member.summary: Main wrapper for all the distributed temperature survey information about the installed system. Note that this can serve as a standalone object for messages that are not part of the WITSML server architecture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystemList.Version
member.summary: Data object schema version. The fourth level must match the version of the schema constraints (enumerations and XML loader files) that are assumed by the document instance.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo
member.summary: A schema to capture a set of data that is relevant for many exchange documents. It includes information about the file that was created, and high-level information about the data that is being exchanged within the file.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentName
member.summary: An identifier for the document. This is intended to be unique within the context of the NamingSystem.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentAlias
member.summary: Zero or more alternate names for the document. These names do not need to be unique within the naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentDate
member.summary: The date of the creation of the document. This is not the same as the date that the file was created. For this date, the document is considered to be the set of information associated with this document information. For example, the document may be a seismic binset. This represents the date that the binset was created. The FileCreation information would capture the date that the XML file was created to send or exchange the binset.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentClass
member.summary: A document class. Examples of classes would be a metadata classification or a set of keywords.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.FileCreationInformation
member.summary: The information about the creation of the exchange file. This is not about the creation of the data within the file, but the creation of the file itself.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.SecurityInformation
member.summary: Information about the security to be applied to this file. More than one classification can be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Disclaimer
member.summary: A free-form string that allows a disclaimer to accompany the information.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.AuditTrail
member.summary: A collection of events that can document the history of the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Owner
member.summary: The owner of the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.QueryPluggedAndAbandonedram
member.summary: WITSML query parameters.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Comment
member.summary: An optional comment about the document.

member.summary: condensate volumes measured during the well test.

member.summary: Condensate rates measured during the well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.GasOilRatio
member.summary: The ratio of the volume of gas and the volume of oil that was produced.

member.summary: The ratio of water produced compared to the volume of total liquids produced.

member.summary: The density of the fluid mixture.

member.summary: The velocity of the overall fluid mixture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.CondensateYield
member.summary: This is the condensate yield, which describes the amount of condensate per unit of natural gas produced

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.BasicSedimentAndWater
member.summary: This is the measured of impurities present in crude oil as it comes from the well. BSandW content is commonly used as a measure for treating performance of hydrocarbon liquids

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.OilPotential
member.summary: This is the the potential of the well to produce crude oil. This represents the flow rate that could be achieved under maximum drawdown.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.GasPotential
member.summary: This is the potential of the well to produce natural gas. This represents the flow rate that could be achieved under maximum drawdown.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.SandVolume
member.summary: the volume of sand that was produced.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.AllocatedSplit
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that the the split factors are allocated as opposed to measured. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates otherwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.OilSplitFactor

member.summary: The split factor for Condensate relative to the overall volume of the test.

member.summary: The temperature measured at the separator during the well test.

member.summary: The pressure at the point.

member.summary: The temperature at the point.

member.summary: The P/Z value at the point. This is P/Z, pressure over gas compressibility factor (z). Note that the uom is units of pressure., since Z is dimensionless.

member.summary: The measured depth of the bottomhole.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.Wellbore
member.summary: Defines the wellbore (sidetract) represented by the measured depth. This must be given when the well has multiple wellbores and the measured depth value is deeper than the first kickoff point. It is recommended that it always be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.Bottomhole
member.summary: A value of true (1 or "true") indicates that the point is at the bottomhole. A value of false (0 or "false") or not given indicates otherwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.Static
member.summary: A value of true (1 or "true") indicates a static (non-flowing) pressure. A value of false (0 or "false") or not given indicates otherwise. The pressure may be measured (e.g., shut-in well) or calculated.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestElectricSubmersiblePumpData

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestElectricSubmersiblePumpData.ElectricCurrent
member.summary: The average electric current of the electric submersible pump (ESP) during the test. The presumption is that only one pump per well is operational during each test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellTestElectricSubmersiblePumpData.Frequency
member.summary: The average frequency of the electric submersible pump (ESP) during the test. The presumption is that only one pump per well is operational during each test.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest
member.summary: The non-contextual content of a WITSML Well Test object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.NameWell
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The minimum time index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. That is, all wellTest for a well in the specified period defined by the min/max. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The maximum time index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.DateTimeCurrent
member.summary: The definition of the "current time" index for this object. The current time index is a server query parameter which requests the selection of a single node from a recurring set (e.g., the data related to one point in a time series). That is, the "most recent" (at or before the specified time) wellTest for a well. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.WellContext
member.summary: Contextual data about the well that was tested.

member.summary: The date-time of well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.PreviousTestDate
member.summary: The date-time of the previous well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.LastValidTest
member.summary: The date-time of the last valid well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.TestReason
member.summary: The reason for the well test: initial, periodic, revision.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.TestType
member.summary: The type of well production test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.ChokeOrificeSize
member.summary: DEPRECATED: use productionTest/wellheadData/chokeOrificeSize or injectionTest/chokeOrificeSize. The size of the opening in the flow choke at the wellhead.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.ProductFlowPort
member.summary: A port on a Product Flow Unit that is represented by this test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.ProductFlowUnit
member.summary: The Product Flow Unit represented by the port. This is defined within the Product Flow Model

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.ProductFlowModel
member.summary: The Product Flow Model that represents the above Product Flow Unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.StandardTempPres
member.summary: Defines the standard temperature and pressure to which all standard volumes in this report have been corrected. This applies to all elements whose name is suffixed by StdTempPres.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.ValidationState
member.summary: The overall state of the test with respect to validation operations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.ValidationOperatingeration
member.summary: Defines the results of one validation operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.ProductionTest
member.summary: Data from a production test. Multiple tests generally indicate that there are multiple components of a single overall test. For example, for multi-zoned wells.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.InjectionTest
member.summary: Data from an injection test. Multiple tests generally indicate that there are multiple components of the overall test. For example, for multi-zoned wells.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.FluidLevelTest
member.summary: Data from a fluid level test.

member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.WellTest.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQualifiedDateTime
member.summary: This class represents the endpointQualifiedDateTime xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQualifiedDateTime.EndpointSurrogate
member.summary: The default is "inclusive".

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellContext
member.summary: Within the context of a WITSML Server, this data should duplicate the equivalent information in the well object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.Field
member.summary: Name of the field in which the well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.WellAlias
member.summary: An alias name associated with the well. If the wellName is associated with a naming system then it should be included in this list.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.WellDatum
member.summary: A datum to which elevations and depths are referenced.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.FluidWell
member.summary: POSC well fluid. The type of fluid being produced from or injected into a well facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.DirectionWell
member.summary: POSC well direction. The direction of flow of the fluids in a well facility (generally, injected or produced, or some combination).

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum
member.summary: Defines the vertical datums associated with elevation, vertical depth and measured depth coordinates within the context of a well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Name
member.summary: The human understandable contextual name of the reference datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Code
member.summary: The code value that represents the type of reference datum. This may represent a point on a device (e.g., kelly bushing) or it may represent a vertical reference datum (e.g., mean sea level).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DatumName
member.summary: The name of the vertical reference datum in a particular naming system. This should only be specified if the above 'code' represents some variation of sea level. An optional short name (code) can also be specified. Specifying a well known datum is highly desired if the above code is a variant of sea level because sea level varies over time and space. An example would be to specify a name of 'Caspian Sea' with a code of '5106' in the 'EPSG' naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DatumCRS
member.summary: A reference to the coordinateReferenceSystem object representing the vertical reference datum (i.e., this wellDatum). This should only be specified if the above 'code' represents some variation of sea level.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Kind
member.summary: Since various activities may use different points as measurement datums, it is useful to characterize the point based on its usage. A well reference datum may have more than one such characterization. For example, it may be the datum used by the driller and logger for measuring their depths. Example usage values would be 'permanent','driller', 'logger' 'WRP' (well reference point) and 'SRP' (site reference point).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Wellbore
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the reference datum. This should be specified if a measured depth is given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Rig
member.summary: A pointer to the rig that contains the device used as a reference datum. The rig may be associated with a wellbore in another well (e.g., pattern drilling using a rig on a track).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Elevation
member.summary: The gravity based elevation coordinate of this reference datum as measured from another datum. Positive moving upward from the elevation datum. An elevation should be given unless this is a vertical reference datum (e.g., sea level).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.MeasuredDepth
member.summary: The measured depth coordinate of this reference datum as measured from another datum. The measured depth datum should either be the same as the elevation datum or it should be relatable to the elevation datum through other datums. Positive moving toward the bottomhole from the measured depth datum. This should be given when a local reference is "downhole", such as a kickoff point or ocean bottom template, and the borehole may not be vertical. If a Depth is given then an Elevation should also be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.HorizontalLocation
member.summary: The horizontal location of the point being used as a well datum. This may be used when the point is not directly above or below the well point location. For example, a well being drilled from a platform may have its location at the entrance into the sea floor, while the well datum may be located on the drilling rig. Or the well datum may be a kickoff point, that is not directly under the well surface point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Comment
member.summary: A contextual description of the well reference datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultMeasuredDepth
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for measured depth coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Measured depth coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to this default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default measured depth datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultVerticalDepth
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for vertical depth coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Vertical depth coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to the default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default vertical depth datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultElevation
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for elevation coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Elevation coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to the default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default elevation datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct
member.summary: This class represents the wellKnownNameStruct xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct.NamingSystem
member.summary: The naming system within the name is unique.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct.Code
member.summary: A unique (short) code associated with the name.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore
member.summary: Data that represents a foreign key to a wellbore. The wellbore may be defined within the context of another well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore.WellboreReference
member.summary: A pointer the wellbore with which there is a relationship.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore.WellPluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the well that contains the wellboreReference. This is not needed unless the referenced wellbore is outside the context of a common parent well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig
member.summary: A reference to a rig within a wellbore. The wellbore may be defined within the context of another well. This value represents a foreign key from one node to another.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.RigReference
member.summary: A pointer to the rig with which there is a relationship.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.WellborePluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the rigReference. This is not needed unless the referenced rig is outside the context of a common parent wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.WellPluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the well that contains the wellboreParent. This is not needed unless the referenced wellbore is outside the context of a common parent well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location
member.summary: WITSML Location Component Schema This is a location that is expressed in terms of 2D coordinates. In order that the location be understood, the coordinate reference system (CRS) must be known. The survey location is given by a pair of tagged values. The pairs may be: (1) latitude/longitude, (2) easting/northing, (3) westing/southing, (4) projectedX/projectedY, or (5) localX/localY. The appropriate pair must be chosen for the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.WellCRS
member.summary: A pointer to the wellCRS that defines the CRS for the coordinates. While optional, it is strongly recommended that this be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude with north being positive. If you set this property, you must also set Longitude.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude with east being positive. If you set this property, you must also set Latitude.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.Easting
member.summary: The projected coordinate with east being positive. This is the most common type of projected coordinates. UTM coordinates are expressed in Easting and Northing. If you set this property, you must also set Northing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.Northing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with north being positive. This is the most common type of projected coordinates. UTM coordinates are expressed in Easting and Northing. If you set this property, you must also set Easting.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.Westing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with west being positive. The positive directions are reversed from the usual Easting and Northing values. These values are generally located in the southern hemisphere, most notably in South Africa and Australia. If you set this property, you must also set Southing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.Southing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with south being positive. The positive directions are reversed from the usual Easting and Northing values. These values are generally located in the southern hemisphere, most notably in South Africa and Australia. If you set this property, you must also set Westing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.ProjectedX
member.summary: The projected X coordinate with the positive direction unknown. ProjectedX and ProjectedY are used when it is not known what the meaning of the coordinates is. If the meaning is known, the Easting/Northing or Westing/Southing should be used. Use of this pair implies a lack of knowledge on the part of the sender. If you set this property, you must also set ProjectedY.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.ProjectedY
member.summary: The projected Y coordinate with the positive direction unknown. ProjectedX and ProjectedY are used when it is not known what the meaning of the coordinates is. If the meaning is known, the Easting/Northing or Westing/Southing should be used. Use of this pair implies a lack of knowledge on the part of the sender. If you set this property, you must also set ProjectedX.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.LocalX
member.summary: The local (engineering) X coordinate. The CRS will define the orientation of the axis. If you set this property, you must also set LocalY.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.LocalY
member.summary: The local (engineering) Y coordinate. The CRS will define the orientation of the axis. If you set this property, you must also set LocalX.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.Original
member.summary: Flag indicating (if "true" or "1") that this pair of values was the original data given for the location. If the pair of values was calculated from an original pair of values, this flag should be "false" (or "0"), or not present.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.Description
member.summary: A Comment, generally given to help the reader interpret the coordinates if the CRS and the chosen pair do not make them clear.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Location.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: WITSML - Extension values Schema. The intent is to allow standard WITSML "named" extensions without having to modify the schema. A client or server can ignore any name that it does not recognize but certain meta data is required in order to allow generic clients or servers to process the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Name
member.summary: The name of the extension. Each standard name should document the expected measure class. Each standard name should document the expected maximum size. For numeric values the size should be in terms of xsd types such as int, long, short, byte, float or double. For strings, the maximum length should be defined in number of characters. Local extensions to the list of standard names are allowed but it is strongly recommended that the names and definitions be approved by the WITSML SIG Technical Team before use.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Value
member.summary: The value of the extension. This may also include a uom attribute. The content should conform to constraints defined by the data type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.DataType
member.summary: The underlying XML type of the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.DateTime
member.summary: The date-time associated with the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.MD
member.summary: The measured depth associated with the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Index
member.summary: Indexes things with the same name. That is, 1 indicates the first one, 2 incidates the second one, etc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.MeasureClass
member.summary: The kind of the measure. For example, "length". This should be specified if the value requires a unit of measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the extension.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Extensionvalue
member.summary: This class represents the extensionvalue xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.Extensionvalue.Uom
member.summary: The unit of measure for the value. This value must conform to the values allowed by a measure class.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData
member.summary: WITSML - Common Data Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.SourceName
member.summary: An identifier to indicate the data originator. This identifies the server that originally created the object and thus most of the uids in the object (but not necessarily the uids of the parents). This is typically a url.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.DateTimeCreation
member.summary: When the data was created at the persistent data store. In a query template, a specified value will be interpreted by the server as a request for dTimCreation values that are greater-than the specified value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.DateTimeLastChange
member.summary: Last change of any element of the data at the persistent data store. The change time is not updated for a growing object while it is growing. In a query template, a specified value will be interpreted by the server as a request for dTimLastChange values that are greater-than the specified value. The dTimLastChange value may be changed by a client (user).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ItemState
member.summary: The item state for the data object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ServiceCategory
member.summary: The category of the service related to the creation of the object. For example, "mud log service", "cement service", "LWD service", "rig service", "drilling service". REALTIME STORE UNIQUE KEY: When accessed via the Store Interface, for each instance of realtime, the combination of "uidWell", "uidWellbore", "idSub" and commonData's "serviceCategory" must be unique. That is, the Store Interface will only retain one realtime for a particular wellbore, subscription and service with the REALTIME STORE UNIQUE KEY being the object selector.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.Comments
member.summary: Comments and remarks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.AcquisitionTimeZone
member.summary: The local time zone of the original acquisition date-time values. It is the deviation in hours and minutes from UTC. The first occurrence should be the actual local time zone at the start of acquisition and may represent a seasonally adjusted value such as daylight savings. The dTim attribute must be populated in the second and subsequent occurrences if the local time zone changes during acquisition. This knowledge is required because the original time zone in a dateTime value may be lost when software converts to a different time zone.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ExtensionAny
member.summary: Extensions to the schema using an xsd:any construct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TimestampedTimeZone
member.summary: This class represents the timestampedTimeZone xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TimestampedTimeZone.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time when this local time zone became active. This value must be defined on the second and subsequent occurrences.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionAny
member.summary: WITSML - Extension Schema. The intent is to allow standard WITSML schema extensions which will validate in older clients or servers. A client or server can ignore any schema that it does not recognize. New versions will modify specific elements to replace this type with a type that adds new elements, including another element with this type.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CustomData
member.summary: This class represents the cs_customData xsd type.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQuantity
member.summary: This class represents the endpointQuantity xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQuantity.EndpointSurrogate
member.summary: Defines the semantics (inclusive or exclusive) of the endpoint within the context of the interval.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesThreshold
member.summary: Defines a value threshold window and the cumulative time duration that the data was within that window.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesThreshold.ThresholdMinimum
member.summary: The lower bound of the threshold for testing whether values are within a specific range. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value. At least one of minimumValue and maximumValue must be specified. The thresholdMinimum must be less than thresholdMaximum. If thresholdMinimum is not specified then the minimum shall be assumed to be minus infinity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesThreshold.ThresholdMaximum
member.summary: The upper bound of the threshold for testing whether values are within a specific range. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value. At least one of minimumValue and maximumValue must be specified. The thresholdMaximum must be greater than thresholdMinimum. If thresholdMaximum is not specified then the maximum shall be assumed to be plus infinity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesThreshold.Duration
member.summary: The sum of the time intervals over the range of dTimMin to dTimMax during which the values were within the specified threshold range.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.EndpointDateTime
member.summary: This class represents the endpointDateTime xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.EndpointDateTime.EndpointSurrogate
member.summary: Defines the semantics (inclusive or exclusive) of the endpoint within the context of the interval.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic
member.summary: The non-contextual content of WITSML statistics about a range of time series data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the time series.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Key
member.summary: A keyword value pair which characterizes the underlying nature of this value. The key value may provide part of the unique identity of an instance of a concept or it may characterize the underlying concept. The key value will be defined within the specified keyword naming system. This is essentially a classification of the data in the specified system (keyword).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Unit
member.summary: If the time series is a measure then this specifies the unit of measure. The unit acronym must be chosen from the list that is valid for the measure class. If this is specified then the measure class must be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.MeasureClass
member.summary: Defines the type of measure that the time series represents. If this is specified then unit must be specified. This may be redundant to some information in the keys but it is important for allowing an application to understand the nature of a measure value even if it does not understand all of the underlying nature.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Comment
member.summary: A comment about the time series.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The lower bound of the analyzed time range. Only data within the range was included in the analysis. The endpoint attribute specifies whether the data was inclusive or exclusive of this point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The upper bound of the analyzed time range. Only data within the range was included in the analysis. The endpoint attribute specifies whether the data was inclusive or exclusive of this point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum value within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum value within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Sum
member.summary: The sum of all values within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Mean
member.summary: The arithmetic mean (sum divided by count) of all values within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.Median
member.summary: The median value of all values within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.StandardDeviation
member.summary: The standard deviation of all values within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.TimeAtThreshold
member.summary: Defines a value threshold window and the time duration where values (within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax) were within that window.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatistic.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.KeywordValueStruct
member.summary: This class represents the keywordValueStruct xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.KeywordValueStruct.KeywordSurrogate
member.summary: The keyword within which the value is unique. The concept of a keyword is very close to the concept of a classification system.

member.summary: This class represents the timeSeriesStringSample xsd type.

member.summary: The date and time at which the value applies. If no time is specified then the value is static and only one sample can be defined. Either dTime or value or both must be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesStringSample.StatusSurrogate
member.summary: An indicator of the quality of the value.

member.summary: The date and time at which the value applies. If no time is specified then the value is static and only one sample can be defined. Either dTime or value or both must be specified.

member.summary: An indicator of the quality of the value.

member.summary: Captures information about an event related to a product balance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceEvent.Date
member.summary: The date of the event.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceEvent.Kind
member.summary: The kind of event.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceEvent.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Balance Detail Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.Owner
member.summary: A pointer to the business unit which owns the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.SourceUnit
member.summary: Points to the business unit from which the product originated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.Share
member.summary: The owner's share of the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.AccountNumber
member.summary: An account identifier for the balance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.Event
member.summary: A dated event related to the balance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.VolumeValue
member.summary: The volume of the fluid, possibly corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure. Different volumes may be defined at different conditions but they should all represent the same mass of material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.SampleAnalysisResult
member.summary: A pointer to a fluid sample analysis result object that is relevant to the balance. This sample may have been acquired previous to or after this period and is used for determining the allocated characteristics.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.ComponentContent
member.summary: The relative amount of a component product in the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue
member.summary: A possibly temperature and pressure corrected volume value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.Volume
member.summary: The volume of the product. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.GrossCAlorificValue
member.summary: The amount of heat which would be released by the complete combustion in air of the above volume of product. This is considered to be a condition of measurement (i.e., the volume may have been converted to this condition).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.Temp
member.summary: The temperature to which the volume has been corrected. If given, then a pressure must also be given. Common standard temperatures are: 0 degC, 15 degC, 60 degF. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Pres.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.Pres
member.summary: The pressure to which the volume has been corrected. If given, then a temperature must also be given. Common standard pressures are: 1 atm and 14.696 psi (which are equivalent). If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Temp.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.StandardTempPres
member.summary: Defines the standard temperature and pressure to which the volume has been corrected. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the procuctVolume root.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeComponentContent
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Component Content Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeComponentContent.Kind
member.summary: The type of product whose relative content is being described. This should be a specific component (e.g., water) rather than a phase (e.g., aqueous).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeComponentContent.ReferenceKind
member.summary: The type of product to which the product is being compared. If not given then the product is being compared against the overall flow stream.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeComponentContent.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue
member.summary: A possibly temperature and pressure corrected flow rate value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.FlowRate
member.summary: The flow rate of the product. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.Temp
member.summary: The temperature to which the flowRate has been corrected. If given, then a pressure must also be given. Common standard temperatures are: 0 degC, 15 degC, 60 degF. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Pres.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.Pres
member.summary: The pressure to which the flowRate has been corrected. If given, then a temperature must also be given. Common standard pressures are: 1 atm and 14.696 psi (which are equivalent). If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Temp.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.StandardTempPres
member.summary: Defines the standard temperature and pressure to which the flowRate has been corrected. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the procuctVolume root.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference
member.summary: This class represents the cs_productVolumePortDifference xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.Port
member.summary: A port on the other end of an internal connection. This should always be specified if a Product Flow Network is being referenced by this report. If this is not specified then there is an assumption that there is only one other port for the unit. For example, if this end of the connection represents an inlet port then the implied other end is the outlet port for the unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.PresDiff
member.summary: The differential pressure between the ports.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.TempDiff
member.summary: The differential temperature between the ports.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.ChokeSize
member.summary: The size of the choke. This characterizes the overall unit with respect to the flow restriction between the ports. The restriction might be implemented using a valve or an actual choke.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.ChokeRelative
member.summary: The relative size of the choke restriction. This characterizes the overall unit with respect to the flow restriction between the ports. The restriction might be implemented using a valve or an actual choke.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DensityValue
member.summary: A possibly temperature and pressure corrected desity value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DensityValue.Density
member.summary: The density of the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DensityValue.Temp
member.summary: The temperature to which the density has been corrected. If given, then a pressure must also be given. Common standard temperatures are: 0 degC, 15 degC, 60 degF. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Pres.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DensityValue.Pres
member.summary: The pressure to which the density has been corrected. If given, then a temperature must also be given. Common standard pressures are: 1 atm and 14.696 psi (which are equivalent). If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Temp.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DensityValue.StandardTempPres
member.summary: Defines the standard temperature and pressure to which the density has been corrected. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the procuctVolume root.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DensityValue.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.summary: The name of the destination.

member.summary: The type of destination.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeDestination.Country

member.summary: A cargo identifier for the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceSet.CArgoBatchNumber
member.summary: A cargo batch number. Used if the vessel needs to temporarily disconnect for some reason (e.g., weather).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceSet.Shipper
member.summary: The name of the shipper

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceSet.Destination
member.summary: Defines the destination of the product.

member.summary: Provides details on the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.Kind
member.summary: The type of period that is being reported. If not specified and a time is not given then the period is defined by the reporting period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateTimeStart
member.summary: The beginning date and time that the period represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateTimeEnd.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The ending date and time that the period represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateTimeStart.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateStart
member.summary: The beginning date that the period represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateEnd.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateEnd
member.summary: The ending date that the period represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateStart.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.Date
member.summary: The day that the period represents.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateTime
member.summary: The beginning date and time that the period represents.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.ComponentContent
member.summary: The relative amount of a component product in the product stream.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.BalanceSet
member.summary: Provides the sales context for this period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.Alert
member.summary: An indication of some sort of abnormal condition relative the values in this period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.Comment
member.summary: A timestamped remark about the amounts.

member.summary: An XPATH to the target value within the message containing this XPATH value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeAlert.Level
member.summary: The level of the alert.

member.summary: The type of alert. For example "off specification".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeAlert.Description
member.summary: A textual decription of the alert.

member.summary: The role of the person providing the comment. This is the role of the person within the context of comment.

member.summary: The date and time where the comment begins to be valid.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DatedComment.Remark
member.summary: The relevant comment.

member.summary: This class represents the cs_refProductFlow xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefProductFlow.ReferencedFlow
member.summary: A pointer to the flow within the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.RefProductFlow.PluggedAndAbandonedrentfacility
member.summary: A pointer to the facility that contains the flow.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Product Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.Kind
member.summary: The type of product that is being reported.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.Name
member.summary: The name of product that is being reported. This is reserved for generic kinds like chemical.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.SplitFactor
member.summary: This factor describes the fraction of fluid in the source flow that is allocated to this product stream. The volumes reported here are derived from the source flow based on this split factor. This should be an allocation flow.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.SourceFlow
member.summary: A reference to the source flow whose volumes are used to determine the volumes within this target product stream based on the split factor.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.ComponentContent
member.summary: The relative amount of a component product in the product stream.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.Period
member.summary: Product amounts for a specific period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.Comment
member.summary: A (possibly timstamped) remark about the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility
member.summary: WITSML - Report Facility Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Name
member.summary: The name of the facility. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This can also define the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent1
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent2
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility of parent1. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Kind
member.summary: A kind of facility where the specific name is not relevant.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Port
member.summary: The Product Flow Port associated with the Product Flow Unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Unit
member.summary: The Product Flow Unit representing the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Network
member.summary: The Product Flow Network representing the facility. This is only required if the network is not the same as the primary network that represents the Product Flow Model. This must be unique within the context of the Product Flow Model represented by this report.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FacilityIdentifierStruct
member.summary: This class represents the facilityIdentifierStruct xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FacilityIdentifierStruct.KindSurrogate
member.summary: The kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FacilityIdentifierStruct.NamingSystem
member.summary: The naming system within which the name is unique. For example, API or NPD.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.FacilityIdentifierStruct.UidRef
member.summary: If the facility is defined and instantiated within the context of a WITSML server, this is a pointer to the uid value of that object instance.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Flow Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Name
member.summary: The name of this flow within the context of this report. This might reflect some combination of the kind of flow, port, qualifier and related facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Kind
member.summary: Indicates the type of flow that is being reported. The type of flow is an indication of the overall source or target of the flow. A production flow has one or more wells as the originating source. An injection flow has one or more wells as the ultimate target. An import flow has an offsite source. An export flow has an offiste target. A consumption flow generally has a kind of equipment as a target.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Port
member.summary: The Product Flow Port to which the flow is assigned. This is the port on the Product Flow Unit that represents the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Direction
member.summary: The kind of port that this flow represents: inlet or outlet.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Facility
member.summary: The name of the facility represented by the port where the measurements were taken. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.FacilityAlias
member.summary: An alternatative name of a facility represented by the port. This is generally unique within a naming system. The above contextually unique name (that is, within the context of a parent) should also be listed as an alias.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Qualifier
member.summary: Qualifies the type of flow that is being reported.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.SubQualifier
member.summary: Defines a specialization of the qualifier value. This should only be given if a qualifier is given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.RelatedFacility
member.summary: A second facility related to this flow. For a production flow, this would represent a role of 'produced for'. For an import flow, this would represent a role of 'inport from'. For an export flow, this would represent a role of 'export to'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Version
member.summary: A timestamp representing the version of this data. A flow (same port and products) with a more recent timestamp will represent the "current" version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.VersionSource
member.summary: Identifies the source of the version. This will commonly be the name of the software which created the version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.SourceFlow
member.summary: This is a pointer to the flow from which this flow was derived.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Product
member.summary: Reports a product flow stream.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Comment
member.summary: A timestamped remark about the flow.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.IntegerQualifiedCount
member.summary: This class represents the integerQualifiedCount xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.IntegerQualifiedCount.StatusSurrogate
member.summary: An indicator of the quality of the value.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.KindQualifiedString
member.summary: This class represents the kindQualifiedString xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.KindQualifiedString.StatusSurrogate
member.summary: An indicator of the quality of the value.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveData
member.summary: This class represents the cs_curveData xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveData.Index
member.summary: The value of an independent (index) variable in a row of the curve table. The units of measure are specified in the curve definition. The first value corresponds to order=1 for colums where isIndex is true. The second to order=2. And so on. The number of index and data values must match the number of columns in the table.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveData.Value
member.summary: The value of a dependent (data) variable in a row of the curve table. The units of measure are specified in the curve definition. The first value corresponds to order=1 for columns where isIndex is false. The second to order=2. And so on. The number of index and data values must match the number of columns in the table.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue
member.summary: WITSML - Parameter Value Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time at which the parameter applies. If no time is specified then the value is static.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The date and time at which the parameter no longer applies. The "active" time interval is inclusive of this point. If dTimEnd is given then dTim shall also be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.MeasureValue
member.summary: A measure value. Unless the parameter is defined as a tuple, only one value should be specified. The measure class is defined by measureClass in the parent set. The unit of measure must conform to the units allowed by the measure class in the unit dictionary file. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.IntegerValue
member.summary: An integer value. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.StringValue
member.summary: A string value. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.CurveValue
member.summary: The values in one row of a curve. The aggregate of the curve rows represent the curve.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.Port
member.summary: A port related to the parameter. If a port is given then the corresponding unit usually must be given. For example, an "offset along network" parameter must specify a port from which the offset was measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.Unit
member.summary: A unit related to the parameter. For example, an "offset along network" parameter must specify a port (on a unit) from which the offset was measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.Alert
member.summary: An indication of some sort of abnormal condition relative this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition
member.summary: The definition of a curve.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.Order
member.summary: The order of the value in the index or data tuple. If isIndex is true this is the order of the (independent) index element. If isIndex is false, this is the order of the (dependent) value element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: The name of the variable in this curve.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.IsIndex
member.summary: True (equal "1" or "true") indicates that this is an independent variable in this curve. At least one column column should be flagged as independent.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.MeasureClass
member.summary: The measure class of the variable. This defines which units of measure are valid for the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.Unit
member.summary: The unit of measure of the variable. The unit of measure must match a unit allowed by the measure class.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Facility Parameter Set Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Name
member.summary: The name of the facility parameter. This should reflect the business semantics of all values in the set and not the underlying kind. For example, specify "diameter" rather than "length" or "distance".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Port
member.summary: The port to which this parameter is assigned. This must be a port on the unit representing the parent facility of this parameter. If not specified then the parameter represents the unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.MeasureClass
member.summary: If the value is a measure (value with unit of measure), this defines the measurement class of the value. The units of measure for the value must conform to the list allowed by the measurement class in the unit dictionary file. Mutually exclusive with curveDefinition.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.CurveDefinition
member.summary: If the value is a curve, this defines the meaning of the one column in the table representing the curve. Mutually exclusive with measureClass.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Qualifier
member.summary: Qualifies the type of parameter that is being reported.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.SubQualifier
member.summary: Defines a specialization of the qualifier value. This should only be given if a qualifier is given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Version
member.summary: A timestamp representing the version of this data. A parameter set with a more recent timestamp will represent the "current" version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.VersionSource
member.summary: Identifies the source of the version. This will commonly be the name of the software which created the version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Product
member.summary: The type of product that is being reported. This would be useful for something like specifying a tank procuct volume or level.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: A parameter value, possibly at a time. If a time is not given then only one parameter should be given. If a time is specified with one value then time should be specified for all values. Each value in a time series should be of the same underling kind of value (for example, a length measure).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Comment
member.summary: A comment about the parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility
member.summary: WITSML - Report Facility Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Name
member.summary: The name of the facility. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent1
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility. For example, if name represents a completion, then facilityParent1 would represent the name of the well within which name was unique. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent2
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility of parent1. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.FacilityAlias
member.summary: An alternatative name of a facility. This is generally unique within a naming system. The above contextually unique name (that is, within the context of a parent) should also be listed as an alias.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Unit
member.summary: The Product Flow Unit representing the facility. This must be unique within the context of the Product Flow Network.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Network
member.summary: The Product Flow Network representing the facility. This can only be given if unit is given. This is only required if the network is not the same as the primary network that represents the Product Flow Model. This must be unique within the context of the Product Flow Model represented by this report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.ContextFacility
member.summary: The name and type of a facility whose context is relevant to this facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.StatusWell
member.summary: The status of the well. In PRODML, the value of "active -- injecting" has been DEPRECATED. Instead, use "active" with wellProducing=true. In PRODML, the value of "active -- producing" has been DEPRECATED. Instead, use "active" with wellInjecting=true.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.FluidWell
member.summary: POSC well fluid. The type of fluid being produced from or injected into a well facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.OperatingMethod
member.summary: The lift method being used to operate the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.WellProducing
member.summary: True (or 1) indicates that the well is producing. False (or 0) or not given indicates that the well is not producing. This only applies if the facility is a well or wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.WellInjecting
member.summary: True (or 1) indicates that the well is injecting. False (or 0) or not given indicates that the well is not injecting. This only applies if the facility is a well or wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Capacity
member.summary: The storage capacity of the facility (e.g., a tank).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.OperatingerationTime
member.summary: The amount of time that the facility was active during the reporting period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.DowntimeReason
member.summary: The reason for any down time during the reporting period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.PluggedAndAbandonedrameterSet
member.summary: Usage values for one parameter associated with the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Flow
member.summary: Reports a flow of a product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Comment
member.summary: A timestamped remark about the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.
