member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsCalibration
member.summary: Calibration parameters vary from vendor to vendor, depending on the calibration method being used. This is a general type that allows a calibration date, business associate, and many name/value pairs.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsCalibration.DateTimeCAlibration
member.summary: The date of the calibration

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsCalibration.CalibratedBy
member.summary: The business associate that performed the calibration.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsCalibration.CAlibrationProtocol
member.summary: This may be a standard protocol, or a software application.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsCalibration.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: Attribute name is the name of the parameter. Optional attribute uom is the unit of measure of the parameter. The value of the element is the value of the parameter. Note that a string value may appear as a parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsCalibration.Remarks
member.summary: Any remarks that may be useful, regarding the calibration information.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsCalibration.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss
member.summary: The The power loss for one way travel of a beam of light, usually measured in decibels per unit length. It is necessary to include both the value (and its unit) and the wavelength. The wavelength varies with the refractive index, while the frequency remains constant. The wavelength given to specify this type is the wavelength in a vacuum (refractive index = 1).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss.Value
member.summary: The value of the one way loss per unit of length. The usual uom is decibels per kilometre (dB/km), although this might vary depending on the calibration method used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency (and uom) for which the one-way loss is measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss.Wavelength
member.summary: The wavelength (and uom) for which the one-way loss is measured. The reported wavelength should be the wavelength of the light in a vacuum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex
member.summary: The refractive index of a material depends on the frequency or wavelength of the light. Hence it is necessary to include both the value (a unitless number) and the frequency or wavelength. The frequency will be a quantity type with a frequency unit, such as Hz, kHz, or MHz. The wavelength will be a quantity type with a length unit, such as m, cm, um, in, or ft.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex.Value
member.summary: The value of the refractive index.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency (and uom) for which the refractive index is measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex.Wavelength
member.summary: The wavelength (and uom) for which the refractive index is measured. The reported wavelength should be the wavelength of the light in a vacuum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TypeOptionalClassString
member.summary: This class represents the typeOptionalClassString xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.TypeOptionalClassString.ClassType
member.summary: This identifies the classification system to which the class belongs.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber
member.summary: The optical fiber used for distributed temperature surveys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Name
member.summary: A human understandable name for the fiber. This is used for identification of the instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Mode
member.summary: The mode of fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Type
member.summary: Zero or more instances that allow other classifications to be assigned to the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Coating
member.summary: The type of coating on the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Jacket
member.summary: The type of jacket covering the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.CoreDiameter
member.summary: The inner diameter of the core, generally measured in microns (um).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.CladdedDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the core plus the cladding, generally measured in microns (um).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.OutsideDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the cable and all its sheathing, generally measured in microns (um). This is intended to be the diameter of the cable on the spool.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.RefractiveIndex
member.summary: The refractive index of the fiber. Also included is the frequency in Hz for which this refractive index is valid. There may be multiple instances of this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.OneWayLoss
member.summary: The power loss (usually in decibels) per unit of length of the fiber. Also included is the frequency for which this loss is measured. There ay be multiple instances of this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: Additional parameters to define the fiber as a material. These should not be parameters to define the installation of the fiber in a well, or other system. This element should be used only if an appropriate parameter is not available as an element, or in the calibration operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.SpoolNumberTag
member.summary: The spool number located on the particular spool. The spool number may contain alphanumeric characters.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.SpoolLength
member.summary: The length of the fiber on the spool when purchased.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.SupplyDate
member.summary: A fiber may go through several manufacturers for its various parts. The supplier is the final company in the chain that supplies the fiber to the end user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Supplier
member.summary: A fiber may go through several manufacturers for its various parts. The supplier is the final company in the chain that supplies the fiber to the end user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.SupplierModelNumber
member.summary: The model number (alphanumeric) that is used by the supplier to reference the type of fiber that is supplied to the user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.FactoryCAlibration
member.summary: Information about calibrations and quality checks that were performed on the cable at the factory. This is not to include calibrations that are run at installation time and at measurement time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.InstallationHistory
member.summary: A reference to a dtsInstalledSytem object that previously used the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation
member.summary: The optical fiber used for distributed temperature surveys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.InstallationDate
member.summary: The date the fiber is installed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.InstallationCompany
member.summary: The company that installed the fiber in the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.DeInstallationDate
member.summary: The date the fiber was de-installed from the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.CapillaryTubeDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the capillary tube into which one or more fibers will be installed. If the installation has fibers that go to different wellbores, only those fibers installed in the parent wellbore should be included in this instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.Fiber
member.summary: The properties of the fiber or fibers installed in the wellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQualifiedDate
member.summary: This class represents the endpointQualifiedDate xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQualifiedDate.EndpointSurrogate
member.summary: The default is "inclusive".

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem
member.summary: The optical fiber is installed in a wellbore and attached to an instrument box. Calibrations are performed. In general, this should be a subelement of a DTS object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.NameWell
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.NameWellbore
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore that contains the installed system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the dts.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.DateMin
member.summary: The minimum date index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. That is, all measurements for a well in the specified period defined by the min/max. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.DateMax
member.summary: The maximum date index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.DateCurrent
member.summary: The definition of the "current date" index for this object. The current date index is a server query parameter which requests the selection of a single node from a recurring set (e.g., the data related to one point in a date series). That is, the "most recent" (at or before the specified date) installation for a well. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.WellContext
member.summary: Contextual data about the well in which the system was installed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.IsPlanned
member.summary: Is this a planned installation in a well, or has the installation already occurred. Note that the default value is 'false', which states that this is an actual installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberInformation
member.summary: Information about the fiber used, and its installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.InstrumentBoxInformation
member.summary: Information about the instrument box used, and its installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration of the fiber installation. Example values would be linear, linear with gauge, J, U.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberEndPoint
member.summary: A fiber installed with a "U" configuration will have two ends available for hookup to an instrument box. In order to record which end is cabled to the instrument box on a particular measurement run, it is necessary to identify the two ends. This complex type allows a name and description for each end, so that it may be identified in a later use. This may also be useful when multiple fibers in multiple wellbores converge at the same wellhead.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberLength
member.summary: The length of the fiber installed in the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.WellboreFiberSchematic
member.summary: A table of values along the length along the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.OperatingticalBudget
member.summary: Total light budget available for the installation. This is generally measured in decibels, and indicates the total power loss for two-way travel of the light in the installed fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.PumpActivity
member.summary: The activity of pumping the fiber downhole

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.OtdrInstallationTest
member.summary: This captures the data from the pre-installation and post-installation OTDR tests run on the fiber. A standard quality control program would include these two, but the schema allows for more than two if additional runs associated with the installation of the fiber are performed. OTDR runs associated with a measurement are given as a child of the measurementInformation element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.InstallationCAlibration
member.summary: Any calibration other than the ones explicitly given may be recorded here. This is a general calibration type, which is populated with name/value pairs.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.BasedOnInstalledFiber
member.summary: If an instrument box is changed, for example, but the fiber remains the same, this instance of installed fiber is given to record that change. This element refers to a previous installed fiber, on which this one is based. For example, the wellboreFiberSchematic is unchanged, and may be obtained from the previous instance of installed fiber that is referenced here.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.DtsInstalledSystem.UidWellbore
member.summary: Unique identifier for the wellbore. This uniquely represents the wellbore referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfoQueryParam
member.summary: A structure for WITSML query parameters. The intent is to allow a query for all objects within an index range (whether or not the object is growing). These would typically be something like a daily report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfoQueryParam.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The minimum start time for an object. This only applies to objects with a root level date and/or dateTime element(s). The objects may or not be growing objects but the See the API specification for behavior related to this query parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfoQueryParam.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The maximum start time for an object. This only applies to objects with a root level date and/or dateTime element(s). See the API specification for behavior related to this query parameter.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent
member.summary: An event type captures the basic information about an event that has affected the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.EventDate
member.summary: The date on which the event took place.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.EventType
member.summary: The kind of event event.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.ResponsiblePluggedAndAbandonedrty
member.summary: The party responsible for the event.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.Comment
member.summary: A free form comment that can further define the event that occurred.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo
member.summary: Information about the security classification of the document. This is intended as a documentation of the security so that the file will not inadvertently be sent to someone who is not allowed access to the data. This block also carries a date that the security classification expires. For example, a well log is confidential for a period of time, and then becomes open. All security classes are characterized by their classification systems.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.Class
member.summary: The security class in which this document is classified. Examples would be confidential, partner confidential, tight. The meaning of the class is determined by the System in which it is defined.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.SecuritySystem
member.summary: The security classification system. This gives context to the meaning of the Class value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.EndDate
member.summary: The date on which this security class is no longer applicable.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.Comment
member.summary: A general comment to further define the security class.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentFileCreation
member.summary: A block of information about the creation of the XML file. This is different than the creation of the data that is included within the file.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentFileCreation.FileCreationDate
member.summary: The date and time that the file was created.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentFileCreation.SoftwareName
member.summary: If appropriate, the software that created the file. This is a free form string, and may include whatever information is deemed relevant.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentFileCreation.FileCreator
member.summary: The person or business associate that created the file.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ComponentSchemas.DocumentFileCreation.Comment
member.summary: Any comment that would be useful to further explain the creation of this instance document.

member.summary: Information about the XML message instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatisticList.TimeSeriesStatistic
member.summary: Statistics about a single range of time. This is a VIEW of the time series data and represents derived information about that series. As such, it is not persisted and cannot be added, updated or deleted from a persistent server. The statistics view uses the same identity (including uid) as the time series data object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesStatisticList.Version
member.summary: Data object schema version.

member.summary: Data object schema version. The fourth level must match the version of the schema constraints (enumerations and XML loader files) that are assumed by the document instance.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report
member.summary: This class represents the obj_report xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Kind
member.summary: The type of report. This should define and constrain the expected content of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Title
member.summary: The tile of the report if different from the name of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Date
member.summary: The date that the report represents (i.e., not a year or month). Only one of date, month or year should be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.DateEnd
member.summary: The ending date that the report represents if it represents an interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Month
member.summary: The month that the report represents (i.e., not a year, date or date range). Only one of date, month or year should be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Year
member.summary: The year that the report represents (i.e., not a month, date or date range). Only one of date, month or year should be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Comment
member.summary: A textual comment about the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.ReportVersion
member.summary: The current report version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.ReportStatus
member.summary: The current document version status.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Installation
member.summary: The name of the facility which is represented by this report. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.ContextFacility
member.summary: The name and type of a facility whose context is relevant to the represented installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Operator
member.summary: The operator of the facilities in the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.GeographicContext
member.summary: The geographic context of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.IssueDate

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.IssuedBy
member.summary: The person or company that issued the report. This may contain the role of the person or company within the context of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.ApprovalDate
member.summary: The date that the report was approved.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.Approver
member.summary: The person or company that approved the report. This may contain the role of the person or company within the context of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.Report.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.summary: casing flange: A flange affixed to the top of the casing string used to attach production equipment.

member.summary: crown valve

member.summary: derrick floor

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.GL
member.summary: ground level

member.summary: kelly bushing

member.summary: rotary table

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.SF
member.summary: sea floor

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.LAT
member.summary: Lowest Astronomical Tide. The lowest tide level over the duration of the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.SL
member.summary: Mean Sea Level - A tidal datum. The arithmetic mean of hourly heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MHHW
member.summary: Mean Higher High Water - A tidal datum. The average of the higher high water height of each tidal day observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MHW
member.summary: Mean High Water - A tidal datum. The average of all the high water heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MLLW
member.summary: Mean Lower Low Water - A tidal datum. The average of the lower low water height of each tidal day observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years ).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MLW
member.summary: Mean Low Water - A tidal datum. The average of all the low water heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MTL
member.summary: Mean Tide Level - A tidal datum. The arithmetic mean of mean high water and mean low water. Same as half-tide level.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.KO
member.summary: kickoff point

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid
member.summary: This class represents the WellFluid xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid.air
member.summary: This is generally an injected fluid.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid.condensate
member.summary: Liquid hydrocarbons produced with natural gas that are separated from the gas by cooling and various other means. Condensate generally has an API gravity of 50 degrees to 120 degrees and is water white, straw, or bluish in color. It is the liquid recovery from a well classified as a gas well. It is generally dissolved in the gaseous state under reservoir conditions but separates as a liquid either in passing up the hole or at the surface. These hydrocarbons, from associated and nonassociated gas well gas, normally are recovered from lease separators or field facilities by mechanical separation.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid.dry
member.summary: The well facility is classified as a dry well. It has not been, nor will it be used to produce or inject any fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid.gas
member.summary: The well is classified as a gas well, producing or injecting a hydrocarbon gas. The gas is generally methane, but may have a mixture of other gases also.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid.oil
member.summary: The liquid hydrocarbon, generally referred to as crude oil.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid.steam
member.summary: The gaseous state of water. This is generally an injected fluid, but it is possible that some hydrothermal wells produce steam.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid.water
member.summary: The well is classified as a water well without distinguishing between brine or fresh water.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellFluid.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellDirection
member.summary: This class represents the WellDirection xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellDirection.injector
member.summary: The well facility is injecting fluids into the subsurface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellDirection.producer
member.summary: The well facility is producing fluids from the subsurface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellDirection.uncertain
member.summary: The flow direction of the fluids is variable, but not on a regular basis as is the case with the huff-n-puff flow.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellDirection.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ItemState
member.summary: This class represents the ItemState xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ItemState.actual
member.summary: Actual data measured or entered at the well site.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ItemState.model
member.summary: Model data used for "what if" calculations.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ItemState.plan
member.summary: A planned object. That is, one which is expected to be executed in the future.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ItemState.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.ItemsChoiceType8
member.summary: This class represents the ItemsChoiceType8 xsd enumeration.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus
member.summary: This class represents the WellStatus xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.abandoned
member.summary: The status of a facility in which drilling, completion, and production operations have been permanently terminated.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.active
member.summary: For a well to be active, at least one of its wellbores must be active. For a wellbore to be active, at least one of its completions must be actively producing or injecting fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.completed
member.summary: The completion has been installed, but the facility is not yet active. This status is appropriate only before the initial producing or injecting activity.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.drilling
member.summary: The status of a well or wellbore in which drilling operations have begun, but are not yet completed. The status ends when another status becomes appropriate.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.permitted
member.summary: The facility has received regulatory approvel, but drilling has not yet commenced. For a well, it has been spudded. For a subsequent wellbore, the whipstock or similar device has not yet been set.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.proposed
member.summary: The status of a well or wellbore from conception to either regulatory approval or commencement of drilling.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.sold
member.summary: The facility has been sold, so it is no longer appropriate to keep a close internal status value. Status values may be added at later times without changing the sold status.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.suspended
member.summary: Production or injection has been temporarily suspended in a manner that will allow immediate resumption of activities.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.testing
member.summary: The facility operations are suspended while tests are being conducted to determine formation and/or reservoir properties. For example, a drillstem test. This status also includes extended testing.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.tight
member.summary: Information about the status of the well is confidential. This is more explicit than unknown, since it gives the reason that the status value is unknown.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReferenceData.WellStatus.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.RealtimeEnumValue.RealtimeDataType
member.summary: For realtime data, defines the underlying type data associated with this term.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.RealtimeEnumValue.RealtimeMeasureClass
member.summary: For realtime data, defines the measure class associated with the term. This controls the allowed units of measure. If this is specified then the value must be defined with a unit of measure. All measure values inherently have a numeric data type.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueRealtimeType
member.summary: Lithology qualifier types.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueRealtimeType.RealtimeString
member.summary: The value is a string. This is also appropriate for a short list of integer codes (e.g., "1", 2" or "3") or for booleans.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueRealtimeType.RealtimeNumeric
member.summary: The value is a number and fractional component is allowed.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueRealtimeType.RealtimeInteger
member.summary: Specialization of numeric. The value is a whole number. That is, a fractional component is not allowed.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueRealtimeType.RealtimeUnknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueLithoType
member.summary: Lithology qualifier types.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueLithoType.noun
member.summary: Qualifiers which are isolated or spot occurrences suggesting that these components are `included' in a lithology and does not imply a lithology type (for example, a single occurrence of a fossil). A qualifier which is specified as a point value (top=bottom) should be interpreted as representing the noun form.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueLithoType.adjective
member.summary: Qualifiers which are components or attributes of the lithology occurring/prevailing over a depth range, or over the whole lithology; an adjective should be used as a further definition of an existing lithology type (for example, types of cementation or other diagenetic effects would be expressed using adjectives). A qualifier which is specified over a depth range should be interpreted as representing the adjective form.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueLithoType.both
member.summary: A qualifier which can have both adjective and noun forms. If the qualifier is specified either over a depth range then it should be interpreted as representing its adjective form. If the qualifier is specified at a point then it should be interpreted as its noun form.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.EnumValue.EnumValueLithoType.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier
member.summary: The meaning of the endpoint for min/max query parameters on "growing objects".

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of EndpointQualifiers

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier.Inclusive
member.summary: The endpoint of the range is inclusive of the specified range value. That is, a node index value which matches the specified range value is considered to be within the range.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier.Exclusive
member.summary: The endpoint of the range is exclusive of the specified range value. That is, a node index value which matches the specified range value is considered to be outside the range.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier.Extensive
member.summary: The endpoint of the range may be extended to the first encountered value if an exact value match is not found. That is, if a node index value does not match the specified range value then the next smaller value (on minimum end) or larger value (on maximum end) in the index series should be used as the endpoint. Basically, this concept is designed to support interpolation across an undefined point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier.OverlapExtensive
member.summary: The endpoint of the range may be extended to the first encountered value if the interval is overlapped with the index interval. That is, if a node index value does not match the specified range value then the next smaller value (on minimum end) or larger value (on maximum end) in the index series should be used as the endpoint. This concept is designed to select ALL nodes whose index interval overlap with the query range.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.EndpointQualifier.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter
member.summary: Defines kinds of facility parameters.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of FacilityParameters

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.Available
member.summary: Indicates the availablity of the facility. This should be implemented as a string value. A value of "true" indicates that it is available for use. That is, it may be currently shut-down but it can be restarted. A value of "false" indicates that the faility is not available to be used. That is, it cannot be restarted at this time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.AvailableRoom
member.summary: Defines the unoccupied volume of a tank. Zero indicates that the tank is full. This should be implemented as a volume measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.BlockValveStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of a block valve. This should be implemented as a string value. A value of "open" indicates that it is open. A value of "closed" indicates that it is closed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.FacilityUptime
member.summary: The ammount to time the facility was available during the specified period. This should be implemented as an time measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.PumpCountOnline
member.summary: The number of pumps which are active. This should be implemented as an integer value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.ReciprocatingSpeed
member.summary: The reciprocating speed of a device (e.g., motor, compressor). This should be implemented as an anglePerTime measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.RelativeTankLevel
member.summary: Defines the relative level of a tank. Zero indicates empty and 100% indicates full. This should be implemented as a lengthPerLength measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.RelativeValveOpening
member.summary: Indicates the status of a valve. This should be implemented as an areaPerAreaMeasure. A value of 100 % indicates that it is open. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.ValveOpening
member.summary: Indicates the open area of a valve. This should be implemented as an areaMeasure. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.OpeningSize
member.summary: The size of an opening. For example, a valve diameter. This should be implemented as an lengthMeasure. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.RelativeOpeningSize
member.summary: The size of an opening. This should be implemented as an lengthPerLengthMeasure. A value of 100 % indicates that it is open. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.Pressure
member.summary: A pressure value within a flowing system. This should be implemented as an pressureMeasure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.Temperature
member.summary: A temperature value within a flowing system. This should be implemented as a temperatureMeasure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.ShutinPressure
member.summary: A pressure value within a non-flowing system. This should be implemented as an pressureMeasure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.ShutinTemperature
member.summary: A temperature value within a non-flowing system. This should be implemented as a temperatureMeasure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.ScheduledDowntime
member.summary: Indicates the amount of time the facility has been unavailable during the specified period. May be related to a particular point in time which would represent the start of the downtime. This should be implemented as an time measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.ShutdownOrder
member.summary: Defines the relative order in which a facility should be shutdown. This should be implemented as an integer count. Facilities with smaller values should be shut down first. Only facility parameters with the same version time and same version source should be evaluated together for the purposes of this order.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.TankFluidLevel
member.summary: The vertical height of the specified product in a tank. This should be implemented as a length measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.TankProductVolume
member.summary: The volume of the specified product in a tank. This should be implemented as a volume measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.TankProductStandardVolume
member.summary: The volume of the specified product in a tank, corrected to standard conditions of temperature and pressure. This should be implemented as a volume measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.WellOperationType
member.summary: This commonly called the "well type". It characterizes the well based on its mode of lifting the product. This should be implemented as a string value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FacilityParameter.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FiberMode
member.summary: The mode of a Distributed Temperature Survey (DTS) fiber.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FiberMode.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FiberMode.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FiberMode.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of FiberModes

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FiberMode.Singlemode
member.summary: A single, narrow, core of constant refractive index, surrounded by glass cladding. The core diameter is comparable to a wave length of the light (about 5 um).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FiberMode.Multimode
member.summary: The core has a graded refractive index. The core is generally about 50um in diameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FiberMode.Other
member.summary: The fiber mode is neither singlemode or multimode.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FiberMode.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier
member.summary: Defines qualifiers for type of flow.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of FlowQualifiers

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Allocated
member.summary: Indicates product characteristics that were allocated back to a well as opposed to being measured at the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Budget
member.summary: A performance requirement as determined by a budget.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Constraint
member.summary: Indicates product characteristics that were determined by an allowable or other performance limit. This includes allowables which are usually established by a regulatory agency for a product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Difference
member.summary: A value that is the difference between e.g. a target value and a metered value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Forecast
member.summary: A forecast future value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Derived
member.summary: Indicates product volumes that were derived directly from one or more other flows.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Estimate
member.summary: An estimated or calculated performance, possibly based on comparable product flow units, but not based on reservoir simulations for the particular product flow unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.MassAdjusted
member.summary: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Measured
member.summary: Indicates product volumes that were actually measured at the port.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Metered
member.summary: A value that is read off an officially calibrated instrument (e.g. a gas chromatograph).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.MeteredFiscal
member.summary: A value that is generated by measurement and calculation and has an impact on company revenue and government taxation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Nominated
member.summary: Normally a 1 day forcast promise to a buyer.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Potential
member.summary: The estimated maximum which is possible.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Processed
member.summary: A measured value that has been processed. This is different from derived because it is fundamentally a variation of the original value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Quota
member.summary: An amount, set by some authority, which may or may not be based on technical criteria.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Recommended
member.summary: A value which is believed to be very desirable if it can be achieved. This a recommendation that something be changed in order to achieve this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Simulated
member.summary: An estimated performance based on a simulation that includes the particular product flow unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Target
member.summary: The desired value. What you are aiming for.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.TariffBasis
member.summary: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.ValueAdjusted
member.summary: A value that is adjusted due to a change in the value of a product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowQualifier.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier
member.summary: Defines a specialization of a flow qualifier.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of FlowSubQualifiers

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.DeclineCurve
member.summary: Indicates a pseudo decline-curve of flow rate over time. This presumes that the flow will not be interrupted over that time period. Specialization of "forecast".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Difference
member.summary: A value is derived by taking the difference between two other values. Specialization of "derived".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Fiscal
member.summary: The value was measured for fiscal purposes. Specialization of "measured".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Fixed
member.summary: The value supplied is the only value permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Minimum
member.summary: The value supplied is the minimum permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Maximum
member.summary: The value supplied is the maximum permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Raw
member.summary: The value is a raw measurement. Specialization of "measured".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Recalibrated
member.summary: The value has changed due to a recalibration of the sensor. Specialization of "measured".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Standard
member.summary: A standard forecast as opposed to a decline curve. Specialization of "forecast".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.FlowSubQualifier.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint
member.summary: The type of Distributed Temperature Survey (DTS) fiber point.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of InstalledFiberPoints

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.Splice
member.summary: A point at which a fiber is physically, and semi-permanently, connected to another length of fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.Connector
member.summary: A point at which a cable connector is installed, which allows the fiber to be connected to another instrument or fiber length.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.EndOfFiber
member.summary: The end of the fiber. If a U-geometry is used, and a connector is at both ends, the connector classification should be used rather than the end of fiber classification.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.BaseOfFiber
member.summary: The deepest point of the installed fiber in a well. This is a valid value for fiber installations that do NOT turn around at the bottom (J- and U-type installations).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.TurnAroundPoint
member.summary: The point in the turn-around-sub at which measured depth stops increasing and begins decreasing. This is a valid value for fiber installations of the J- and U- type only.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.StartOfFiber
member.summary: The start of the fiber. If appropriate, the connector classification should be used instead of this classification.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.OvenEntryPoint
member.summary: The point on the fiber at which it enters the oven.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.OvenExitPoint
member.summary: The point on the fiber at which it exits the oven. The oven exit point should be closer to the wellbore than the oven entry point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.DownholeGauge
member.summary: A downhole point on the fiber at which a gauge is attached.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.DtsLaserHead
member.summary: The connector between the laser head and the optical fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.DtsReferenceOven
member.summary: The oven within or near the DTS instrument box which maintains a length of fiber at a reference temperature.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.SpliceBox
member.summary: Container in which ends of lengths of fiber are joined.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.WellheadJunctionBox
member.summary: The device at which a fiber originating at the instrument box is joined to a fiber installed in a wellbore. This is a recommended location at which LengthAlongFiber and measuredDepth in the wellbore are correlated

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.BaseTubingHangerFlange
member.summary: The device at the base of the wellhead to which the production tubing is attached. This is a recommended location at which LengthAlongFiber and measuredDepth in the wellbore are correlated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.PbrWetConnect
member.summary: The top-most point at which the fiber intersects the PBR (polished bore receptacle). For J- and U- installations, on the upward portion of the fiber, this is the point at which it leaves the pbf.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.TopEspPump
member.summary: The top of the electrical submersible pump (ESP). This is the minimum measured depth point of the pump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.BaseEspPump
member.summary: The base of the electrical submersible pump (ESP). This is the maximum measured depth point of the pump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.WellheadTemperatureGauge
member.summary: Temperature measuring device at the wellhead independent of the optic fiber sensor.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.TopCompletionZone
member.summary: The point which is the minimum measured depth of a completion zone.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.BaseCompletionZone
member.summary: The point which is the maximum measured depth of a completion zone.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.InstalledFiberPoint.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.summary: A single country.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.FieldArea
member.summary: A ground that is an area above an oilfield.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.FieldGroup
member.summary: An area concept that is a grouping of two or more selcted petroleum fields for commercial reasons or other purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.FieldPart
member.summary: An area concept that is an area that forms part of a petroleum field.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Flowline
member.summary: A single flowline.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.FlowMeter
member.summary: A single flow meter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Formation
member.summary: A bed or deposit composed throughout of substantially the same kind of rock.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Generator
member.summary: A single electrical generator.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Installation
member.summary: A physical object that is an appliance involved in the extraction, production, transportation or storage of oil or gas.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Lease
member.summary: A single lease.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.License
member.summary: A regulatory agreement that gives the licensees excluding rights to investigate, explore and recover petroleum deposits within the geographical area and timeperiode stated in the agreement.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Manifold
member.summary: A an accessory system of piping to a main piping system that serves to divide a flow into several parts, to combine several flows into one, or to reroute a flow to any one of several possible destinations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.OrganizationalUnit
member.summary: A logical unit of organization for production reporting.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Packer
member.summary: A device used to make a seal between the outside of the production tubing and the inside of the casing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.PerforatedInterval
member.summary: The section of wellbore that has been prepared for production by creating channels between the reservoir formation and the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Pipeline
member.summary: A fluid conductor that consists of pipe, possibly also including pumps, valves, and control devices, intended for conveying liquids, gases, or finely divided solids.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.PlantProcessing
member.summary: A facility that processes natural gas to achieve the recovery of natural gas liquids.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Platform
member.summary: A single platform.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.PressureMeter
member.summary: A single pressure meter. Note that this represents the device and not the sensor itself.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.ProductionTubing
member.summary: A a tube placed in a wellbore through which production fluids travel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Pump
member.summary: A single pump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.ProcessingFacility
member.summary: A single production processing facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.RegulatingValve
member.summary: A device used to regulate the rate of flow of a fluid.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Reservoir
member.summary: A single reservoir.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Separator
member.summary: A single separator.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.SleeveValve
member.summary: A single sleeve valve. This is a type of tubing valve which has a sliding sleeve to cover holes in the tubing. You cover all of the holes in order to close the valve. For configurations oriented toward production, the inlet is on the casing side and the outlet is on the tubing side. For injection, the reverse would be true.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.State
member.summary: A single state or province.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Storage
member.summary: A system for the storage of gaseous, liquid and solid products.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Tank
member.summary: A single tank.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.TemperatureMeter
member.summary: A single temperature meter. Note that this represents the device and not the sensor itself.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Template
member.summary: A single template.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Terminal
member.summary: A physical object that is an industrial facility for the storage of oil and/or petrochemical products and from which these products are usually transported to end users or further storage facilities.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.Trunkline
member.summary: A single trunkline.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFacility.TubingHead

member.summary: Defines the types of flows for volume reports.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of ReportingFlows

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Consume
member.summary: Consumed (all methods) by the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeBlackStart
member.summary: Consummed to restart power facilities as a result of an overall power outage.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeCompressor
member.summary: Consummed by compressors.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeNonCompressor
member.summary: Consumed by devices other than compressors.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeEmitted
member.summary: Released into the atmosphere as a by-product of consumption.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeFlare
member.summary: Burned in a flare. A fluid stream that has one or more flares as the ultimate target.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeHpFlare
member.summary: Burned in a high pressure flare.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeLpFlare
member.summary: Burned in a low pressure flare.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeFuel
member.summary: Consumed by processing equipment.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ConsumeVenting
member.summary: Released into the atmosphere.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Disposal
member.summary: A fluid stream that contains waste fluids for disposal.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Export
member.summary: Leaving the installation for commercialized purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ExportRequested
member.summary: Requested to leave the installation for commercialized purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ExportNominated
member.summary: Planned to leave the installation for commercialized purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.ExportShortfall
member.summary: Difference between what was requested and what was delivered.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.GasLift
member.summary: Injected into a producing well to reduce the hydrostataic pressure of the fluid column. The resulting reduction in bottom hole pressure allows the reservoir liquids to flow.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.HydrocarbonAccounting
member.summary: An accounting of all of the fluids into and out of Stock (i.e., Inventory) which includes all storage facilities at a site including fluid within a pipeline.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Import
member.summary: Entering the facility for commercialized purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Injection
member.summary: Inject into a well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Inventory
member.summary: Stock at a facility. For a period that represents an event, the amount would represent the current amount of inventory. For other periods, the amount would represent the addition (positive value) or drawdown (negative value) over that period. For an individual storage facility (e.g., a tank), the amounts would represent that tank. For an overall facility, the amounts would represent all tanks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Overboard
member.summary: Dropped overboard into the sea.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Production
member.summary: Exploited from a reservoir. This is independent of any disposition.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Sale
member.summary: A fluid stream that is sold and transported to a buyer by pipeline.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Storage
member.summary: A fluid stream that is directed to one or more storage locations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingFlow.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod
member.summary: A period of one day. If the report does not represent one day then this represents the 24 hour period ending at the end of the report period.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of ReportingPeriods

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.Day
member.summary: A period of one day. If the report does not represent one day then this represents the 24 hour period ending at the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.Week
member.summary: A period of one week. If the report does not represent one week then this represents the 7 times 24 hour period ending at the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.Month
member.summary: A period of one calendar month.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.Year
member.summary: A period of one gregorian year.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.YearToDate
member.summary: A period from the beginning of the year to the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.MonthToDate
member.summary: A period from the beginning of the calendar month to the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.DailyYearToDate
member.summary: The average per day over the period from the beginning of the year to the end of the report period

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.DailyMonthToDate
member.summary: The average per day over the period from the beginning of the month to the end of the report period

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.TotalCumulative
member.summary: A period with no beginning that ends at the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.Report
member.summary: A period coinciding with the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.ReportStart
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with the start of report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.ReportEnd
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with the end of report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.PreviousPeriod
member.summary: The previous reporting period. For example, if the report period represents a day then the previous period represents the previous day.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.Midnight
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with midnight during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at midnight - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.Noon
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with noon during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at noon - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.ZeroSixZeroZero
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with 6 am during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at 6 am - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.GasDay
member.summary: A period in time that is all space of time within a day (24 hour period) starting at 06:00 AM and ending 06:00 AM next day.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.GasMonth
member.summary: A period in time that is all space of time within a whole given month starting at 06:00 AM the first day and ending at 06:00 AM the first day of next month.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.GasYear
member.summary: A period in time that is all time within a period starting at 06:00 AM October 1st and ending at same date and time the following year.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.GasYearToDate
member.summary: A period in time that is all space of time within a period starting at 06:00 AM October 1st ending at 06:00 AM at a given date.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.LifeToDate
member.summary: A period in time that is all space of time within a period from starting up an equipment, installation, field, license, etc, to a given date.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingPeriod.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.Oleic
member.summary: An undifferentiated liquid fluid phase in which the dominant continuous materials are liquid hydrocarbons. This phase is often called the "oil phase".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.Aqueous
member.summary: An undifferentiated liquid fluid phase in which the dominant continuous material is liquid water. This phase is often called the "water phase".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.Vapor
member.summary: An undifferentiated fluid phase that is distinctly gaseous. This phase is often called the "gas phase".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.Liquid
member.summary: An undifferentiated fluid phase that is distinctly liquid. This includes water.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.CSeven
member.summary: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with seven carbon atoms.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.CEight
member.summary: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with eight carbon atoms.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.CNine
member.summary: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with nine carbon atoms.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.COneZero
member.summary: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with ten carbon atoms.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.CarbonMonoxodeGas
member.summary: Carbon monoxode in a gaseous state.

member.summary: Carbon dioxide in a gaseous state.

member.summary: Mixture of light and heavier hydrocarbons in a liguid state.

member.summary: Light hydrocarbon fractions produced with natural gas, which condense into liquid at normal temperatures and pressures associated with surface production equipment.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.CondensateNet
member.summary: Hydrocatbon condensate containing only the heavier carbon fractions C5 to C10+.

member.summary: A crude oil that has been stabilized by separating out dissolved gas.

member.summary: Gas mixture of hydrocarbons.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.GasDry
member.summary: A natural gas that occurs in the absence of condensate or liquid hydrocarbons, or gas that has had condensable hydrocarbons removed, mainly consisting of methane gas.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.GasRich
member.summary: Gas mixture of light and heavier hydrocarbons than a lean gas.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.GasWet
member.summary: A natural gas that contains less methane (typically less than 85% methane) and more ethane and other more complex hydrocarbons like propane, butane and naphtha.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.LiquifiedNaturalGas
member.summary: A liquid compound that is natural gas compressed and supercooled to -167 deg C (-269 deg F) into a liquid to reduce its volume to 1/635th for storage and transportation. Liquefied natural gas has a calorific value of 22,300 Btu/lb. It consists of about 91% of methane and 7% ethane with some propane, butane, and higher hydrocarbons. One tonne liquified natural gas is equal to about 53 Mcf of gas. Liquified natural gas can be vaporized by ambient air, another fluid, or directfired vaporizer.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReportingProduct.LiquifiedPetroleumGas
member.summary: A liquid compound that is predominantly butane and propane separated from natural gasoline or natural gas and sold as fuel - commonly known as bottled gas, tank gas or LP-gas.

member.summary: N-butane as a component in another fluid.

member.summary: An aggregate that is a volatile and inflammable product of crude oil refining with a boiling range 140 - 210 deg. Celsius consisting of C5+ to C10 components (pentanes and hexanes).

member.summary: Crude oil including water. A mixture of hydrocargons, that existed in liquid phase in underground reservoirs and remains liquid at atmospheric pressure after passing through separating facilities.
