member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesKeyword.AssetIdentifier
member.summary: A PRODML formatted URI identifier of the asset (facility) related to the value. This captures the kind of asset as well as the unique identifier of the asset within a specified context (the authority). The identifier may define a hierarchy of assets.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesKeyword.Qualifier
member.summary: A qualifier of the meaning of the value. This is used to distinguish between variations of an underlying meaning based on the method of creating the value (e.g., measured versus simulated). The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type FlowQualifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesKeyword.Subqualifier
member.summary: A specialization of a qualifier. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type FlowSubQualifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesKeyword.Product
member.summary: The type of product that is represented by the value. This is generally used with things like volume or flow rate. It is generally meaningless for things like temperature or pressure. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type ReportingProduct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesKeyword.Flow
member.summary: Defines the part of the flow network where the asset is located. This is most useful in situations (e.g., reporting) where detailed knowledge of the network configuration is not needed. Basically, this classifies different segments of the flow network based on its purpose within the context of the whole network. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type ReportingFlow.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesKeyword.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus
member.summary: An indicator of the quality of a value. This is designed for a SCADA or OPC style of value stasus. The token in parentheses are OPC's status string for the condition.

member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of ValueStatuss

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus.BadCalibration
member.summary: The calibration status of the sensor is unknown. (Out of Calibration)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus.RangeLimit
member.summary: The value is range limited, that is, at or near the end of range of the sensor. The value might be clamped. (Low Limited, High Limited)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus.Questionable
member.summary: The value is just plain questionable. (Sub-Normal, Non-specific)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus.DeviceFailure
member.summary: The unit to which the sensor is attached is not running. (Device Failure)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus.SensorFailure
member.summary: The field sensor itself is not working due to hardware failure or misconfiguration. (Sensor Failure)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus.CommFailure
member.summary: The communication to the field sensor is not working. That is, communcation cannot be established or maintained. (Comm Failure)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus.Timeout
member.summary: Communication to the field sensor has timed out, that is, a connection exists, but a request for a field sensor data value has failed. (Last Known Value)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ValueStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftFlowingIntervalKind
member.summary: This is used to characterize the kind of connection between the wireline formation tester tool (WFT) and the formation via a section of wellbore. Since WFTs can have probes or pairs of packers, which have different geometries (respectively a point connection or a section of wellbore like a welltest), it is necessary to state which kind if flowing for this station.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftFlowingIntervalKind.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftFlowingIntervalKind.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftFlowingIntervalKind.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of WftFlowingIntervalKinds

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftFlowingIntervalKind.Probe
member.summary: This is used to identify a probe connection between reservoir and WFT tool.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftFlowingIntervalKind.PackedInterval
member.summary: This is to identify a connection between reservoir and WFT tool which is between a pair of packers, ie akin to the flow connection of a traditional drill stem test (DST) though usually on a smaller scale.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftFlowingIntervalKind.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftEventKind
member.summary: This is used to identify events occuring during the operation of a wireline formation tester (WFT) at a given station (ie a temporary fixed position in the wellbore where a series of tests will be made). This list could be expanded in future. Two basic events are documented.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftEventKind.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftEventKind.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftEventKind.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of WftEventKinds

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftEventKind.ToolSet
member.summary: This event describes the process of setting the WFT tool prior to tests being made at the station.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftEventKind.ToolRetract
member.summary: This event describes the process of retracting the WFT tool after tests being made at the station, ready to move to another station or be retrieved from the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftEventKind.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftStationKind
member.summary: This is used to characterize the kind of station. Two kinds are expected: conventional where flow is occuring and being measured, and observation where there is no flow and merely pressure observation of the effect at this station of flow which is occuring at a different station.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftStationKind.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftStationKind.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftStationKind.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of WftStationKinds

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftStationKind.Conventional
member.summary: This is used to identify a station where flow is occuring and being measured, such as pressure, temperature and flowrate.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftStationKind.Observation
member.summary: This is used to identify a station where there is no flow occuring but the WFT tool is set and making pressure observation of the effect at this station of flow which is occuring at a different station.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftStationKind.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestKind
member.summary: This is used to characterise the kind of Test being carried out at a given time at a given station by a wireline formation tester (WFT). This list could be expanded in future. Two basic tests are documented.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestKind.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestKind.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestKind.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of WftTestKinds

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestKind.Drawdown
member.summary: A drawdown test is where reservoir fluid is flowing into the WFT tool via a connection described by the flowing interval kind element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestKind.Buildup
member.summary: A build up test is where there is no flow of reservoir fluid into the WFT tool, but because the connection described by the flowing interval kind element remains in place, the WFT tool is measuring the pressure in the reservoir at the sandface (ie the inside face of the wellbore). A buildup must be preceded by one or more drawdowns (during which the sandface pressure will have dropped), and during the buildup the pressure will rise again. Hence the name, buildup.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestKind.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestResultKind
member.summary: This is used to characterize the kind of test result. The kind of result typically represents a combination of test kind and analysis method applied. This list could be expanded in future. Two illustrative result kinds are documented.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestResultKind.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestResultKind.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestResultKind.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of WftTestResultKinds

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestResultKind.BuildupResult
member.summary: This refers to the result of analysis of a buildup. More specialist buildup results could be added to the enum list such as buildup horner analysis, etc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestResultKind.DrawdownResult
member.summary: This refers to the result of analysis of a drawdown.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestResultKind.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestDataRole
member.summary: This is used to charaterize the test data being described. A curve of data may comprise one item of test data (by use of the curveSection element), in which case the wftTestDataRole is used to say what that curve "means" in the test. Alternatively a single parameter may characterise the test in some manner (by use of the parameter element), in which case the wftTestDataRole is used to say what that parameter "means" in the test. This list could be expanded in future. Two illustrative WftTestDataRole kinds are documented.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestDataRole.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestDataRole.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestDataRole.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of WftTestDataRoles

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestDataRole.PressureStream
member.summary: This would refer to a curveSection element and indicate the curve is a curve (a time series of data points) containing the pressure data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestDataRole.FlowHistory
member.summary: This would refer to a curveSection element and indicate the curve is a curve (a time series of data points) containing the flowrate history data (used in pressure transient analysis.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftTestDataRole.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.summary: A single attachment Object

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo
member.summary: A schema to capture a set of data that is relevant for many exchange documents. It includes information about the file that was created, and high-level information about the data that is being exchanged within the file.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentName
member.summary: An identifier for the document. This is intended to be unique within the context of the NamingSystem.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentAlias
member.summary: Zero or more alternate names for the document. These names do not need to be unique within the naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentDate
member.summary: The date of the creation of the document. This is not the same as the date that the file was created. For this date, the document is considered to be the set of information associated with this document information. For example, the document may be a seismic binset. This represents the date that the binset was created. The FileCreation information would capture the date that the XML file was created to send or exchange the binset.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentClass
member.summary: A document class. Examples of classes would be a metadata classification or a set of keywords.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.FileCreationInformation
member.summary: The information about the creation of the exchange file. This is not about the creation of the data within the file, but the creation of the file itself.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.SecurityInformation
member.summary: Information about the security to be applied to this file. More than one classification can be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Disclaimer
member.summary: A free-form string that allows a disclaimer to accompany the information.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.AuditTrail
member.summary: A collection of events that can document the history of the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Owner
member.summary: The owner of the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Comment
member.summary: An optional comment about the document.

member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore.

member.summary: This is a pointer to the parent wellbore. No parent = starts from top.

member.summary: Operator borehole number.

member.summary: API suffix.

member.summary: Government assigned number.

member.summary: POSC wellbore status.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.IsActive
member.summary: True (="1" or "true") indicates that the wellbore is active. False (="0" or "false") indicates otherwise. It is the servers responsibility to set this value based on its available internal data (e.g., what objects are changing).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.PurposeWellbore
member.summary: POSC wellbore purpose.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.TypeWellbore
member.summary: Type of wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.Shape
member.summary: POSC wellbore trajectory shape.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.DateTimeKickoff
member.summary: Date and time of wellbore kickoff.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.AchievedTD
member.summary: True ("true" of "1") indicates that the wellbore has acheieved total depth. That is, drilling has completed. False ("false" or "0") indicates otherwise. Not given indicates that it is not known whether total depth has been reached.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.MD
member.summary: The measured depth of the borehole. If status is plugged, indicates the maximum depth reached before plugging. It is recommended that this value be updated about every 10 minutes by an assigned raw data provider at a site.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.Tvd
member.summary: The true vertical depth of the borehole. If status is plugged, indicates the maximum depth reached before plugging. It is recommended that this value be updated about every 10 minutes by an assigned raw data provider at a site.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.MDBit
member.summary: The measured depth of the bit. If isActive=false then this value is not relevant. It is recommended that this value be updated about every 10 minutes by an assigned raw data provider at a site.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.TvdBit
member.summary: The true vertical depth of the bit. If isActive=false then this value is not relevant. It is recommended that this value be updated about every 10 minutes by an assigned raw data provider at a site.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.MDKickoff
member.summary: Kickoff measured depth of the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Wellbore.TvdKickoff
member.summary: Kickoff true vertical depth of the wellbore.

member.summary: Planned measured depth for the wellbore total depth.

member.summary: Planned true vertical depth for the wellbore total depth.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData
member.summary: WITSML - Common Data Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.SourceName
member.summary: An identifier to indicate the data originator. This identifies the server that originally created the object and thus most of the uids in the object (but not necessarily the uids of the parents). This is typically a url.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.DateTimeCreation
member.summary: When the data was created at the persistent data store. This is an API server parameter releted to the "Special Handling of Change Information" within a server. See the relevant API specification for the behavior related to this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.DateTimeLastChange
member.summary: Last change of any element of the data at the persistent data store. This is an API server parameter releted to the "Special Handling of Change Information" within a server. See the relevant API specification for the behavior related to this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ItemState
member.summary: The item state for the data object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ServiceCategory
member.summary: The category of the service related to the creation of the object. For example, "mud log service", "cement service", "LWD service", "rig service", "drilling service".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.Comments
member.summary: Comments and remarks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.AcquisitionTimeZone
member.summary: The local time zone of the original acquisition date-time values. It is the deviation in hours and minutes from UTC. The first occurrence should be the actual local time zone at the start of acquisition and may represent a seasonally adjusted value such as daylight savings. The dTim attribute must be populated in the second and subsequent occurrences if the local time zone changes during acquisition. This knowledge is required because the original time zone in a dateTime value may be lost when software converts to a different time zone.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.DefaultDatum
member.summary: A pointer to the default wellDatum for measured depth coordinates, vertical depth coordinates and elevation coordinates in this object. Depth coordinates that do not specify a datum attribute shall be assumed to be measured relative to this default vertical datum. The referenced wellDatum must be defined within the well object associated with this object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.PrivateGroupOnly
member.summary: This is an API query parameter. See the API specification for the behavior related to this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ExtensionAny
member.summary: Extensions to the schema using an xsd:any construct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TimestampedTimeZone
member.summary: This class represents the timestampedTimeZone xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TimestampedTimeZone.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time when this local time zone became active. This value must be defined on the second and subsequent occurrences.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionAny
member.summary: WITSML - Extension Schema. The intent is to allow standard WITSML schema extensions which will validate in older clients or servers. A client or server can ignore any schema that it does not recognize. New versions will modify specific elements to replace this type with a type that adds new elements, including another element with this type.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: WITSML - Extension values Schema. The intent is to allow standard WITSML "named" extensions without having to modify the schema. A client or server can ignore any name that it does not recognize but certain meta data is required in order to allow generic clients or servers to process the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Name
member.summary: The name of the extension. Each standard name should document the expected measure class. Each standard name should document the expected maximum size. For numeric values the size should be in terms of xsd types such as int, long, short, byte, float or double. For strings, the maximum length should be defined in number of characters. Local extensions to the list of standard names are allowed but it is strongly recommended that the names and definitions be approved by the WITSML SIG Technical Team before use.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Value
member.summary: The value of the extension. This may also include a uom attribute. The content should conform to constraints defined by the data type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.DataType
member.summary: The underlying XML type of the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.DateTime
member.summary: The date-time associated with the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.MD
member.summary: The measured depth associated with the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Index
member.summary: Indexes things with the same name. That is, 1 indicates the first one, 2 incidates the second one, etc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.MeasureClass
member.summary: The kind of the measure. For example, "length". This should be specified if the value requires a unit of measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the extension.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Extensionvalue
member.summary: This class represents the extensionvalue xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Extensionvalue.Uom
member.summary: The unit of measure for the value. This value must conform to the values allowed by a measure class.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.CustomData
member.summary: This class represents the cs_customData xsd type.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint
member.summary: WITSML - Reference Point Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Type
member.summary: The kind of point. For example, 'well reference point', 'platform reference point', 'sea surface', 'sea bottom'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Elevation
member.summary: The gravity based elevation coordinate of this point as measured from a datum. Positive moving upward from the elevation datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.MeasuredDepth
member.summary: The measured depth coordinate of this reference point. Positive moving toward the bottomhole from the measured depth datum. This should be given when the reference is "downhole", such as an ocean bottom template, or when the reference point is also used as a vertical well datum. The measured depth value can be used to determine if the reference point and a vertical well datum are at the same point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Location
member.summary: Two dimensional coordinates that locate the point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location
member.summary: WITSML Location Component Schema This is a location that is expressed in terms of 2D coordinates. In order that the location be understood, the coordinate reference system (CRS) must be known. The survey location is given by a pair of tagged values. The pairs may be: (1) latitude/longitude, (2) easting/northing, (3) westing/southing, (4) projectedX/projectedY, or (5) localX/localY. The appropriate pair must be chosen for the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.WellCRS
member.summary: A pointer to the wellCRS that defines the CRS for the coordinates. While optional, it is strongly recommended that this be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude with north being positive. If you set this property, you must also set Longitude.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude with east being positive. If you set this property, you must also set Latitude.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.Easting
member.summary: The projected coordinate with east being positive. This is the most common type of projected coordinates. UTM coordinates are expressed in Easting and Northing. If you set this property, you must also set Northing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.Northing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with north being positive. This is the most common type of projected coordinates. UTM coordinates are expressed in Easting and Northing. If you set this property, you must also set Easting.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.Westing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with west being positive. The positive directions are reversed from the usual Easting and Northing values. These values are generally located in the southern hemisphere, most notably in South Africa and Australia. If you set this property, you must also set Southing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.Southing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with south being positive. The positive directions are reversed from the usual Easting and Northing values. These values are generally located in the southern hemisphere, most notably in South Africa and Australia. If you set this property, you must also set Westing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.ProjectedX
member.summary: The projected X coordinate with the positive direction unknown. ProjectedX and ProjectedY are used when it is not known what the meaning of the coordinates is. If the meaning is known, the Easting/Northing or Westing/Southing should be used. Use of this pair implies a lack of knowledge on the part of the sender. If you set this property, you must also set ProjectedY.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.ProjectedY
member.summary: The projected Y coordinate with the positive direction unknown. ProjectedX and ProjectedY are used when it is not known what the meaning of the coordinates is. If the meaning is known, the Easting/Northing or Westing/Southing should be used. Use of this pair implies a lack of knowledge on the part of the sender. If you set this property, you must also set ProjectedX.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.LocalX
member.summary: The local (engineering) X coordinate. The CRS will define the orientation of the axis. If you set this property, you must also set LocalY.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.LocalY
member.summary: The local (engineering) Y coordinate. The CRS will define the orientation of the axis. If you set this property, you must also set LocalX.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.Original
member.summary: Flag indicating (if "true" or "1") that this pair of values was the original data given for the location. If the pair of values was calculated from an original pair of values, this flag should be "false" (or "0"), or not present.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.Description
member.summary: A Comment, generally given to help the reader interpret the coordinates if the CRS and the chosen pair do not make them clear.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Location.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem
member.summary: This class represents the cs_publicLandSurveySystem xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.PrincipalMeridian
member.summary: Principal meridian for this location.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.Range
member.summary: Range number.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.RangeDir
member.summary: Range direction.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.Township
member.summary: Township number.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.TownshipDir
member.summary: Township direction.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.Section
member.summary: Section number.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.QuarterSection
member.summary: The location of the well within the section, with the primary component listed first. Spot location will be made some from combination of the following codes: NE, NW, SW, SE, N2, S2, E2, W2, C (center quarter), LTxx (where xx represents a two digit lot designation), TRzz (where zz represents a one or two character trac designation). Free format will allow for entries such as NESW (southwest quarter of northeast quarter), E2NESE (southeast quarter of northeast quarter of east half), CNE (northeast quarter of center quarter), etc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.QuarterTownship
member.summary: Quarter township.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.FootageNS
member.summary: Distance inside of the boundary line of the specified section. North specifies the distance from the north boundary line.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.PublicLandSurveySystem.FootageEW
member.summary: Distance inside of the boundary line of the specified section. East specifies the distance from the east boundary line.

member.summary: The non-contextual content of a WITSML Well object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.NameLegal
member.summary: Legal name of the well.

member.summary: License number of the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.NumGovt
member.summary: Government assigned well number.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.DateTimeLicense
member.summary: Date and time license was issued.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.Field
member.summary: Name of the field in which the well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.Country
member.summary: Country in which well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.State
member.summary: State or province in which well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.County
member.summary: County in which the well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.Region
member.summary: Geo-political region.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.District
member.summary: Geo-political district name.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.Block
member.summary: Block name in which well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.TimeZone
member.summary: The time zone in which well is located. It is the deviation in hours and minutes from UTC. This should be the normal time zone at the well and not a seasonally adjusted value such as daylight savings time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.Operator
member.summary: Operator company name.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.OperatorDivision
member.summary: Division of operator company.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.PercentInterest
member.summary: Interest for Operator. Commonly in percent.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.NumAPI
member.summary: American Petroleum Institute well number.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.StatusWell
member.summary: POSC Well status.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.PurposeWell
member.summary: POSC well purpose.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.FluidWell
member.summary: POSC well fluid. The type of fluid being produced from or injected into a well facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.DirectionWell
member.summary: POSC well direction. The direction of flow of the fluids in a well facility (generally, injected or produced, or some combination).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.DateTimeSpud
member.summary: Date and time at which well was spudded.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.DateTimePluggedAndAbandoned
member.summary: Date and time at which well was plugged and abandoned.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.WellheadElevation
member.summary: Elevation of wellhead relative to a wellDatum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.WellDatum
member.summary: A vertical datum to which elevations and depths are referenced.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.GroundElevation
member.summary: Elevation of ground level (land rigs).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.WaterDepth
member.summary: Depth of water (not land rigs).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.WellLocation
member.summary: the 2D coordinates of the well surface point in one coordinate reference system. This is where the well crosses ground level on land and crosses the platform offshore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.WellPublicLandSurveySystemLocation
member.summary: Township, section, range, quarter, and footage calls for USA Public Land Survey System.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.ReferencePoint
member.summary: Defines a reference point within the context of the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.WellCRS
member.summary: A coordinate reference system that was used within the context of this well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Well.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum
member.summary: Defines the vertical datums associated with elevation, vertical depth and measured depth coordinates within the context of a well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Name
member.summary: The human understandable contextual name of the reference datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Code
member.summary: The code value that represents the type of reference datum. This may represent a point on a device (e.g., kelly bushing) or it may represent a vertical reference datum (e.g., mean sea level).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DatumCRS
member.summary: A reference to the coordinateReferenceSystem object representing the vertical reference datum (i.e., this wellDatum). This should only be specified if the above 'code' represents some variation of sea level.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DatumName
member.summary: The name of the vertical reference datum in a particular naming system. This should only be specified if the above 'code' represents some variation of sea level. An optional short name (code) can also be specified. Specifying a well known datum is highly desired if the above code is a variant of sea level because sea level varies over time and space. An example would be to specify a name of 'Caspian Sea' with a code of '5106' in the 'EPSG' naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Kind
member.summary: Since various activities may use different points as measurement datums, it is useful to characterize the point based on its usage. A well reference datum may have more than one such characterization. For example, it may be the datum used by the driller and logger for measuring their depths. Example usage values would be 'permanent','driller', 'logger' 'WRP' (well reference point) and 'SRP' (site reference point).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Wellbore
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the reference datum. This should be specified if a measured depth is given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Rig
member.summary: A pointer to the rig that contains the device used as a reference datum. The rig may be associated with a wellbore in another well (e.g., pattern drilling using a rig on a track).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Elevation
member.summary: The gravity based elevation coordinate of this reference datum as measured from another datum. Positive moving upward from the elevation datum. An elevation should be given unless this is a vertical reference datum (e.g., sea level).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.MeasuredDepth
member.summary: The measured depth coordinate of this reference datum as measured from another datum. The measured depth datum should either be the same as the elevation datum or it should be relatable to the elevation datum through other datums. Positive moving toward the bottomhole from the measured depth datum. This should be given when a local reference is "downhole", such as a kickoff point or ocean bottom template, and the borehole may not be vertical. If a Depth is given then an Elevation should also be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.HorizontalLocation
member.summary: The horizontal location of the point being used as a well datum. This may be used when the point is not directly above or below the well point location. For example, a well being drilled from a platform may have its location at the entrance into the sea floor, while the well datum may be located on the drilling rig. Or the well datum may be a kickoff point, that is not directly under the well surface point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Comment
member.summary: A contextual description of the well reference datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Uid
member.summary: The unique identifier of the node. All measured depth, vertical depth and elevation coordinates may point to this uid using attribute "datum". Alternatively, the commonData elements defaultMeasuredDatum, defaultVerticalDatum and defaultElevationDatum may point to this value. The best practice for the uid is to derive it from the name. For example, by changing spaces to underscores.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct
member.summary: This class represents the wellKnownNameStruct xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct.NamingSystem
member.summary: The naming system within the name is unique.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct.Code
member.summary: A unique (short) code associated with the name.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore
member.summary: Data that represents a foreign key to a wellbore. The wellbore may be defined within the context of another well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore.WellboreReference
member.summary: A pointer the wellbore with which there is a relationship.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore.WellPluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the well that contains the wellboreReference. This is not needed unless the referenced wellbore is outside the context of a common parent well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig
member.summary: A reference to a rig within a wellbore. The wellbore may be defined within the context of another well. This value represents a foreign key from one node to another.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.RigReference
member.summary: A pointer to the rig with which there is a relationship.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.WellborePluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the rigReference. This is not needed unless the referenced rig is outside the context of a common parent wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.WellPluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the well that contains the wellboreParent. This is not needed unless the referenced wellbore is outside the context of a common parent well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS
member.summary: WITSML - Well Coordinate Reference System Component Schema. Note that this is intended for use with two dimensional coordinates. That does not prevent the use of a three dimensional CRS. It just means that only two coordinates will be specified in that 3D system. The veritcal coordinates are specified separately and, for 3D systems, one of the linked wellDatums should represent the vertical datum of that 3D system so that the height in the 3d system can be determined.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the system. For a geodetic system this is commonly the name of the datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.MapProjectionCRS
member.summary: A reference to the coordinateReferenceSystems object representing the Map projection system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.GeodeticCRS
member.summary: A reference to the coordinateReferenceSystems object representing the Geodetic (i.e., Geocentric or Geographic) system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.Geographic
member.summary: Geographic system. Note that these structures do not truly define a CRS but rather specify information that could be used to describe a CRS.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.LocalCRS
member.summary: Local (engineering) system. Note that these structures do not truly define a CRS but rather specify information that could be used to describe a CRS.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.MapProjection
member.summary: Map projection system. Note that these structures do not truly define a CRS but rather specify information that could be used to describe a CRS.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel
member.summary: WITSML - Geodetic Model Component Schema. All elements except nameCRS have been deprecated. Either use a well known name of a CRS or use the wellCRS reference to a gmlCoordinateReferenceSystem.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.NameCRS
member.summary: The name of the coordinate reference system in a particular naming system. An optional short name (code) can also be specified. Specifying a well known system is highly desired. An example would be to specify a name of 'ED50' with a code of '4230' in the 'EPSG' naming system. Note that specifying a name in the EPSG naming system is asserting that the parameters in the EPSG database are appropriate for this CRS. This is also true for any other naming system. If in doubt, contact your local geodesist.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.GeodeticDatumCode
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Geodetic datum code. This defines a system in the Geoshare naming system and should probably not be used with CRSName.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.XTranslation
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Ellipsoid translation (3). Units are meters by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.YTranslation
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Ellipsoid translation (3). Units are meters by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.ZTranslation
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Ellipsoid translation (3). Units are meters by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.XRotation
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Ellipsoid rotation (3). Seconds of arc by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.YRotation
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Ellipsoid rotation (3). Seconds of arc by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.ZRotation
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Ellipsoid rotation (3). Seconds of arc by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.ScaleFactor
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Ellipsoid scale factor.

member.summary: DEPRECATED. Ellipsoid semi-major axis size. Implied if geodeticDatumCode or ellipsoidCode specified.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS
member.summary: This class represents the cs_localCRS xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.OriginDescription
member.summary: A textual description of the origin.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.Origin
member.summary: A pointer to the well reference point that is the origin of this CRS.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.UsesWellAsOrigin
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that the well surface point is the origin of this CRS. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates otherwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.YAxisAzimuth
member.summary: The angle of the Y axis from North (as described in attribute northDirection). Defaults to zero. Positive clockwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.MagneticDeclination
member.summary: The angle between magnetic north and true north. The angle is measured positive clockwise from true north to magnetic north. This value SHOULD be given if the yAxisAzimuth is measured from the magnetic north direction.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.GridConvergence
member.summary: The angle between true north and the northing axis or the projection grid being used. The angle is measured at the point in question, and is measured from true north to grid north, positive clockwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.YAxisDescription
member.summary: A free-form description of the Y axis. Examples would be 'parallel to the west side of the platform', or 'along the main entry road'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.XRotationCounterClockwise
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that the X axis is rotated counter-clockwise from the Y axis when viewed from above the earth looking down. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates a clockwise rotation. Generally the X axis is rotated clockwise.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx
member.summary: WITSML Element Types All elements except nameCRS have been deprecated. Either use a well known name of a CRS or use the wellCRS reference to a gmlCoordinateReferenceSystem.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.NameCRS
member.summary: The name of the coordinate reference system in a particular naming system. An optional short name (code) can also be specified. Specifying a well known system is highly desired. An example would be to specify a name of 'WGS 84 / UTM zone 10N' with a code of '32610' in the 'EPSG' naming system. Note that specifying a name in the EPSG naming system is asserting that the parameters in the EPSG database are appropriate for this CRS. This is also true for any other naming system. If in doubt, contact your local geodesist.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.ProjectionCode
member.summary: DEPRECATED. A code to identify the type of projection.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.ProjectedFrom
member.summary: DEPRECATED. A pointer to the wellCRS that represents the geographic system from which this system was projected.

member.summary: DEPRECATED. Zone for the type of projection. Zones have values from 1 to 60 with a required direction of "N" (North) or "S" (South). For example, "21N".

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.NameTag
member.summary: WITSML - Equipment NameTag Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Name
member.summary: The physical identification string of the equipment tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.NumberingScheme
member.summary: The format or encoding specification of the equipment tag. The tag may contain may different pieces of information and knowledge of that information is inherent in the specification. The "identification string" is a mandatory part of the information in a tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Technology
member.summary: Identifies the general type of identifier on an item. If multiple identifiers exist on an item, a separate description set for each identifier should be created. For example, a joint of casing may have a barcode label on it along with a painted-on code and an RFID tag attached or embedded into the coupling. The barcode label may in turn be an RFID equipped label. This particular scenario would require populating five nameTags to fully describe and decode all the possible identifiers as follows: 'tagged' - RFID tag embedded in the coupling, 'label' - Serial number printed on the label, 'tagged' - RFID tag embedded into the label, 'label' - Barcode printed on the label, 'painted'- Mill number painted on the pipe body.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Location
member.summary: An indicator of where the tag is attached to the item. This is used to assist the user in finding where an identifier is located on an item. This optional field also helps to differentiate where an identifier is located when multiple identifiers exist on an item. Most downhole components have a box (female thread) and pin (male thread) end as well as a pipe body in between the ends. Where multiple identifiers are used on an item, it is convenient to have a reference as to which end, or somewhere in the middle, an identifier may be closer to. Some items may have an identifier on a non-standard location, such as on the arm of a hole opener. 'other', by exclusion, tells a user to look elsewhere than on the body or near the ends of an item. Most non-downhole tools will use either 'body', 'other' or not specified as the location tends to lose value with smaller or non threaded items.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.InstallationDate
member.summary: When the tag was installed in or on the item.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.InstallationCompany
member.summary: The name of the company that installed the tag.

member.summary: Reference to a manufacturers or installers installation description, code, or method.

member.summary: A comment or remark about the tag.

member.summary: Maximum measured depth of this object. This is an API "structural-range" query parameter for growing objects. See the relevant API specification for the query behavior related to this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.ServiceCompany
member.summary: Name of contractor who provided the service.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.MagDeclUsed
member.summary: Magnetic declination used to correct a Magnetic North referenced azimuth to a True North azimuth. Magnetic declination angles are measured positive clockwise from True North to Magnetic North (or negative in the anti-clockwise direction). To convert a Magnetic azimuth to a True North azimuth, the magnetic declination should be added. Starting value if stations have individual values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.GridCorUsed
member.summary: DEPRECATED - use gridConUsed. Grid correction used to correct a survey. Starting value if stations have individual values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.GridConUsed
member.summary: Magnetic declination used to correct a Magnetic North referenced azimuth to a True North azimuth. Magnetic declination angles are measured positive clockwise from True North to Magnetic North (or negative in the anti-clockwise direction). To convert a Magnetic azimuth to a True North azimuth, the magnetic declination should be added. Starting value if stations have individual values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.AziVertSect
member.summary: Azimuth used for vertical section plot/computations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.DispNSVertSectOrig
member.summary: Origin north-south used for vertical section plot/computations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.DispEWVertSectOrig
member.summary: Origin east-west used for vertical section plot/computations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.Definitive
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that this trajectory is definitive for this wellbore. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates otherwise. There can only be one trajectory per wellbore with definitive=true and it must define the geometry of the whole wellbore (surface to bottom). The definitive trajectory may represent a composite of information in many other trajectories. A query requesting a subset of the possible information can provide a simplistic view of the geometry of the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.Memory
member.summary: Is trajectory a result of a memory dump from a tool? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.FinalTraj
member.summary: Is trajectory a final or intermediate/preliminary? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.Trajectory.AziRef
member.summary: Specifies the definition of north. While this is optional because of legacy data, it is strongly recommended that this always be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.GravAccelCorUsed
member.summary: Was an accelerometer alignment correction applied to survey computation? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.MagXAxialCorUsed
member.summary: Was a magnetometer alignment correction applied to survey computation? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.SagCorUsed
member.summary: Was a bottom hole assembly sag correction applied to the survey computation? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.MagDrlstrCorUsed
member.summary: Was a drillstring magnetism correction applied to survey computation? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.InfieldRefCorUsed
member.summary: Was an In Field Referencing (IFR) correction applied to the azimuth value? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0"). An IFR survey measures the strength and direction of the Earth's magnetic field over the area of interest. By taking a geomagnetic modelled values away from these field survey results, we are left with a local crustal correction, which since it is assumed geological in nature, only varies over geological timescales. For MWD survey operations, these corrections are applied in addition to the geomagnetic model to provide accurate knowledge of the local magnetic field and hence to improve the accuracy of MWD magnetic azimuth measurements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.InterpolatedInfieldRefCorUsed
member.summary: Was an Interpolated In Field Referencing (IIFR) correction applied to the azimuth value? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0"). Interpolated In Field Referencing measures the diurnal Earth magnetic field variations resulting from electrical currents in the ionosphere and effects of magnetic storms hitting the Earth. It increases again the accuracy of the magnetic azimuth measurement.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.InHoleRefCorUsed
member.summary: Was an In Hole Referencing (IHR) correction applied to the inclination and/or azimuth values? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0"). In-Hole Referencing essentially involves comparing gyro surveys to MWD surveys in a tangent section of a well. Once a small part of a tangent section has been drilled and surveyed using an MWD tool, then an open hole (OH) gyro is run. By comparing the Gyro surveys to the MWD surveys a correction can be calculated for the MWD. This correction is then assumed as valid for the rest of the tangent section allowing to have a near gyro accuracy for the whole section, therefore reducing the ellipse of uncertainty (EOU) size.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.AxialMagInterferenceCorUsed
member.summary: Was an Axial Magnetic Interference (AMI) correction applied to the azimuth value? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0"). Most of the BHAs used to drill wells include an MWD tool. An MWD is a magnetic survey tool and as such suffer from magnetic interferences from a wide variety of sources. Magnetic interferences can be categorized into axial and radial type interferences. Axial interferences are mainly the result of magnetic poles from the drill string steel components located below and above the MWD tool. Radial interferences are numerous. Therefore, there is a risk that magXAxialCorUsed includes both Axial and radial corrections.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.CosagCorUsed
member.summary: WWas a Cosag Correction applied to the azimuth values? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0"). The BHA Sag Correction is the same as the Sag Correction except it includes the horizontal misalignment (Cosag).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.TrajectoryStation.MSACorUsed
member.summary: Was a correction applied to the survey due to a Multi-Station Analysis process? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StnTrajCorUsed.StnMagDeclUsed
member.summary: Magnetic declination used to correct a Magnetic North referenced azimuth to a True North azimuth. Magnetic declination angles are measured positive clockwise from True North to Magnetic North (or negative in the anti-clockwise direction). To convert a Magnetic azimuth to a True North azimuth, the magnetic declination should be added.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StnTrajCorUsed.StnGridCorUsed
member.summary: DEPRECATED - use stnGridConUsed. Grid Correction (Meridian convergence). The angle between True North and Grid North. Grid Correction is positive when True North is west of Grid North. The correction is added to the raw observation, thus yielding a reduced or corrected observation that can go into the subsequent calculations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StnTrajCorUsed.StnGridConUsed
member.summary: Magnetic declination used to correct a Magnetic North referenced azimuth to a True North azimuth. Magnetic declination angles are measured positive clockwise from True North to Magnetic North (or negative in the anti-clockwise direction). To convert a Magnetic azimuth to a True North azimuth, the magnetic declination should be added.

member.summary: Measured depth at top of interval.

member.summary: Measured depth at base of interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimReservoirInterval.LithFormationPermeability
member.summary: Formation permeability, a measurement of the ability of a fluid to flow through a rock. Commonly measured in milliDarcys (1m2 = 0.000000000000986923 Darcy).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimReservoirInterval.LithYoungsModulus
member.summary: Young's modulus (E) is a measure of the stiffness of an isotropic elastic material. It is also known as the Young modulus, modulus of elasticity, elastic modulus (though Young's modulus is actually one of several elastic moduli such as the bulk modulus and the shear modulus) or tensile modulus. It is defined as the ratio of the uniaxial stress over the uniaxial strain.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimReservoirInterval.LithPorePres
member.summary: Refers to the pressure of fluids held within a soil or rock, in gaps between particles formation porosity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimReservoirInterval.LithNetPluggedAndAbandonedyThickness
member.summary: Net pay is computed. It is the thickness of rock that can deliver hydrocarbons to the well bore formation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimReservoirInterval.LithName
member.summary: A name for the formation lithology.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimReservoirInterval.MDGrossPluggedAndAbandonedyTop
member.summary: Measured depth of the top of the formation.

member.summary: Measured depth of the bottom of the formation.

member.summary: The total thickness of the interval being treated, whether or not it is productive.

member.summary: The thickness of the most productive part of the interval. Net pay is a subset of the gross.

member.summary: The pore pressure of the net pay.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimReservoirInterval.NetPluggedAndAbandonedyFluidCompressibility
member.summary: The volume change of the fluid in the net pay when pressure is applied.

member.summary: With respect to the net pay, a measurement of the internal resistance of a fluid to flow against itself. Expressed as the ratio of shear stress to shear rate.

member.summary: The name used for the net pay zone.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimReservoirInterval.NetPluggedAndAbandonedyFormationPermeability
member.summary: The permeability of the net pay.

member.summary: The ratio of the relative contraction strain, or transverse strain (normal to the applied load), divided by the relative extension strain, or axial strain (in the direction of the applied load).

member.summary: Porosity of the net pay formation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.FractureClosePres
member.summary: The pressure at which the fracture effectively closes without proppant in place.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.FractureExtensionPres
member.summary: The fracture pressure limit for an unfractured formation is the fracture initiation pressure. This is typically considered the upper bound for the minimum horizontal stress or closure pressure. A step rate test is used to determine the fracture extension pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.NetPres
member.summary: The difference between the fracture extension pressure and the pressure that exists in the fracture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.PorePres
member.summary: The pressure of the liquids in the formation pores.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.PseudoRadialPres
member.summary: The Horner plot is used to determine if pseudo-radial flow developed during pressure decline. If a semi-log straight line is observed and the line can be extrapolated to a reasonable value of reservoir pressure, radial or pseudo-radial flow may be affecting the decline behavior. This suggests that the fracture is already closed and that data beyond the point of influence need not be considered in the evaluation of closure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.FractureLength
member.summary: Fracture length is the length of the fracture tip to tip; fracture half length, the length of one wing of a fracture from the wellbore to the tip.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.FractureWidth
member.summary: The width of a fracture at the wellbore. Hydraulic frac width is generated by frac fluid viscosity and/or pump rate (i.e., horsepower).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.FluidEfficiency
member.summary: A measurement, derived from a data frac, of the efficiency of a particular fluid in creating fracture area on a particular formation at a set of conditions.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.PdlCoef
member.summary: The pressure dependent leakoff coefficient.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.ResidualPermeability
member.summary: That permeability which remains after a fractured formation has closed, allowing the the formation fracture face to be pressurized before the fracture is mechanically reopened.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimFetTest.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.summary: In an injection step test, the injection rate at a particular pressure.

member.summary: The pressure of the step test.

member.summary: The flow of the fluid at the bottomhole.

member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimStepTest
member.summary: An injection test, plotted pressure against injection rate, where a curve deflection and change of slope indicates the fracture breakdown pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimStepTest.PresMeasurement
member.summary: A pressure and fluid rate data reading.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimStepTest.FractureExtensionPres
member.summary: The pressure necessary to extend the fracture once initiated. The fracture extension pressure may rise slightly with increasing fracture length and/or height because of friction pressure drop down the length of the fracture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimStepTest.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.summary: The pressure at which gas begins to break out of an under saturated oil and form a free gas phase in the matrix or a gas cap.

member.summary: The constant earth temperature at a given depth specific to a region.

member.summary: Static bottomhole temperature.

member.summary: Temperature of the fluid at the surface.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimPdatSession.FluidCompressibility
member.summary: The volume change of a fluid when pressure is applied.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimPdatSession.ReservoirTotalCompressibility
member.summary: The volume change of a reservoir material when pressure is applied.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimPdatSession.FluidNprimeFactor
member.summary: Power law component. As n decreases from 1, the fluid becomes more shear thinning. Reducing n produces more non-Newtonian behavior.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimPdatSession.FluidKprimeFactor
member.summary: The consistency index K is the shear stress or viscosity of the fluid at one sec-1 shear rate. An increasing K raises the effective viscosity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimPdatSession.FluidSpecificHeat
member.summary: The heat required to raise one unit mass of a substance by one degree.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimPdatSession.FluidThermalConductivity
member.summary: In physics, thermal conductivity is the property of a material describing its ability to conduct heat. It appears primarily in Fourier's Law for heat conduction. Thermal conductivity is measured in watts per kelvin-meter. Multiplied by a temperature difference (in kelvins) and an area (in square meters), and divided by a thickness (in meters), the thermal conductivity predicts the rate of energy loss (in watts) through a piece of material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimPdatSession.FluidThermalExpansionCoefficient
member.summary: Dimensional response to temperature change is expressed by its coefficient of thermal expansion. When the temperature of a substance changes, the energy that is stored in the intermolecular bonds between atoms changes. When the stored energy increases, so does the length of the molecular bonds. As a result, solids typically expand in response to heating and contract on cooling. The degree of expansion divided by the change in temperature is called the material's coefficient of thermal expansion and generally varies with temperature.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimPdatSession.FluidEfficiency
member.summary: A measurement, derived from a data frac, of the efficiency of a particular fluid in creating fracture area on a particular formation at a set of conditions.

member.summary: Foam quality percentage of foam for the job during the stimulation services.

member.summary: The volume of the pad divided by the (volume of the pad + the volume of the proppant laden fluid).

member.summary: The number of a stage associated with this diagnostics session.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimJobStage.MaxPmaxPluggedAndAbandonedcPres
member.summary: PMax prediction allows the tool assembly to be designed with expected pressures. It determines maximum allowable surface pressure and is typically calculated as a single number by which the pressure relief valves are set. This variable is the average of all the pmax pressures calculated for this stage.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimJobInterval.AveragegFractureWidth
member.summary: Average fracture width created during the treatment during the stimulation services.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimJobInterval.AveragegConductivity
member.summary: Average conductivity of fracture created during the treatment supported by proppant during the stimulation services Hydraulic conductivity, symbolically represented as K, is a property of vascular plants, soil or rock, that describes the ease with which water can move through pore spaces or fractures. It depends on the intrinsic permeability of the material and on the degree of saturation. Saturated hydraulic conductivity, Ksat, describes water movement through saturated media.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimJobInterval.NetPres
member.summary: The difference between the pressure which holds a fracture closed (minimal principal stress) and that pressure which is necessary to open the fracture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimJobInterval.ClosurePres
member.summary: An analysis parameter used in hydraulic fracture design to indicate the pressure at which the fracture effectively closes without proppant in place.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ComponentSchemas.StimJobInterval.ClosureDuration
member.summary: Delta time recorded for the closure of the fracture to occur during the stimulation services.
