member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType
member.summary: This class represents the StimAdditiveType xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.abrasive
member.summary: Substances used to wear away a surface by friction.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.accelerator
member.summary: An accelerator additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.activator
member.summary: An activator additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.alcohol
member.summary: An alcohol additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.biocide
member.summary: A biocide additive, is a chemical substance capable of killing living organisms and to protect them against biological infestation and growth.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.breaker
member.summary: A breaker additive, Chemicals used to reduce the viscosity of fracturing fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.buffer
member.summary: A buffer additive, A buffer solution is an aqueous solution consisting of a mixture of a weak acid and its conjugate base or a weak base and its conjugate acid. It has the property that the pH of the solution changes very little when a small amount of acid or base is added to it. Buffer solutions are used as a means of keeping pH at a nearly constant value in a wide variety of chemical applications.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.catalyst
member.summary: A material used in a process to activate a chemical reaction.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.clay
member.summary: Clay is a naturally occurring material composed primarily of fine-grained minerals, which show plasticity through a variable range of water content.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.crosslinker
member.summary: A crosslinker additive, The crosslinker reacts with the multiple-strand polymer to couple the molecules, creating a fluid of high, but closely controlled, viscosity.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.defoamer
member.summary: A defoaming agent.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.demulsifier
member.summary: A demulsifier additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.diluent
member.summary: A material used to dilute the base product.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.dispersant
member.summary: A dispersant agent.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.diverter
member.summary: A diverter agent.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.emulsifier
member.summary: An emulsifier agent.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.expander
member.summary: An expander agent.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.flocculant
member.summary: An anti-suspension agent. Used to "knock" solids out of suspension.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.foamer
member.summary: A foamer additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.gas
member.summary: Any general purpose gas.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.intensifier
member.summary: An additive that intensifies the activity of another.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.lubricant
member.summary: A lubricant additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.oxydizer
member.summary: An oxidizing agent, (also called an oxidant, oxidizer or oxidiser) can be defined as either: a chemical compound that readily transfers oxygen atoms, or a substance that gains electrons in a redox chemical reaction.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.polymer
member.summary: A polymer is a large molecule (macromolecule) composed of repeating structural units connected by covalent chemical bonds. A material used in cement and mud slurries as a friction reducer, gelling agent, viscosifier, suspending agent, or fluid loss control agent.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.retarder
member.summary: A retarder additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.salt
member.summary: A salt additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.sand
member.summary: Naturally occurring granular material composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.stabilizer
member.summary: A special additive, substance added to prevent unwanted change in state of another substance.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.surfactant
member.summary: A surfactant agent.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.tactifier
member.summary: A tackiness agent; a substance which is added in order to increase the stickiness of a compound.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.viscosifier
member.summary: A viscosifier additive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimAdditiveType.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType
member.summary: This class represents the StimStageType xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.acid
member.summary: A stage in which the fluid type is an acid.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.breakdown
member.summary: The case in which a rock matrix of an exposed formation fractures and allows fluid to be injected.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.circulate
member.summary: To pump fluid through the whole active fluid system.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.displacement
member.summary: A stage that displaces the existing fluid in the wellbore.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.diverter
member.summary: A stage used in stimulation treatments to ensure uniform injection over the area to be treated.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.flowback
member.summary: A stage in which fluids are allowed to flow from the well following a treatment in preparation for a later treatment or for returning the well to production.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.flush
member.summary: A stage in which a specially prepared fluid is used to displace preceeding treatments away from the wellbore.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.hydrajet
member.summary: A stage in which a specially prepared fluid is pumped through a jet.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.overflush
member.summary: A stage in which a specially prepared fluid is used to displace preceeding treatments away from the wellbore in excess of the normal flush volume.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.pad
member.summary: A stage which uses a specially prepared fluid generally preceeding a fracture stimulation treatment to propagate the initiated fracture.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.slurry
member.summary: A stage in which a mixture of suspended solids and liquids is pumped. A proppant laden fluid is also a slurry, but a slurry is not necessarily a proppant laden fluid.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.spacer
member.summary: A stage that provides a fluid cusion or separator between two dissimilar fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.treatment
member.summary: A stage used to identify fluid injection to the wellbore.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.other
member.summary: A stage of a known type not already listed here.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.StimStageType.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.LithostratigraphyUnit
member.summary: This class represents the LithostratigraphyUnit xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.LithostratigraphyUnit.group
member.summary: A succession of two or more contiguous or associated formations with significant and diagnostic lithologic properties in common. Formations need not be aggregated into groups unless doing so provides a useful means of simplifying stratigraphic classification in certain regions or certain intervals. Thickness of a stratigraphic succession is not a valid reason for defining a unit as a group rather than a formation. The component formations of a group need not be everywhere the same.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.LithostratigraphyUnit.formation
member.summary: The primary formal unit of lithostratigraphic classification. Formations are the only formal lithostratigraphic units into which the stratigraphic column everywhere should be divided completely on the basis of lithology. The contrast in lithology between formations required to justify their establishment varies with the complexity of the geology of a region and the detail needed for geologic mapping and to work out its geologic history. No formation is considered justifiable and useful that cannot be delineated at the scale of geologic mapping practiced in the region. The thickness of formations may range from less than a meter to several thousand meters.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.LithostratigraphyUnit.member
member.summary: The formal lithostratigraphic unit next in rank below a formation. It possesses lithologic properties distinguishing it from adjacent parts of the formation. No fixed standard is required for the extent and thickness of a member. A formation need not be divided into members unless a useful purpose is thus served. Some formations may be completely divided into members; others may have only certain parts designated as members. A member may extend from one formation to another.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.LithostratigraphyUnit.bed
member.summary: The smallest formal unit in the hierarchy of sedimentary lithostratigraphic units, e.g. a single stratum lithologically distinguishable from other layers above and below. Customarily only distinctive beds (key beds, marker beds) particularly useful for stratigraphic purposes are given proper names and considered formal lithostratigraphic units.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.ChronostratigraphyUnit
member.summary: This class represents the ChronostratigraphyUnit xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.ChronostratigraphyUnit.era
member.summary: Era is the geochronologic equivalent of an erathem. The names of erathems were chosen to reflect major changes of the development of life on the Earth: Paleozoic (old life), Mesozoic (intermediate life), and Cenozoic (recent life).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.ChronostratigraphyUnit.period
member.summary: Period is the geochronologic equivalent of a System. A system is a unit of major rank in the conventional chronostratigraphic hierarchy, above a series and below an erathem. The names of currently recognized systems are of diverse origin inherited from early classifications: some indicate chronologic position (Tertiary, Quaternary), others have lithologic connotation (Carboniferous, Cretaceous), others are tribal (Ordovician, Silurian) and still others are geographic (Devonian, Permian).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.ChronostratigraphyUnit.epoch
member.summary: Epoch is the geochronologic equivalent of a Series. The names of the currently recognized series are derived from their position within a system: lower, middle, upper.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML141.ReferenceData.ChronostratigraphyUnit.stage
member.summary: The stage has been called the basic working unit of chronostratigraphy because it is suited in scope and rank to the practical needs and purposes of intraregional chronostratigraphic classification. A stage is normally the lowest ranking unit in the chronostratigraphic hierarchy that can be recognized on a global scale.

member.summary: Information about the XML message instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystemList.DtsInstalledSystem
member.summary: Main wrapper for all the distributed temperature survey information about the installed system. Note that this can serve as a standalone object for messages that are not part of the WITSML server architecture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystemList.Version
member.summary: Data object schema version. The fourth level must match the version of the schema constraints (enumerations and XML loader files) that are assumed by the document instance.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo
member.summary: A schema to capture a set of data that is relevant for many exchange documents. It includes information about the file that was created, and high-level information about the data that is being exchanged within the file.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentName
member.summary: An identifier for the document. This is intended to be unique within the context of the NamingSystem.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentAlias
member.summary: Zero or more alternate names for the document. These names do not need to be unique within the naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentDate
member.summary: The date of the creation of the document. This is not the same as the date that the file was created. For this date, the document is considered to be the set of information associated with this document information. For example, the document may be a seismic binset. This represents the date that the binset was created. The FileCreation information would capture the date that the XML file was created to send or exchange the binset.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentClass
member.summary: A document class. Examples of classes would be a metadata classification or a set of keywords.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.FileCreationInformation
member.summary: The information about the creation of the exchange file. This is not about the creation of the data within the file, but the creation of the file itself.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.SecurityInformation
member.summary: Information about the security to be applied to this file. More than one classification can be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Disclaimer
member.summary: A free-form string that allows a disclaimer to accompany the information.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.AuditTrail
member.summary: A collection of events that can document the history of the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Owner
member.summary: The owner of the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.QueryPluggedAndAbandonedram
member.summary: WITSML query parameters.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Comment
member.summary: An optional comment about the document.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult
member.summary: A single result derived from analysis of formation tester data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult.Kind
member.summary: The kind of result represents a combination of test kind and analysis method applied.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult.Method
member.summary: The name of a proprietary method which generally represents a specialization of a result kind.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult.MDTop
member.summary: The top of the interval to which this result applies.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult.MDBottom
member.summary: The bottom of the interval to which this result applies.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult.TestData
member.summary: A reference to the formation tester data used to derive this result.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult.InputPluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: An input parameter to the analysis method.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult.OutputPluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: An output (result) parameter from the analysis of the test. The aggregate of parameters might represent something like the simulated response of the test, to compare with actual.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WftTestResult.InputResultRef
member.summary: A reference to an outputParameter of another result which was used as an input to this result. For a test result, the other result will be in the same test (i.e., ../result). For a station result, the other result will be in the same station (i.e., ../result) or will be a test result in the same station (../test/result) or will be an sampleAcquisition in the same station (i.e., ../sampleAcquisition/result). For a wftRun result, the other result will be in the same wftRun (i.e., ../result) or will be a result in a station (i.e., ../station/result) or will be a result in a station's test (i.e., ../station/test/result) or will be a result in a station's sampleAcquisition (i.e., ../station/sampleAcquisition/result). The "../result" notation means: starting in the parent node, traverse down to the appropriate child result using the provided pointers.

member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: WITSML - Extension values Schema. The intent is to allow standard WITSML "named" extensions without having to modify the schema. A client or server can ignore any name that it does not recognize but certain meta data is required in order to allow generic clients or servers to process the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Name
member.summary: The name of the extension. Each standard name should document the expected measure class. Each standard name should document the expected maximum size. For numeric values the size should be in terms of xsd types such as int, long, short, byte, float or double. For strings, the maximum length should be defined in number of characters. Local extensions to the list of standard names are allowed but it is strongly recommended that the names and definitions be approved by the WITSML SIG Technical Team before use.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Value
member.summary: The value of the extension. This may also include a uom attribute. The content should conform to constraints defined by the data type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.DataType
member.summary: The underlying XML type of the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.DateTime
member.summary: The date-time associated with the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.MD
member.summary: The measured depth associated with the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Index
member.summary: Indexes things with the same name. That is, 1 indicates the first one, 2 incidates the second one, etc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.MeasureClass
member.summary: The kind of the measure. For example, "length". This should be specified if the value requires a unit of measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionNameValue.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the extension.

member.summary: The maximum station depth within this WFT. This is an API "structural-range" query parameter for growing objects. See the relevant API specification for the query behavior related to this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftRun.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftRun.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WftRun.UidWellbore

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData
member.summary: WITSML - Common Data Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.SourceName
member.summary: An identifier to indicate the data originator. This identifies the server that originally created the object and thus most of the uids in the object (but not necessarily the uids of the parents). This is typically a url.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.DateTimeCreation
member.summary: When the data was created at the persistent data store. In a query template, a specified value will be interpreted by the server as a request for dTimCreation values that are greater-than the specified value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.DateTimeLastChange
member.summary: Last change of any element of the data at the persistent data store. The change time is not updated for a growing object while it is growing. In a query template, a specified value will be interpreted by the server as a request for dTimLastChange values that are greater-than the specified value. The dTimLastChange value may be changed by a client (user).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ItemState
member.summary: The item state for the data object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ServiceCategory
member.summary: The category of the service related to the creation of the object. For example, "mud log service", "cement service", "LWD service", "rig service", "drilling service". REALTIME STORE UNIQUE KEY: When accessed via the Store Interface, for each instance of realtime, the combination of "uidWell", "uidWellbore", "idSub" and commonData's "serviceCategory" must be unique. That is, the Store Interface will only retain one realtime for a particular wellbore, subscription and service with the REALTIME STORE UNIQUE KEY being the object selector.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.Comments
member.summary: Comments and remarks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.AcquisitionTimeZone
member.summary: The local time zone of the original acquisition date-time values. It is the deviation in hours and minutes from UTC. The first occurrence should be the actual local time zone at the start of acquisition and may represent a seasonally adjusted value such as daylight savings. The dTim attribute must be populated in the second and subsequent occurrences if the local time zone changes during acquisition. This knowledge is required because the original time zone in a dateTime value may be lost when software converts to a different time zone.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ExtensionAny
member.summary: Extensions to the schema using an xsd:any construct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CommonData.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.TimestampedTimeZone
member.summary: This class represents the timestampedTimeZone xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.TimestampedTimeZone.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time when this local time zone became active. This value must be defined on the second and subsequent occurrences.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ExtensionAny
member.summary: WITSML - Extension Schema. The intent is to allow standard WITSML schema extensions which will validate in older clients or servers. A client or server can ignore any schema that it does not recognize. New versions will modify specific elements to replace this type with a type that adds new elements, including another element with this type.

member.summary: condensate volumes measured during the well test.

member.summary: Condensate rates measured during the well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.GasOilRatio
member.summary: The ratio of the volume of gas and the volume of oil that was produced.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.WaterCut
member.summary: The ratio of water produced compared to the volume of total liquids produced.

member.summary: The density of the fluid mixture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.FluidVelocity
member.summary: The velocity of the overall fluid mixture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.CondensateYield
member.summary: This is the condensate yield, which describes the amount of condensate per unit of natural gas produced

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.BasicSedimentAndWater
member.summary: This is the measured of impurities present in crude oil as it comes from the well. BSandW content is commonly used as a measure for treating performance of hydrocarbon liquids

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.OilPotential
member.summary: This is the the potential of the well to produce crude oil. This represents the flow rate that could be achieved under maximum drawdown.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.GasPotential
member.summary: This is the potential of the well to produce natural gas. This represents the flow rate that could be achieved under maximum drawdown.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.SandVolume
member.summary: The volume of sand that was produced.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.AllocatedSplit
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that the the split factors are allocated as opposed to measured. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates otherwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.OilSplitFactor
member.summary: The split factor for Oil relative to the overall volume of the test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.GasSplitFactor
member.summary: The split factor for Gas relative to the overall volume of the test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.WaterSplitFactor
member.summary: The split factor for Water relative to the overall volume of the test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.CondensateSplitFactor
member.summary: The split factor for Condensate relative to the overall volume of the test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.ProductivityIndex
member.summary: Productivity Index (PI) is an expression which defines the pressure drop in the reservoir to produce a unit of oil per day. That is, the energy to produce a unit of oil. The value was defined at ambient temperature and pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestProductionTestResults.ProductivityIndexStdTempPres
member.summary: Productivity Index (PI) is an expression which defines the pressure drop in the reservoir to produce a unit of oil per day. That is, the energy to produce a unit of oil. The value has been converted to the declared conditions of standard temperature and pressure.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestSeparatorData
member.summary: Well test data gathered at the separator.

member.summary: The pressure measured at the separator during the well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestSeparatorData.SeparatorTemperature
member.summary: The temperature measured at the separator during the well test.

member.summary: Well test data gathered at points in the wellbore.

member.summary: The pressure at the point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.Temp
member.summary: The temperature at the point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.POverZ
member.summary: The P/Z value at the point. This is P/Z, pressure over gas compressibility factor (z). Note that the uom is units of pressure., since Z is dimensionless.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.MD
member.summary: The measured depth of the bottomhole.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.Wellbore
member.summary: Defines the wellbore (sidetract) represented by the measured depth. This must be given when the well has multiple wellbores and the measured depth value is deeper than the first kickoff point. It is recommended that it always be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.Bottomhole
member.summary: A value of true (1 or "true") indicates that the point is at the bottomhole. A value of false (0 or "false") or not given indicates otherwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellTestPointData.Static
member.summary: A value of true (1 or "true") indicates a static (non-flowing) pressure. A value of false (0 or "false") or not given indicates otherwise. The pressure may be measured (e.g., shut-in well) or calculated.

member.summary: The average frequency of the electric submersible pump (ESP) during the test. The presumption is that only one pump per well is operational during each test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The minimum time index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. That is, all wellTest for a well in the specified period defined by the min/max. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The maximum time index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.DateTimeCurrent
member.summary: The definition of the "current time" index for this object. The current time index is a server query parameter which requests the selection of a single node from a recurring set (e.g., the data related to one point in a time series). That is, the "most recent" (at or before the specified time) wellTest for a well. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.WellContext
member.summary: Contextual data about the well that was tested.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.TestDate
member.summary: The date-time of well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.PreviousTestDate
member.summary: The date-time of the previous well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.LastValidTest
member.summary: The date-time of the last valid well test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.TestReason
member.summary: The reason for the well test: initial, periodic, revision.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.TestType
member.summary: The type of well production test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.ChokeOrificeSize
member.summary: DEPRECATED: use productionTest/wellheadData/chokeOrificeSize or injectionTest/chokeOrificeSize. The size of the opening in the flow choke at the wellhead.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.ProductFlowPort
member.summary: A port on a Product Flow Unit that is represented by this test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.ProductFlowUnit
member.summary: The Product Flow Unit represented by the port. This is defined within the Product Flow Model

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.ProductFlowModel
member.summary: The Product Flow Model that represents the above Product Flow Unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.StandardTempPres
member.summary: Defines the standard temperature and pressure to which all standard volumes in this report have been corrected. This applies to all elements whose name is suffixed by StdTempPres.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.ValidationState
member.summary: The overall state of the test with respect to validation operations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.ValidationOperatingeration
member.summary: Defines the results of one validation operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.InjectionTest
member.summary: Data from an injection test. Multiple tests generally indicate that there are multiple components of the overall test. For example, for multi-zoned wells.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.FluidLevelTest
member.summary: Data from a fluid level test.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.ProductionTest
member.summary: Data from a production test. Multiple tests generally indicate that there are multiple components of a single overall test. For example, for multi-zoned wells.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.WellTest.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQualifiedDateTime
member.summary: This class represents the endpointQualifiedDateTime xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQualifiedDateTime.EndpointSurrogate
member.summary: The default is "inclusive".

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellContext
member.summary: Within the context of a WITSML Server, this data should duplicate the equivalent information in the well object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.Field
member.summary: Name of the field in which the well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.WellAlias
member.summary: An alias name associated with the well. If the wellName is associated with a naming system then it should be included in this list.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.WellDatum
member.summary: A datum to which elevations and depths are referenced.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.FluidWell
member.summary: POSC well fluid. The type of fluid being produced from or injected into a well facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellContext.DirectionWell
member.summary: POSC well direction. The direction of flow of the fluids in a well facility (generally, injected or produced, or some combination).

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum
member.summary: Defines the vertical datums associated with elevation, vertical depth and measured depth coordinates within the context of a well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Name
member.summary: The human understandable contextual name of the reference datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Code
member.summary: The code value that represents the type of reference datum. This may represent a point on a device (e.g., kelly bushing) or it may represent a vertical reference datum (e.g., mean sea level).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DatumCRS
member.summary: A reference to the coordinateReferenceSystem object representing the vertical reference datum (i.e., this wellDatum). This should only be specified if the above 'code' represents some variation of sea level.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DatumName
member.summary: The name of the vertical reference datum in a particular naming system. This should only be specified if the above 'code' represents some variation of sea level. An optional short name (code) can also be specified. Specifying a well known datum is highly desired if the above code is a variant of sea level because sea level varies over time and space. An example would be to specify a name of 'Caspian Sea' with a code of '5106' in the 'EPSG' naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Kind
member.summary: Since various activities may use different points as measurement datums, it is useful to characterize the point based on its usage. A well reference datum may have more than one such characterization. For example, it may be the datum used by the driller and logger for measuring their depths. Example usage values would be 'permanent','driller', 'logger' 'WRP' (well reference point) and 'SRP' (site reference point).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Wellbore
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the reference datum. This should be specified if a measured depth is given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Rig
member.summary: A pointer to the rig that contains the device used as a reference datum. The rig may be associated with a wellbore in another well (e.g., pattern drilling using a rig on a track).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Elevation
member.summary: The gravity based elevation coordinate of this reference datum as measured from another datum. Positive moving upward from the elevation datum. An elevation should be given unless this is a vertical reference datum (e.g., sea level).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.MeasuredDepth
member.summary: The measured depth coordinate of this reference datum as measured from another datum. The measured depth datum should either be the same as the elevation datum or it should be relatable to the elevation datum through other datums. Positive moving toward the bottomhole from the measured depth datum. This should be given when a local reference is "downhole", such as a kickoff point or ocean bottom template, and the borehole may not be vertical. If a Depth is given then an Elevation should also be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.HorizontalLocation
member.summary: The horizontal location of the point being used as a well datum. This may be used when the point is not directly above or below the well point location. For example, a well being drilled from a platform may have its location at the entrance into the sea floor, while the well datum may be located on the drilling rig. Or the well datum may be a kickoff point, that is not directly under the well surface point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Comment
member.summary: A contextual description of the well reference datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultMeasuredDepth
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for measured depth coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Measured depth coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to this default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default measured depth datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultVerticalDepth
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for vertical depth coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Vertical depth coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to the default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default vertical depth datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultElevation
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for elevation coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Elevation coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to the default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default elevation datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct
member.summary: This class represents the wellKnownNameStruct xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct.NamingSystem
member.summary: The naming system within the name is unique.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.WellKnownNameStruct.Code
member.summary: A unique (short) code associated with the name.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore
member.summary: Data that represents a foreign key to a wellbore. The wellbore may be defined within the context of another well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore.WellboreReference
member.summary: A pointer the wellbore with which there is a relationship.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore.WellPluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the well that contains the wellboreReference. This is not needed unless the referenced wellbore is outside the context of a common parent well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig
member.summary: A reference to a rig within a wellbore. The wellbore may be defined within the context of another well. This value represents a foreign key from one node to another.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.RigReference
member.summary: A pointer to the rig with which there is a relationship.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.WellborePluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the rigReference. This is not needed unless the referenced rig is outside the context of a common parent wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.WellPluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the well that contains the wellboreParent. This is not needed unless the referenced wellbore is outside the context of a common parent well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location
member.summary: WITSML Location Component Schema This is a location that is expressed in terms of 2D coordinates. In order that the location be understood, the coordinate reference system (CRS) must be known. The survey location is given by a pair of tagged values. The pairs may be: (1) latitude/longitude, (2) easting/northing, (3) westing/southing, (4) projectedX/projectedY, or (5) localX/localY. The appropriate pair must be chosen for the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.WellCRS
member.summary: A pointer to the wellCRS that defines the CRS for the coordinates. While optional, it is strongly recommended that this be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude with north being positive. If you set this property, you must also set Longitude.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude with east being positive. If you set this property, you must also set Latitude.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.Easting
member.summary: The projected coordinate with east being positive. This is the most common type of projected coordinates. UTM coordinates are expressed in Easting and Northing. If you set this property, you must also set Northing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.Northing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with north being positive. This is the most common type of projected coordinates. UTM coordinates are expressed in Easting and Northing. If you set this property, you must also set Easting.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.Westing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with west being positive. The positive directions are reversed from the usual Easting and Northing values. These values are generally located in the southern hemisphere, most notably in South Africa and Australia. If you set this property, you must also set Southing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.Southing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with south being positive. The positive directions are reversed from the usual Easting and Northing values. These values are generally located in the southern hemisphere, most notably in South Africa and Australia. If you set this property, you must also set Westing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.ProjectedX
member.summary: The projected X coordinate with the positive direction unknown. ProjectedX and ProjectedY are used when it is not known what the meaning of the coordinates is. If the meaning is known, the Easting/Northing or Westing/Southing should be used. Use of this pair implies a lack of knowledge on the part of the sender. If you set this property, you must also set ProjectedY.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.ProjectedY
member.summary: The projected Y coordinate with the positive direction unknown. ProjectedX and ProjectedY are used when it is not known what the meaning of the coordinates is. If the meaning is known, the Easting/Northing or Westing/Southing should be used. Use of this pair implies a lack of knowledge on the part of the sender. If you set this property, you must also set ProjectedX.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.LocalX
member.summary: The local (engineering) X coordinate. The CRS will define the orientation of the axis. If you set this property, you must also set LocalY.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.LocalY
member.summary: The local (engineering) Y coordinate. The CRS will define the orientation of the axis. If you set this property, you must also set LocalX.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.Original
member.summary: Flag indicating (if "true" or "1") that this pair of values was the original data given for the location. If the pair of values was calculated from an original pair of values, this flag should be "false" (or "0"), or not present.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.Description
member.summary: A Comment, generally given to help the reader interpret the coordinates if the CRS and the chosen pair do not make them clear.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.Location.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQuantity
member.summary: This class represents the endpointQuantity xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQuantity.EndpointSurrogate
member.summary: Defines the semantics (inclusive or exclusive) of the endpoint within the context of the interval.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesThreshold
member.summary: Defines a value threshold window and the cumulative time duration that the data was within that window.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesThreshold.ThresholdMinimum
member.summary: The lower bound of the threshold for testing whether values are within a specific range. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value. At least one of minimumValue and maximumValue must be specified. The thresholdMinimum must be less than thresholdMaximum. If thresholdMinimum is not specified then the minimum shall be assumed to be minus infinity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesThreshold.ThresholdMaximum
member.summary: The upper bound of the threshold for testing whether values are within a specific range. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value. At least one of minimumValue and maximumValue must be specified. The thresholdMaximum must be greater than thresholdMinimum. If thresholdMaximum is not specified then the maximum shall be assumed to be plus infinity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.TimeSeriesThreshold.Duration
member.summary: The sum of the time intervals over the range of dTimMin to dTimMax during which the values were within the specified threshold range.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EndpointDateTime
member.summary: This class represents the endpointDateTime xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EndpointDateTime.EndpointSurrogate
member.summary: Defines the semantics (inclusive or exclusive) of the endpoint within the context of the interval.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic
member.summary: The non-contextual content of WITSML statistics about a range of time series data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the time series.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Key
member.summary: A keyword value pair which characterizes the underlying nature of this value. The key value may provide part of the unique identity of an instance of a concept or it may characterize the underlying concept. The key value will be defined within the specified keyword naming system. This is essentially a classification of the data in the specified system (keyword).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Unit
member.summary: If the time series is a measure then this specifies the unit of measure. The unit acronym must be chosen from the list that is valid for the measure class. If this is specified then the measure class must be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.MeasureClass
member.summary: Defines the type of measure that the time series represents. If this is specified then unit must be specified. This may be redundant to some information in the keys but it is important for allowing an application to understand the nature of a measure value even if it does not understand all of the underlying nature.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Comment
member.summary: A comment about the time series.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The lower bound of the analyzed time range. Only data within the range was included in the analysis. The endpoint attribute specifies whether the data was inclusive or exclusive of this point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The upper bound of the analyzed time range. Only data within the range was included in the analysis. The endpoint attribute specifies whether the data was inclusive or exclusive of this point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum value within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum value within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Sum
member.summary: The sum of all values within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Mean
member.summary: The arithmetic mean (sum divided by count) of all values within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.Median
member.summary: The median value of all values within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.StandardDeviation
member.summary: The standard deviation of all values within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax. Element "unit" defines the unit of measure of this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.TimeAtThreshold
member.summary: Defines a value threshold window and the time duration where values (within the time range of dTimMin to dTimMax) were within that window.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.TimeSeriesStatistic.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.summary: This class represents the keywordValueStruct xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.KeywordValueStruct.KeywordSurrogate
member.summary: The keyword within which the value is unique. The concept of a keyword is very close to the concept of a classification system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.VolumeValue
member.summary: The volume of the fluid, possibly corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure. Different volumes may be defined at different conditions but they should all represent the same mass of material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.SampleAnalysisResult
member.summary: A pointer to a fluid sample analysis result object that is relevant to the balance. This sample may have been acquired previous to or after this period and is used for determining the allocated characteristics.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.ComponentContent
member.summary: The relative amount of a component product in the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBalanceDetail.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue
member.summary: A possibly temperature and pressure corrected volume value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.Volume
member.summary: The volume of the product. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.GrossCAlorificValue
member.summary: The amount of heat which would be released by the complete combustion in air of the above volume of product. This is considered to be a condition of measurement (i.e., the volume may have been converted to this condition).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.Temp
member.summary: The temperature to which the volume has been corrected. If given, then a pressure must also be given. Common standard temperatures are: 0 degC, 15 degC, 60 degF. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Pres.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.Pres
member.summary: The pressure to which the volume has been corrected. If given, then a temperature must also be given. Common standard pressures are: 1 atm and 14.696 psi (which are equivalent). If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Temp.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.StandardTempPres
member.summary: Defines the standard temperature and pressure to which the volume has been corrected. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the procuctVolume root.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.VolumeValue.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeComponentContent
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Component Content Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeComponentContent.Kind
member.summary: The type of product whose relative content is being described. This should be a specific component (e.g., water) rather than a phase (e.g., aqueous).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeComponentContent.ReferenceKind
member.summary: The type of product to which the product is being compared. If not given then the product is being compared against the overall flow stream.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeComponentContent.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue
member.summary: A possibly temperature and pressure corrected flow rate value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.FlowRate
member.summary: The flow rate of the product. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.Temp
member.summary: The temperature to which the flowRate has been corrected. If given, then a pressure must also be given. Common standard temperatures are: 0 degC, 15 degC, 60 degF. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Pres.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.Pres
member.summary: The pressure to which the flowRate has been corrected. If given, then a temperature must also be given. Common standard pressures are: 1 atm and 14.696 psi (which are equivalent). If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Temp.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FlowRateValue.StandardTempPres
member.summary: Defines the standard temperature and pressure to which the flowRate has been corrected. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the procuctVolume root.

member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference
member.summary: This class represents the cs_productVolumePortDifference xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.Port
member.summary: A port on the other end of an internal connection. This should always be specified if a Product Flow Network is being referenced by this report. If this is not specified then there is an assumption that there is only one other port for the unit. For example, if this end of the connection represents an inlet port then the implied other end is the outlet port for the unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.PresDiff
member.summary: The differential pressure between the ports.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.TempDiff
member.summary: The differential temperature between the ports.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.ChokeSize
member.summary: The size of the choke. This characterizes the overall unit with respect to the flow restriction between the ports. The restriction might be implemented using a valve or an actual choke.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.ChokeRelative
member.summary: The relative size of the choke restriction. This characterizes the overall unit with respect to the flow restriction between the ports. The restriction might be implemented using a valve or an actual choke.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePortDifference.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.summary: The density of the product.

If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Pres.

If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the productVolume root. If you set this property, you must also set Temp.

member.summary: Defines the standard temperature and pressure to which the density has been corrected. If neither standardTempPres nor temp,pres are specified then the standard condition is defined by standardTempPres at the procuctVolume root.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateTimeStart

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateTimeEnd

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateStart

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumePeriod.DateEnd

member.summary: The beginning date and time that the period represents.

member.summary: An XPATH to the target value within the message containing this XPATH value.

member.summary: The level of the alert.
