member.summary: This class represents the cs_refProductFlow xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefProductFlow.ReferencedFlow
member.summary: A pointer to the flow within the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RefProductFlow.PluggedAndAbandonedrentfacility
member.summary: A pointer to the facility that contains the flow.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Product Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.Kind
member.summary: The type of product that is being reported.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.Name
member.summary: The name of product that is being reported. This is reserved for generic kinds like chemical.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.SplitFactor
member.summary: This factor describes the fraction of fluid in the source flow that is allocated to this product stream. The volumes reported here are derived from the source flow based on this split factor. This should be an allocation flow.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.SourceFlow
member.summary: A reference to the source flow whose volumes are used to determine the volumes within this target product stream based on the split factor.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.ComponentContent
member.summary: The relative amount of a component product in the product stream.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.Period
member.summary: Product amounts for a specific period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.Comment
member.summary: A (possibly timstamped) remark about the product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeProduct.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility
member.summary: WITSML - Report Facility Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Name
member.summary: The name of the facility. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This can also define the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent1
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent2
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility of parent1. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Kind
member.summary: A kind of facility where the specific name is not relevant.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Port
member.summary: The Product Flow Port associated with the Product Flow Unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Unit
member.summary: The Product Flow Unit representing the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeRelatedFacility.Network
member.summary: The Product Flow Network representing the facility. This is only required if the network is not the same as the primary network that represents the Product Flow Model. This must be unique within the context of the Product Flow Model represented by this report.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FacilityIdentifierStruct
member.summary: This class represents the facilityIdentifierStruct xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FacilityIdentifierStruct.KindSurrogate
member.summary: The kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FacilityIdentifierStruct.NamingSystem
member.summary: The naming system within which the name is unique. For example, API or NPD.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.FacilityIdentifierStruct.UidRef
member.summary: If the facility is defined and instantiated within the context of a WITSML server, this is a pointer to the uid value of that object instance.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Flow Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Name
member.summary: The name of this flow within the context of this report. This might reflect some combination of the kind of flow, port, qualifier and related facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Kind
member.summary: Indicates the type of flow that is being reported. The type of flow is an indication of the overall source or target of the flow. A production flow has one or more wells as the originating source. An injection flow has one or more wells as the ultimate target. An import flow has an offsite source. An export flow has an offiste target. A consumption flow generally has a kind of equipment as a target.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Port
member.summary: The Product Flow Port to which the flow is assigned. This is the port on the Product Flow Unit that represents the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Direction
member.summary: The kind of port that this flow represents: inlet or outlet.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Facility
member.summary: The name of the facility represented by the port where the measurements were taken. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.FacilityAlias
member.summary: An alternatative name of a facility represented by the port. This is generally unique within a naming system. The above contextually unique name (that is, within the context of a parent) should also be listed as an alias.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Qualifier
member.summary: Qualifies the type of flow that is being reported.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.SubQualifier
member.summary: Defines a specialization of the qualifier value. This should only be given if a qualifier is given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.RelatedFacility
member.summary: A second facility related to this flow. For a production flow, this would represent a role of 'produced for'. For an import flow, this would represent a role of 'inport from'. For an export flow, this would represent a role of 'export to'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Version
member.summary: A timestamp representing the version of this data. A flow (same port and products) with a more recent timestamp will represent the "current" version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.VersionSource
member.summary: Identifies the source of the version. This will commonly be the name of the software which created the version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.SourceFlow
member.summary: This is a pointer to the flow from which this flow was derived.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Product
member.summary: Reports a product flow stream.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.Comment
member.summary: A timestamped remark about the flow.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFlow.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.IntegerQualifiedCount
member.summary: This class represents the integerQualifiedCount xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.IntegerQualifiedCount.StatusSurrogate
member.summary: An indicator of the quality of the value.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.KindQualifiedString
member.summary: This class represents the kindQualifiedString xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.KindQualifiedString.StatusSurrogate
member.summary: An indicator of the quality of the value.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveData
member.summary: This class represents the cs_curveData xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveData.Index
member.summary: The value of an independent (index) variable in a row of the curve table. The units of measure are specified in the curve definition. The first value corresponds to order=1 for colums where isIndex is true. The second to order=2. And so on. The number of index and data values must match the number of columns in the table.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveData.Value
member.summary: The value of a dependent (data) variable in a row of the curve table. The units of measure are specified in the curve definition. The first value corresponds to order=1 for columns where isIndex is false. The second to order=2. And so on. The number of index and data values must match the number of columns in the table.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue
member.summary: WITSML - Parameter Value Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time at which the parameter applies. If no time is specified then the value is static.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The date and time at which the parameter no longer applies. The "active" time interval is inclusive of this point. If dTimEnd is given then dTim shall also be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.IntegerValue
member.summary: An integer value. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.StringValue
member.summary: A string value. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.MeasureValue
member.summary: A measure value. Unless the parameter is defined as a tuple, only one value should be specified. The measure class is defined by measureClass in the parent set. The unit of measure must conform to the units allowed by the measure class in the unit dictionary file. If the 'status' attribute is absent and the value is not "NaN", the data value can be assumed to be good with no restrictions. A value of "NaN" should be interpreted as null and should be not be given unless a status is also specified to explain why it is null.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.CurveValue
member.summary: The values in one row of a curve. The aggregate of the curve rows represent the curve.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.Port
member.summary: A port related to the parameter. If a port is given then the corresponding unit usually must be given. For example, an "offset along network" parameter must specify a port from which the offset was measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.Unit
member.summary: A unit related to the parameter. For example, an "offset along network" parameter must specify a port (on a unit) from which the offset was measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.Alert
member.summary: An indication of some sort of abnormal condition relative this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterValue.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition
member.summary: The definition of a curve.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.Order
member.summary: The order of the value in the index or data tuple. If isIndex is true this is the order of the (independent) index element. If isIndex is false, this is the order of the (dependent) value element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: The name of the variable in this curve.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.IsIndex
member.summary: True (equal "1" or "true") indicates that this is an independent variable in this curve. At least one column column should be flagged as independent.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.MeasureClass
member.summary: The measure class of the variable. This defines which units of measure are valid for the value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.Unit
member.summary: The unit of measure of the variable. The unit of measure must match a unit allowed by the measure class.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.CurveDefinition.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume Facility Parameter Set Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Name
member.summary: The name of the facility parameter. This should reflect the business semantics of all values in the set and not the underlying kind. For example, specify "diameter" rather than "length" or "distance".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.ChildFacilityIdentifier
member.summary: The "PRODML Relative Identifier" of a child of the parent facility. The idenfifier path is presumed to begin with the identity of the parent facility. This identifies a sub-facility which is identified within the context of the parent facilityParent2/facilityParent1/name identification hierarchy.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Port
member.summary: The port to which this parameter is assigned. This must be a port on the unit representing the parent facility of this parameter. If not specified then the parameter represents the unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.MeasureClass
member.summary: If the value is a measure (value with unit of measure), this defines the measurement class of the value. The units of measure for the value must conform to the list allowed by the measurement class in the unit dictionary file. Mutually exclusive with curveDefinition.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.CurveDefinition
member.summary: If the value is a curve, this defines the meaning of the one column in the table representing the curve. Mutually exclusive with measureClass.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Qualifier
member.summary: Qualifies the type of parameter that is being reported.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.SubQualifier
member.summary: Defines a specialization of the qualifier value. This should only be given if a qualifier is given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Version
member.summary: A timestamp representing the version of this data. A parameter set with a more recent timestamp will represent the "current" version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.VersionSource
member.summary: Identifies the source of the version. This will commonly be the name of the software which created the version.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Product
member.summary: The type of product that is being reported. This would be useful for something like specifying a tank procuct volume or level.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.PeriodKind
member.summary: The type of period that is being reported.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: A parameter value, possibly at a time. If a time is not given then only one parameter should be given. If a time is specified with one value then time should be specified for all values. Each value in a time series should be of the same underling kind of value (for example, a length measure).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.Comment
member.summary: A comment about the parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeParameterSet.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility
member.summary: WITSML - Report Facility Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Name
member.summary: The name of the facility. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent1
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility. For example, if name represents a completion, then facilityParent1 would represent the name of the well within which name was unique. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent2
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility of parent1. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.FacilityAlias
member.summary: An alternatative name of a facility. This is generally unique within a naming system. The above contextually unique name (that is, within the context of a parent) should also be listed as an alias.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Unit
member.summary: The Product Flow Unit representing the facility. This must be unique within the context of the Product Flow Network.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Network
member.summary: The Product Flow Network representing the facility. This can only be given if unit is given. This is only required if the network is not the same as the primary network that represents the Product Flow Model. This must be unique within the context of the Product Flow Model represented by this report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.ContextFacility
member.summary: The name and type of a facility whose context is relevant to this facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.StatusWell
member.summary: The status of the well. In PRODML, the value of "active -- injecting" has been DEPRECATED. Instead, use "active" with wellProducing=true. In PRODML, the value of "active -- producing" has been DEPRECATED. Instead, use "active" with wellInjecting=true.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.FluidWell
member.summary: POSC well fluid. The type of fluid being produced from or injected into a well facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.OperatingMethod
member.summary: The lift method being used to operate the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.WellProducing
member.summary: True (or 1) indicates that the well is producing. False (or 0) or not given indicates that the well is not producing. This only applies if the facility is a well or wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.WellInjecting
member.summary: True (or 1) indicates that the well is injecting. False (or 0) or not given indicates that the well is not injecting. This only applies if the facility is a well or wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Capacity
member.summary: The storage capacity of the facility (e.g., a tank).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.OperatingerationTime
member.summary: The amount of time that the facility was active during the reporting period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.DowntimeReason
member.summary: The reason for any down time during the reporting period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.PluggedAndAbandonedrameterSet
member.summary: Usage values for one parameter associated with the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Flow
member.summary: Reports a flow of a product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.Comment
member.summary: A timestamped remark about the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeFacility.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessAccountInfo
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume component schema for defining account information.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessAccountInfo.AccountId
member.summary: The identifier of the account of the sub-unit within the whole business unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessAccountInfo.Product
member.summary: The product associated with the account identifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessAccountInfo.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessOwnershipShare
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume component schema for defining ownership shares.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessOwnershipShare.Share
member.summary: The percent ownership of the sub-unit in the unit during the specified time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessOwnershipShare.StartDate
member.summary: The date on which the ownership became valid.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessOwnershipShare.EndDate
member.summary: The final date on which the ownership was valid. If no end date is specified, the share is considered to still be valid.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessOwnershipShare.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessSubUnit
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume component schema for defining ownership shares of business units.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessSubUnit.Kind
member.summary: Points to business unit which is part of another business unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessSubUnit.AccountInformation
member.summary: Defines account information in the parent unit. This commonly applies at a parent terminus unit (e.g., a terminal),

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessSubUnit.OwnershipShare
member.summary: Defines the ownership share in the parent unit at a point in time. This commonly applies at a parent source unit (e.g., a field or platform).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessSubUnit.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessUnit
member.summary: WITSML - Product Volume component schema for defining business units.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessUnit.Kind
member.summary: The type of business unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessUnit.Name
member.summary: The human contextual name of the business unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessUnit.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the business unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessUnit.SubUnit
member.summary: A component part of the unit. The composition of a unit may vary with time. This defines the ownership share or account information for a sub unit within the context of the whole unit. For ownership shares, at any one point in time the sum of the shares should be 100%.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductVolumeBusinessUnit.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume
member.summary: The non-contextual content of a WITSML Product Volume object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the Product Volume Report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.Installation
member.summary: The name of the facility which is represented by this report. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.ContextFacility
member.summary: The name and type of a facility whose context is relevant to the represented installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.Kind
member.summary: The type of report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.PeriodKind
member.summary: The type of period that is being reported. This value must be consistent with the reporting start and end values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.DateTimeStart
member.summary: The beginning date and time that the report represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateTimeEnd.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The ending date and time that the report represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateTimeStart.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.DateStart
member.summary: The beginning date that the report represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateEnd.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.DateEnd
member.summary: The ending date that the report represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateStart.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.Month
member.summary: The ending date that the report represents.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The minimum time index contained within the report. For the purposes of this parameter, a "period" or "facility parameter" without any time data should be assumed to have the time associated with the overall report. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The maximum time index contained within the report. For the purposes of this parameter, a "period" or "facility parameter" without any time data should be assumed to have the time associated with the overall report. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.DateTimeCurrent
member.summary: The definition of the "current time" index for this report. The current time index is a server query parameter which requests the selection of a single node from a recurring "period" set (e.g., the data related to one point in a time series). For the purposes of this parameter, a "period" without any time data should be assumed to have the time associated with the overall report. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.CAlculationMethod
member.summary: The calculation method for for "filling in" values in an indexed set. If not given, the default is that no calculations are performed to create data where none exists within an existing set. This is not to be construed as to prevent concepts such as simulation and forcasting from being applied in order to create a new set. This is a server query parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.Operator
member.summary: The operator of the facilities in the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.Title
member.summary: The tile of the report if different from the name of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.GeographicContext
member.summary: The geographic context of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.IssueDate
member.summary: The date that the report was issued.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.IssuedBy
member.summary: The person or company that issued the report. This may contain the role of the person or company within the context of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.ApprovalDate
member.summary: The date that the report was approved.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.Approver
member.summary: The person or company that approved the report. This may contain the role of the person or company within the context of the report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.ProductFlowModel
member.summary: The Product Flow Model for the overall installation. This model represents all Product Flow Units referenced within this report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.StandardTempPres
member.summary: Defines the default standard temperature and pressure to which all volumes, densities and flow rates in this report have been corrected. The default may be locally overridden for an individual value. If not specified, then the conditions must be presumed to be ambient conditions (i.e., uncorrected) unless otherwise specified at a local level.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.BusinessUnit
member.summary: A business unit and related account or ownership share information.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.Facility
member.summary: A facility for which product information is being reported.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductVolume.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate
member.summary: The business associate describes any company, person, group, consultant, etc, which is associated within a context (e.g., a well). The information contained in this module is: (1) contact information, such as address, phone numbers, email, (2) alternate name, or aliases, and (3) associations, such as the business associate that this one is associated with, or a contact who is associated with this business associate.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.Name
member.summary: The name of the business associate. This can be the name of a person, business, group, etc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.Role
member.summary: The role of the business associate within the context. For example, "driller" or "operator", "lead agency - CEQA compliance" "regulatory contact", "safety contact". A business associate will generally have one role but the role may be called different things in different naming systems.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.PersonName
member.summary: If the business associate is a person, this specifies the component names of the person.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.Alias
member.summary: The alias is an alternate name of a business associate. It is generally associated with a naming system. An alias is not necessarily unique within the naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.Address
member.summary: Note that address may occur more than once, because it may be necessary to give a physical address, a mailing address, or both.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.PHoneNumber
member.summary: The various types of phone numbers may be given. The may be office or home, they may be a number for a cell phone, or for a fax, etc. Attributes of PhoneNumber declare the type of phone number that is being given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.Email
member.summary: The email address may be home, office, or permanent. More than one may be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.ContactPreference
member.summary: The preferred method of being contacted within the context of this role.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.AssociatedWith
member.summary: A pointer to another business associate that this business associate is associated with. The most common situation is that of an employee being associated with a company. But it may also be, for example, a work group associated with a university.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.Contact
member.summary: A pointer to a business associate (generally a person) who serves as a contact for this business associate.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.PersonnelCount
member.summary: The count of the number of personnel in a group.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.BusinessAssociate.Comment
member.summary: A general comment. This should not be used to carry semantic information. This is not intended to be machine interpretable.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PersonName
member.summary: This class represents the cs_personName xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PersonName.Prefix
member.summary: A name prefix. Such as, Dr, Ms, Miss, Mr, etc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PersonName.First
member.summary: The persons first name.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PersonName.Middle
member.summary: The persons middle name or initial name.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PersonName.Last
member.summary: The persons last or given name.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PersonName.Suffix
member.summary: A name suffix. Such as Esq, Phd, etc.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeneralAddress
member.summary: An general address structure. This form is appropriate for most countries.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeneralAddress.Country
member.summary: The Country may be included. Although this is optional, it is probably required for most uses.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeneralAddress.PostalCode
member.summary: A postal code, if appropriate for the country. In the USA this would be the five or nine digit zip code.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeneralAddress.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeneralAddress.KindSurrogate
member.summary: The type of address: mailing, physical, or both.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PhoneNumberStruct
member.summary: This class represents the phoneNumberStruct xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PhoneNumberStruct.TypeSurrogate
member.summary: The kind of phone such as voice or fax.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PhoneNumberStruct.QualifierSurrogate
member.summary: Indicates whether the number is personal, business or both.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.PhoneNumberStruct.Extension
member.summary: The phone number extension.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EmailQualifierStruct
member.summary: This class represents the emailQualifierStruct xsd type.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeographicContext
member.summary: A geographic context of a report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeographicContext.Country
member.summary: The name of the country.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeographicContext.State
member.summary: The state of province within the country.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeographicContext.Field
member.summary: The name of the field within whose context the report exists.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeographicContext.OffshoreLocation
member.summary: An offshore context.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.GeographicContext.Comment
member.summary: An general comment that further explains the offshore location.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.OffshoreLocation
member.summary: A generic type of offshore location. This allows an offshore location to be given by an Area Name, and up to four block names. A comment is also allowed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.OffshoreLocation.AreaName
member.summary: A general meaning of Area. It may be as general as 'UK North Sea' or 'Viosca Knoll'. The user community must agree on the meaning of this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.OffshoreLocation.BlockID
member.summary: A block ID that can more tightly locate the object. The BlockID should be an identifying name or code. The user community for an area must agree on the exact meaning of this element. An aggregate of increasingly specialized block IDs are sometimes necessary to define the location.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.OffshoreLocation.NorthSeaOffshore
member.summary: An offshore location using the North Sea Offshore terminology.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.OffshoreLocation.Comment
member.summary: An general comment that further explains the offshore location.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NorthSeaOffshore
member.summary: A type of offshore location that captures the North Sea Offshore terminology.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NorthSeaOffshore.AreaName
member.summary: An optional, uncontrolled value, which may be used to describe the general area of offshore North Sea in which the point is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NorthSeaOffshore.Quadrant
member.summary: The number or letter of the quadrant in the North Sea.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NorthSeaOffshore.BlockSuffix
member.summary: A lower case letter assigned if a block is subdivided.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationOperationalComment
member.summary: WITSML - Operational Comments Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationOperationalComment.Type
member.summary: The kind of operation

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationOperationalComment.DateTimeStart
member.summary: The beginning date and time that the comment represents.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationOperationalComment.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The ending date and time that the comment represents.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationOperationalComment.Comment
member.summary: A comment about the operation and/or the activities within the operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationOperationalComment.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation
member.summary: Infomation about a cargo ship operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.VesselName
member.summary: Name of the cargo vessel for the installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.DateTimeStart
member.summary: The date and time that the vessel arrived.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The date and time that the vessel left.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.Captain
member.summary: Name of the captain of the vessel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.CArgoNumber
member.summary: the cargo identifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.CArgoBatchNumber
member.summary: The cargo batch number. Used if the vessel needs to temporarily disconnect for some reason (e.g., weather).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.CArgo
member.summary: Description of cargo on the vessel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.OilGrossStdTempPres
member.summary: Gross oil loaded to the ship during the report period. Gross oil includes BS and W. This volume has been corrected to standard conditions of temperature and pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.OilGrossTotalStdTempPres
member.summary: Gross oil loaded to the ship in total during the operation. Gross oil includes BS and W. This volume has been corrected to standard conditions of temperature and pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.OilNetStdTempPres
member.summary: Net oil loaded to the ship during the report period. Net oil excludes BS and W, fuel, spill and leaks. This volume has been corrected to standard conditions of temperature and pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.OilNetMonthToDateStdTempPres
member.summary: Net oil loaded to the ship from the beginning of the month to the end of the reporting period. Net oil excludes BS and W, fuel, spill and leaks. This volume has been corrected to standard conditions of temperature and pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.DensityStdTempPres
member.summary: Density of the liquid loaded to the tanker. This density has been corrected to standard conditions of temperature and pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.Density
member.summary: Density of the liquid loaded to the tanker.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.Rvp
member.summary: Reid vapor pressure of the liquid.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.Bsw
member.summary: Basic sediment and water is measured from a liquid sample of the production stream. It includes free water, sediment and emulsion and is measured as a volume percentage of the liquid.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationCargoShipOperation.Salt
member.summary: Salt content. The product formed by neutralization of an acid and a base. The term is more specifically applied to sodium chloride.

member.summary: A commnet about the operation.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality
member.summary: Information about the contaminants in water, and the general water quality. The values are measured from a sample, which is described below. Values measured from other samples should be given in different instances of the type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.SamplePoint
member.summary: An identifier of the point from which the sample was taken. This is an uncontrolled string value, which should be as descriptive as possible.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.OilInWaterProduced
member.summary: Total measured oil in the water after the water cleaning process, but before it is discharged from the installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.AmountOfOil
member.summary: Total measured oil in the water after the water cleaning process, but before it is discharged from the installation

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.Ammonium
member.summary: The amount of ammonium found in the water sample.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.TotalOrganicCArbon
member.summary: The amount of total organic carbon found in the water. The water is under high temperature and the carbon left is measured

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.PHenol
member.summary: The amount of Fenol found in the water sample.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.Glycol
member.summary: The amount of Glycol found in the water sample.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.PHValue
member.summary: The pH value of the treated water. The pH value is best given as a value, with no unit of measure, since there are no variations from the pH.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.WaterTemperature
member.summary: The temperature of the water before it is discharged.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.ResidualChloride
member.summary: Total measured residual clorines in the water after the water cleaning process, but before it is discharged from the installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.Oxygen
member.summary: Total measured Oxygen in the water after the water cleaning process, but before it is discharged from the installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.Turbidity
member.summary: A measure of the cloudiness of water caused by suspended particles.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.CoulterCounter
member.summary: A measure of the number of particles in water as measured by a coulter counter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.Comment
member.summary: Any comment that may be useful in describing the water quality. There can be multiple comments.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWaterCleaningQuality.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.summary: Date and time the information is related to.

member.summary: Name of company that supplied the data.

member.summary: Atmospheric pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.BeaufortScaleNumber
member.summary: The Beaufort wind scale is a system used to estimate and report wind speeds when no measuring apparatus is available. It was invented in the early 19th Century by Admiral Sir Francis Beaufort of the British Navy as a way to interpret winds from conditions.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.TempSurface
member.summary: Average temperature above ground for the period. Temperature of the atmosphere.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.TempSurfaceMin
member.summary: Minimum temperature above ground. Temperature of the atmosphere.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.TempSurfaceMax
member.summary: Maximum temperature above ground.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.TempWindChill
member.summary: A measure of the combined chilling effect of wind and low temperature on living things, also named chill factor, e.g., according to US weather service table, an air temperature of 30 degF with a 10 mi/h corresponds to a windchill of 22 degF.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.Tempsea
member.summary: Sea temperature.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.Visibility
member.summary: Horizontal visibility.

member.summary: The direction from which the waves are coming, measured from true north.

member.summary: Average height of the waves.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.SignificantWave
member.summary: An average of the higher 1/3 of the wave heights passing during a sample period (typically 20 to 30 minutes).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.MaxWave
member.summary: The maximum wave height.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.PeriodWave
member.summary: The elapsed time between the passing of two wave tops.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.AziWind
member.summary: The direction from which the wind is blowing, measured from true north.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductionOperationWeather.VelWind
member.summary: Wind speed.

member.summary: The name of the facility which is represented by this report. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.summary: The name and type of a facility whose context is relevant to the represented installation.

member.summary: The type of report.

member.summary: The beginning date and time that the report represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateTimeEnd.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductionOperation.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The ending date and time that the report represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateTimeStart.

member.summary: The beginning date that the report represents. If you set this property, you must also set DateEnd.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductionOperation.DateEnd

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductionOperation.Title

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetworkPlan
member.summary: A plan to extend an actual network.

member.summary: The name assigned to the plan.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetworkPlan.DateTimeStart
member.summary: The date and time of the start of the plan. This point coincides with the end of the actual configuration. The configuration of the actual at this point in time represents the configuration of the plan at this starting point. All changes to this plan must be in the future from this point in time.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ConnectedNode
member.summary: WITSML - Product Flow Connected Node Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ConnectedNode.Node
member.summary: Defines the node to which this port is connected. Only two ports should be actively connected to the same node at the same point in time. That is, a port should only be connected to one other port. There are no semantics for the node except common connection. All ports that are connected to a node with the the same name are inherently connected to each other. The name of the node is only required to be unique within the context of the current Product Flow Network (that is, not the overall model). All ports must be connected to a node and whether or not any other port is connected to the same node depends on the requirements of the network. Any node that is internally connected to only one node is presumably a candidate to be connected to an external node. The behavior of ports connected at a common node is as follows: a) There is no pressure drop across the node. All ports connected to the node have the same pressure. That is, there is an assumption of steady state fluid flow. b) Conservation of mass exists across the node. The mass into the node via all connected ports equals the mass out of the node via all connected ports. c) The flow direction of a port connected to the node may be transient. That is, flow direction may change toward any port if the relative internal pressure of the Product Flow Units change and a new steady state is achieved.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ConnectedNode.PlanName
member.summary: The name of a network plan. This indicates a planned connection. The connected port must be part of the same plan or be an actual. Not specified indicates an actual connection.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ConnectedNode.DateTimeStart
member.summary: The date and time that the connection was activated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ConnectedNode.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The date and time that the connection was terminated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ConnectedNode.Comment
member.summary: A descriptive remark associated with this connection, possibly including a reason for termination.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ConnectedNode.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort
member.summary: WITSML - Product Flow Port Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.Name
member.summary: The name of the port within the context of the Product Flow Unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.PlanName
member.summary: The name of a network plan. This indicates a planned port. All child network components must all be planned and be part of the same plan. The parent unit must be part of the same plan or be an actual. Not specified indicates an actual port.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.Direction
member.summary: Defines whether this port is an inlet or outlet. This is a nominal intended direction.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.Facility
member.summary: The name of the facility represented by this Product Flow Port The name can be qualified by a naming system. The facility name is assumed to be unique within the context of the facility represented by the unit. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.FacilityAlias
member.summary: An alternatative name of a facility. This is generally unique within a naming system. The above contextually unique name should also be listed as an alias.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.Exposed
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that the port is an exposed internal port and cannot be used in a connection external to the unit. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates a normal port.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.ConnectedNode
member.summary: Defines the node to which this port is connected. A timestamp activates and deactivates the connection. Only one connectedNode should be active at any one point in time. There are no semantics for the node except common connection. All ports that are connected to a node with the the same name are inherently connected to each other. The name of the node is only required to be unique within the context of the current Product Flow Network (that is, not the overall model). All ports must be connected to a node and whether or not any other port is connected to the same node depends on the requirements of the network. Any node that is internally connected to only one port is presumably a candidate to be connected to an external node. The behavior of ports connected at a common node is as follows: a) There is no pressure drop across the node. All ports connected to the node have the same pressure. That is, there is an assumption of steady state fluid flow. b) Conservation of mass exists across the node. The mass into the node via all connected ports equals the mass out of the node via all connected ports. c) The flow direction of a port connected to the node may be transient. That is, flow direction may change toward any port(s) if the relative internal pressure of the Product Flow Units change and a new steady state is achieved.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.ExpectedFlowProduct
member.summary: Defines the expected flow and product pairs to be assigned to this port by a Product Volume report. A set of expected qualifiers can be defined for each pair.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowPort.ExpectedFlowProperty
member.summary: Defines the properties that are expected to be measured at this port. This can also specify the equipment tag(s) of the sensor that will read the value. Only one of each property kind should be active at any point in time.

member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.RelativeCoordinate.Z
member.summary: Defines the relative from-front-to-back location in a 3D system. The unrotated display origin (0,0) is the upper left-hand corner of the display as viewed by the user. The "3D picture" may be rotated on the 2d display.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit
member.summary: WITSML - Product Flow Unit Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.Name
member.summary: The name of the Product Flow Unit within the context of the Product Flow Network.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.PlanName
member.summary: The name of a network plan. This indicates a planned unit. All child network components must all be planned and be part of the same plan. The parent network must either contain the plan (i.e., be an actual) or be part of the same plan. Not specified indicates an actual unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.InternalNetwork
member.summary: A pointer to the network representing the internal behavior of this unit. The names of the external ports on the internal network must match the names of the ports on this unit. That is they are logically the same ports.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.Facility
member.summary: The name of the facility for which this Product Flow Unit describes fluid flow connecton behavior. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent1
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility this named facility. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.FacilityPluggedAndAbandonedrent2
member.summary: For facilities whose name is unique within the context of another facility, the name of the parent facility of facilityParent1. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.FacilityAlias
member.summary: An alternatative name of a facility. This is generally unique within a naming system. The above contextually unique name (that is, within the context of a parent) should also be listed as an alias.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.ContextFacility
member.summary: The name and type of a facility whose context is relevant to the represented facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.ExpectedProperty
member.summary: Defines an expected property of the facility represented by this unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.RelativeCoordinate
member.summary: Defines the relative coordinate of the unit on a display screen. This is not intended for detailed diagrams. Rather it is intended to allow different applications to present a user view which has a consistent layout.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.Port
member.summary: An inlet or outlet port associated with this unit. If there is an internal network then the name of this port must match the name of an external port for that network. Any properties (e.g., volume, pressure, temperature) that are assigned to this port are inherently assigned to the corresponding external port on the internal network. That is, the ports are logically the same port. Similar to a node, there is no pressure drop across a port. Also similar to a node, conservation of mass exists across the port and the flow direction across the port can change over time if the relative pressures across connected units change.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.Comment
member.summary: A descriptive remark associated with this unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowUnit.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowlExternalPort
member.summary: WITSML - Product Flow Network External Port Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowlExternalPort.Name
member.summary: The name of the external port within the context of the current Product Flow Network.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowlExternalPort.Direction
member.summary: Defines whether this port is an inlet or outlet. Note that this is a nominal intended direction.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowlExternalPort.Exposed
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that the port is an exposed internal port and cannot be used in a connection external to the network. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates a normal port.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowlExternalPort.ConnectedNode
member.summary: Defines the internal node to which this external port is connected. All ports (whether internal or external) that are connected to a node with the same name are connected to each other. Node names are unique to each network. The purpose of the external port is to provide input to or output from the internal network except when the port is an "exposed" port. The purpose of an exposed port is to allow the properties of the port to be seen external to the network. For an exposed port, the connection points to the associated port.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowlExternalPort.Comment
member.summary: A descriptive remark about the port.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowlExternalPort.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork
member.summary: The non-contextual content of a WITSML Product Flow Network object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.Name
member.summary: The name of the Product Flow Network. This must be unique within the context of the overall Product Flow Model.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.PlanName
member.summary: The name of a network plan. This indicates a planned network. All child network components must all be planned and be part of the same plan. The parent network must either contain the plan (i.e., be an actual) or be part of the same plan. Not specified indicates an actual network.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.PluggedAndAbandonedrentNetwork
member.summary: A pointer to the network containing the unit that this network represents. That is, the Unit must exist in a different Network. If a parent network is not specified then the network represents the model. A model should only be represented by one network. The model network represents the overall installation. All other networks represent internal detail and should not be referenced from outside the model. The external ports on the model network represent the external ports to the overall Product Flow Model. A pointer to an external port on the Product Flow Model does not require the name of the model network because it is redundant to knowledge of the model name (i.e., there is a one-to-one correspondence).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.RepresentedUnit
member.summary: DEPRECATED. Use parentNetwork for all new work. A pointer to the Flow Unit that this network represents. The Unit must exist in a different Network. If a unit is not specified then the network represents the model. A model should only be represented by one network. The model network represents the overall installation. All other networks represent internal detail and should not be referenced from outside this model. The external ports on the model network represent the external ports to the overall Product Flow Model. A pointer to an external port on the Product Flow Model does not require the name of the model network because it is redundant to knowledge of the model name (i.e., there is a one-to-one correspondence). A unit model defines the internal behavior of a Flow Unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.Comment
member.summary: A descriptive remark about the network.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.Port
member.summary: An external port. This exposes an internal node for the purpose of allowing connections to the internal behavior of the network. Networks that represent a Flow Unit should always have external ports. If this network represents a Unit then the name of the external port must match the name of a port on the Unit (i.e., they are logically the same port).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.Unit
member.summary: A flow behavior for one unit. Within this context, a unit represents a usage of equipment for some purpose. The unit is generally identified by its function rather than the actual equipment used to realize the function. A unit might represent something complex like a field or separator or something simple like a valve or pump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.ChangeLog
member.summary: Documents that a change occurred at a particular time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.Plan
member.summary: Defines the existance of a planned network which is a variant of this network beginning at a specified point in time. Any changes to the actual network after that time do not affect the plan.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowNetwork.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowExternalReference
member.summary: A reference to an external port within a different Product Flow Model. This value represents a foreign key from one element to another.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowExternalReference.Port
member.summary: A pointer to the external port in the network that represents the current Model. This is the port to which a different model is being connected.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowExternalReference.ConnectedPort
member.summary: A pointer to the external port within the connected Model. This is the port on a different model to which the port on this model is connected.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowExternalReference.ConnectedModel
member.summary: A pointer to the Product Flow Model that contains the connected port.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowExternalReference.ConnectedInstallation
member.summary: The name of the facility that is represented by the connected model. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.ProductFlowExternalReference.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel
member.summary: The non-contextual content of a WITSML Product Flow Model object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.Name
member.summary: The name of the Product Flow Model.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.Installation
member.summary: The name of the facility which is represented by this model. The name can be qualified by a naming system. This also defines the kind of facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.ContextFacility
member.summary: The name and type of a facility whose context is relevant to the represented installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.DateTimeStart
member.summary: The date and time of the start of validity for this model.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: The date and time of the termination of validity for this model.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.ExistenceTime
member.summary: The time for which "currently existing" data is desired from the network. All connections (and related data) existing at this time (i.e. start and end bracket this value) will will be returned if requested. The existence time is a server query parameter. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The minimum time index contained within the report. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The maximum time index contained within the report. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.ExternalConnect
member.summary: Defines the external port in another Product Flow Model to which an external port in this model is connected. An external port should be connected to an external port with the opposite direction. The connected external port must be in another Product Flow Model. These connections should always be defined on a one-to-one basis. For example, if a facility may receive input from multiple other facilities then a separate input port should be defined for each of those facilities. This allows any question about mass balancing to be contained within each individual model. The external port name must match the name of an external port on the network that represents this model.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.Network
member.summary: The description of one named network within this model. Each model is self contained but may reference other newtorks for defining internal detail. One of the networks must represent this model.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.Comment
member.summary: A descriptive remark about the model.

member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ProductFlowModel.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.
