member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement
member.summary: The information content of a DTS temperature run is captured in the following elements, and in the referenced dtsInstalledFiber (for context) and the reference well log (captures the table of data).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.NameWell
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.NameWellbore
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore that contains the dts.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the dts.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The minimum time index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. That is, all measurements for a well in the specified period defined by the min/max. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The maximum time index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.DateTimeCurrent
member.summary: The definition of the "current time" index for this object. The current time index is a server query parameter which requests the selection of a single node from a recurring set (e.g., the data related to one point in a time series). That is, the "most recent" (at or before the specified time) measurement for a well. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.WellContext
member.summary: Contextual data about the well that was tested.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time associated with the measurement. This will normally be the start of the run.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.RunDuration
member.summary: The length of time that the instrument box was operating while collecting DTS data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.InstalledSystemUsed
member.summary: A reference to the installed system that was used to make the measurements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.DataInWellLog
member.summary: A reference to the well log used to record the table of data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.ConnectedToFiber
member.summary: A reference to the fiber used to record the table of data. This is necessary only in the cases in which a dtsInstalledSystem has a multi-fiber installation. If there is only a single installed fiber, this element is unnecessary.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.FiberEndConnected
member.summary: A pointer to the fiber connection node. If more than one node is available for a well/wellbore, this element is used to specify which node is connected to the instrument box. This name should correspond to the fiberEndPoint/name that is recorded in the installed system object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.FiberDefinedPoint
member.summary: A known point of the fiber. This point should correspond to one that is given in the wellboreFiberSchematic, so that the relationship between the length of fiber values in the wellboreFiberSchematic can be related to the values in the measurement table.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.ErrorReport
member.summary: An error that occurred during the measurement.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.ProcessedLog
member.summary: A reference to a processed wellLog that represents this measurement.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsMeasurement.UidWellbore
member.summary: Unique identifier for the wellbore. This uniquely represents the wellbore referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsSingleInstalledPoint
member.summary: A set of points recorded during the installation process. The information can include the length along the fiber, the measured depth, and a type of point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsSingleInstalledPoint.MD
member.summary: The measured depth of the installed point of the fiber. This is optional, because the sender may want to record points that are outside the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsSingleInstalledPoint.LengthAlongFiber
member.summary: The length along the fiber, from the zero point, for this particular point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsSingleInstalledPoint.Type
member.summary: The type of point that is being recorded.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsSingleInstalledPoint.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOtdr
member.summary: This records the result arrays, along with context information, from an Optical Time Domain Reflectometry (OTDR) run. The arrays will define the relative scattered power from the Rayleigh scattering vs distance along the fiber. The actual data values are recorded in a wellLog object, which is referenced in a subelement.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOtdr.ReasonForRun
member.summary: The reason the OTDR test was run. The three main reasons are 'pre-installation', which is before the installation of the fiber; 'post-installation', which is used to validate a successful fiber installation; and 'DTS run', which is a quality check of the fiber prior to a DTS run. A fourth permitted value is 'other'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOtdr.DateTimeRun
member.summary: The dateTime of the run.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOtdr.DataInWellLog
member.summary: A reference to the well log used to record the table of data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOtdr.FiberEndConncected
member.summary: A pointer to the fiber connection node. If more than one node is available for a well/wellbore, this element is used to specify which node is connected to the instrument box. This name should correspond to the fiberEndPoint/name that is recorded in the installed system object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOtdr.Comment
member.summary: A general comment about the OTDR run.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOtdr.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow
member.summary: The pump log row are elements defined in the sequence below.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow.CAbleSpeed
member.summary: The speed of the cable.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow.FiberPumpedLength
member.summary: The length of fiber pumped into the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow.PumpPressure
member.summary: The operating pressure of the pump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow.PumpFluid
member.summary: The fluid used in the pumping operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow.TemperatureIn
member.summary: The temperature going into the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow.TemperatureOut
member.summary: The temperature at the end of the operation

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow.Remarks
member.summary: Any general remarks about the pumping operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpLogRow.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity
member.summary: The activity of pumping the fiber downhole.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.Name
member.summary: A name which can be used to reference the pumping activity. In general, a pumping activity does not have a natural name, so that this element will not be often used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.InstalledFiber
member.summary: The name of the InstalledFiberInstance that this activity relates to.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.PumpingDate
member.summary: The date of the pumping activity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.EngineerName
member.summary: The person in charge of the pumping activity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.ServiceCompany
member.summary: The company that performed the pumping activity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.PumpFluidType
member.summary: The type of fluid used in the pump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.ControlLineFluid
member.summary: The type of fluid used in the control line.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.PumpDirection
member.summary: The direction of the pumping.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.FiberEndSeal
member.summary: The type of end seal on the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.CAbleMeterType
member.summary: The type of cable meter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.CAbleMeterSerialNumber
member.summary: The serial number of the cable meter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.CAbleMeterCAlibrationDate
member.summary: The date the cable meter was calibrated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.WasDriftRunPerformed
member.summary: True or False. Was a drift run performed? This element should be used to indicate if a drift run was performed or not, where the instance of the drift run (OTDR) is not available. If the OTDR is available, use the OTDRPerformed element to specify the OTDR instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.OTDRPerformed
member.summary: A reference to the OTDR that was run. If an OTDR was run, but there is not instance of the OTDR to reference, choose the wasDriftRunPerformed element, and set it to True.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.ExcessFiberRecovered
member.summary: The length of the excess fiber that was removed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.PumpLog
member.summary: Information about the pumping activity, that is captured in the pump log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsPumpActivity.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberEndPoint
member.summary: A fiber installed in a "U" configuration has two end points that a cable may hook to. When making a measurement, it is useful to be able to say which end was hooked to the input from the instrument box. In order to do this, the fiber ends must be identified. The identifier is a name, along with a description to further aid the interpreter in determining which end was used as the input.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberEndPoint.Name
member.summary: A name, unique within the context of the well, for an instrument box cable to hook to.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberEndPoint.Description
member.summary: Any description of the node that may be useful in identifying the hookup.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberEndPoint.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsInstrumentBoxCalibration
member.summary: Calibration parameters vary from vendor to vendor, depending on the calibration method being used. This is an extension of the general cs_dtsCalibration, and allows for specific parameters associated with an instrument box. The two additional parameters are the offset temperature calibration, and the slope calibration. These allow for a linear shift in temperature vs measurements. Additional offset and slope calibrations may be performed at measurement time.

member.summary: The date of the calibration

member.summary: The business associate that performed the calibration.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsInstrumentBoxCalibration.CAlibrationProtocol
member.summary: This may be a standard protocol, or a software application.

member.summary: Attribute name is the name of the parameter. Optional attribute uom is the unit of measure of the parameter. The value of the element is the value of the parameter. Note that a string value may appear as a parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsInstrumentBoxCalibration.Remarks
member.summary: Any remarks that may be useful, regarding the calibration information.

member.summary: The temperature offset correction that is applied to the dts instrument box.

member.summary: The temperature slope correction that is applied to the dts instrument box.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag
member.summary: WITSML - Equipment NameTag Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Name
member.summary: The physical identification string of the equipment tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.NumberingScheme
member.summary: The format or encoding specification of the equipment tag. The tag may contain may different pieces of information and knowledge of that information is inherent in the specification. The "identification string" is a mandatory part of the information in a tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Technology
member.summary: Identifies the general type of identifier on an item. If multiple identifiers exist on an item, a separate description set for each identifier should be created. For example, a joint of casing may have a barcode label on it along with a painted-on code and an RFID tag attached or embedded into the coupling. The barcode label may in turn be an RFID equipped label. This particular scenario would require populating five nameTags to fully describe and decode all the possible identifiers as follows: 'tagged' - RFID tag embedded in the coupling, 'label' - Serial number printed on the label, 'tagged' - RFID tag embedded into the label, 'label' - Barcode printed on the label, 'painted'- Mill number painted on the pipe body.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Location
member.summary: An indicator of where the tag is attached to the item. This is used to assist the user in finding where an identifier is located on an item. This optional field also helps to differentiate where an identifier is located when multiple identifiers exist on an item. Most downhole components have a box (female thread) and pin (male thread) end as well as a pipe body in between the ends. Where multiple identifiers are used on an item, it is convenient to have a reference as to which end, or somewhere in the middle, an identifier may be closer to. Some items may have an identifier on a non-standard location, such as on the arm of a hole opener. 'other', by exclusion, tells a user to look elsewhere than on the body or near the ends of an item. Most non-downhole tools will use either 'body', 'other' or not specified as the location tends to lose value with smaller or non threaded items.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.InstallationDate
member.summary: When the tag was installed in or on the item.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.InstallationCompany
member.summary: The name of the company that installed the tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.MountingCode
member.summary: Reference to a manufacturers or installers installation description, code, or method.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Comment
member.summary: A comment or remark about the tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.summary: An identification tag for the instrument box. A serial number is a type of identification tag however some tags contain many pieces of information. This structure just identifies the tag and does not describe the contents.

member.summary: Information about the calibration of the instrument box that was performed. This includes factory calibrations before shipping, and bench calibrations. This does not include calibrations made in preparation for taking measurements.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss
member.summary: The The power loss for one way travel of a beam of light, usually measured in decibels per unit length. It is necessary to include both the value (and its unit) and the wavelength. The wavelength varies with the refractive index, while the frequency remains constant. The wavelength given to specify this type is the wavelength in a vacuum (refractive index = 1).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss.Value
member.summary: The value of the one way loss per unit of length. The usual uom is decibels per kilometre (dB/km), although this might vary depending on the calibration method used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency (and uom) for which the one-way loss is measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss.Wavelength
member.summary: The wavelength (and uom) for which the one-way loss is measured. The reported wavelength should be the wavelength of the light in a vacuum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsOneWayLoss.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex
member.summary: The refractive index of a material depends on the frequency or wavelength of the light. Hence it is necessary to include both the value (a unitless number) and the frequency or wavelength. The frequency will be a quantity type with a frequency unit, such as Hz, kHz, or MHz. The wavelength will be a quantity type with a length unit, such as m, cm, um, in, or ft.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex.Value
member.summary: The value of the refractive index.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency (and uom) for which the refractive index is measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex.Wavelength
member.summary: The wavelength (and uom) for which the refractive index is measured. The reported wavelength should be the wavelength of the light in a vacuum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsRefractiveIndex.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.summary: The optical fiber used for distributed temperature surveys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Name
member.summary: A human understandable name for the fiber. This is used for identification of the instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Mode
member.summary: The mode of fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Type
member.summary: Zero or more instances that allow other classifications to be assigned to the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Coating
member.summary: The type of coating on the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Jacket
member.summary: The type of jacket covering the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.CoreDiameter
member.summary: The inner diameter of the core, generally measured in microns (um).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.CladdedDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the core plus the cladding, generally measured in microns (um).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.OutsideDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the cable and all its sheathing, generally measured in microns (um). This is intended to be the diameter of the cable on the spool.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.RefractiveIndex
member.summary: The refractive index of the fiber. Also included is the frequency in Hz for which this refractive index is valid. There may be multiple instances of this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.OneWayLoss
member.summary: The power loss (usually in decibels) per unit of length of the fiber. Also included is the frequency for which this loss is measured. There ay be multiple instances of this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: Additional parameters to define the fiber as a material. These should not be parameters to define the installation of the fiber in a well, or other system. This element should be used only if an appropriate parameter is not available as an element, or in the calibration operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.SpoolNumberTag
member.summary: The spool number located on the particular spool. The spool number may contain alphanumeric characters.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.SpoolLength
member.summary: The length of the fiber on the spool when purchased.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.SupplyDate
member.summary: A fiber may go through several manufacturers for its various parts. The supplier is the final company in the chain that supplies the fiber to the end user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.Supplier
member.summary: A fiber may go through several manufacturers for its various parts. The supplier is the final company in the chain that supplies the fiber to the end user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.SupplierModelNumber
member.summary: The model number (alphanumeric) that is used by the supplier to reference the type of fiber that is supplied to the user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.FactoryCAlibration
member.summary: Information about calibrations and quality checks that were performed on the cable at the factory. This is not to include calibrations that are run at installation time and at measurement time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.InstallationHistory
member.summary: A reference to a dtsInstalledSytem object that previously used the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiber.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation
member.summary: The optical fiber used for distributed temperature surveys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.InstallationDate
member.summary: The date the fiber is installed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.InstallationCompany
member.summary: The company that installed the fiber in the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.DeInstallationDate
member.summary: The date the fiber was de-installed from the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.CapillaryTubeDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the capillary tube into which one or more fibers will be installed. If the installation has fibers that go to different wellbores, only those fibers installed in the parent wellbore should be included in this instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DtsFiberInformation.Fiber
member.summary: The properties of the fiber or fibers installed in the wellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQualifiedDate
member.summary: This class represents the endpointQualifiedDate xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.EndpointQualifiedDate.EndpointSurrogate
member.summary: The default is "inclusive".

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem
member.summary: The optical fiber is installed in a wellbore and attached to an instrument box. Calibrations are performed. In general, this should be a subelement of a DTS object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.NameWell
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.NameWellbore
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore that contains the installed system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the dts.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.DateMin
member.summary: The minimum date index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. That is, all measurements for a well in the specified period defined by the min/max. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.DateMax
member.summary: The maximum date index contained within the object. The minimum and maximum indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a "get" result. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.DateCurrent
member.summary: The definition of the "current date" index for this object. The current date index is a server query parameter which requests the selection of a single node from a recurring set (e.g., the data related to one point in a date series). That is, the "most recent" (at or before the specified date) installation for a well. See the WITSML API Specification appendix on "Special Handling" of growing objects for a description of the behavior related to this parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.WellContext
member.summary: Contextual data about the well in which the system was installed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.IsPlanned
member.summary: Is this a planned installation in a well, or has the installation already occurred. Note that the default value is 'false', which states that this is an actual installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberInformation
member.summary: Information about the fiber used, and its installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.InstrumentBoxInformation
member.summary: Information about the instrument box used, and its installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration of the fiber installation. Example values would be linear, linear with gauge, J, U.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberEndPoint
member.summary: A fiber installed with a "U" configuration will have two ends available for hookup to an instrument box. In order to record which end is cabled to the instrument box on a particular measurement run, it is necessary to identify the two ends. This complex type allows a name and description for each end, so that it may be identified in a later use. This may also be useful when multiple fibers in multiple wellbores converge at the same wellhead.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberLength
member.summary: The length of the fiber installed in the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.WellboreFiberSchematic
member.summary: A table of values along the length along the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.OperatingticalBudget
member.summary: Total light budget available for the installation. This is generally measured in decibels, and indicates the total power loss for two-way travel of the light in the installed fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.PumpActivity
member.summary: The activity of pumping the fiber downhole

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.OtdrInstallationTest
member.summary: This captures the data from the pre-installation and post-installation OTDR tests run on the fiber. A standard quality control program would include these two, but the schema allows for more than two if additional runs associated with the installation of the fiber are performed. OTDR runs associated with a measurement are given as a child of the measurementInformation element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.InstallationCAlibration
member.summary: Any calibration other than the ones explicitly given may be recorded here. This is a general calibration type, which is populated with name/value pairs.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.BasedOnInstalledFiber
member.summary: If an instrument box is changed, for example, but the fiber remains the same, this instance of installed fiber is given to record that change. This element refers to a previous installed fiber, on which this one is based. For example, the wellboreFiberSchematic is unchanged, and may be obtained from the previous instance of installed fiber that is referenced here.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.DtsInstalledSystem.UidWellbore
member.summary: Unique identifier for the wellbore. This uniquely represents the wellbore referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfoQueryParam
member.summary: A structure for WITSML query parameters. The intent is to allow a query for all objects within an index range (whether or not the object is growing). These would typically be something like a daily report.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfoQueryParam.DateTimeMin
member.summary: The minimum start time for an object. This only applies to objects with a root level date and/or dateTime element(s). The objects may or not be growing objects but the See the API specification for behavior related to this query parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfoQueryParam.DateTimeMax
member.summary: The maximum start time for an object. This only applies to objects with a root level date and/or dateTime element(s). See the API specification for behavior related to this query parameter.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent
member.summary: An event type captures the basic information about an event that has affected the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.EventDate
member.summary: The date on which the event took place.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.EventType
member.summary: The kind of event event.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.ResponsiblePluggedAndAbandonedrty
member.summary: The party responsible for the event.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.Comment
member.summary: A free form comment that can further define the event that occurred.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentEvent.ExtensionNameValue
member.summary: Extensions to the schema based on a name-value construct.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo
member.summary: Information about the security classification of the document. This is intended as a documentation of the security so that the file will not inadvertently be sent to someone who is not allowed access to the data. This block also carries a date that the security classification expires. For example, a well log is confidential for a period of time, and then becomes open. All security classes are characterized by their classification systems.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.Class
member.summary: The security class in which this document is classified. Examples would be confidential, partner confidential, tight. The meaning of the class is determined by the System in which it is defined.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.SecuritySystem
member.summary: The security classification system. This gives context to the meaning of the Class value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.EndDate
member.summary: The date on which this security class is no longer applicable.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ComponentSchemas.DocumentSecurityInfo.Comment

member.summary: The tile of the report if different from the name of the report.

member.summary: The date that the report represents (i.e., not a year or month). Only one of date, month or year should be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.Report.DateEnd
member.summary: The ending date that the report represents if it represents an interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.Report.Month
member.summary: The month that the report represents (i.e., not a year, date or date range). Only one of date, month or year should be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.Report.Year
member.summary: The year that the report represents (i.e., not a month, date or date range). Only one of date, month or year should be specified.

member.summary: A textual comment about the report.

member.summary: The current report version.

member.summary: The current document version status.

member.summary: The name and type of a facility whose context is relevant to the represented installation.

member.summary: The operator of the facilities in the report.

member.summary: The person or company that issued the report. This may contain the role of the person or company within the context of the report.

member.summary: The date that the report was approved.

member.summary: The person or company that approved the report. This may contain the role of the person or company within the context of the report.

member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.summary: casing flange: A flange affixed to the top of the casing string used to attach production equipment.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.CV
member.summary: crown valve

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.DF
member.summary: derrick floor

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.GL
member.summary: ground level

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.KB
member.summary: kelly bushing

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.RB
member.summary: rotary bushing

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.RT
member.summary: rotary table

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.SF
member.summary: sea floor

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.LAT
member.summary: Lowest Astronomical Tide. The lowest tide level over the duration of the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.SL
member.summary: Mean Sea Level - A tidal datum. The arithmetic mean of hourly heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MHHW
member.summary: Mean Higher High Water - A tidal datum. The average of the higher high water height of each tidal day observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MHW
member.summary: Mean High Water - A tidal datum. The average of all the high water heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MLLW
member.summary: Mean Lower Low Water - A tidal datum. The average of the lower low water height of each tidal day observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years ).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MLW
member.summary: Mean Low Water - A tidal datum. The average of all the low water heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MTL
member.summary: Mean Tide Level - A tidal datum. The arithmetic mean of mean high water and mean low water. Same as half-tide level.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.KO
member.summary: kickoff point

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ItemsChoiceType
member.summary: This class represents the ItemsChoiceType xsd enumeration.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid
member.summary: This class represents the WellFluid xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid.air
member.summary: This is generally an injected fluid.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid.condensate
member.summary: Liquid hydrocarbons produced with natural gas that are separated from the gas by cooling and various other means. Condensate generally has an API gravity of 50 degrees to 120 degrees and is water white, straw, or bluish in color. It is the liquid recovery from a well classified as a gas well. It is generally dissolved in the gaseous state under reservoir conditions but separates as a liquid either in passing up the hole or at the surface. These hydrocarbons, from associated and nonassociated gas well gas, normally are recovered from lease separators or field facilities by mechanical separation.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid.dry
member.summary: The well facility is classified as a dry well. It has not been, nor will it be used to produce or inject any fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid.gas
member.summary: The well is classified as a gas well, producing or injecting a hydrocarbon gas. The gas is generally methane, but may have a mixture of other gases also.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid.oil
member.summary: The liquid hydrocarbon, generally referred to as crude oil.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid.steam
member.summary: The gaseous state of water. This is generally an injected fluid, but it is possible that some hydrothermal wells produce steam.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid.water
member.summary: The well is classified as a water well without distinguishing between brine or fresh water.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellFluid.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellDirection
member.summary: This class represents the WellDirection xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellDirection.injector
member.summary: The well facility is injecting fluids into the subsurface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellDirection.producer
member.summary: The well facility is producing fluids from the subsurface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellDirection.uncertain
member.summary: The flow direction of the fluids is variable, but not on a regular basis as is the case with the huff-n-puff flow.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellDirection.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.ItemsChoiceType8
member.summary: This class represents the ItemsChoiceType8 xsd enumeration.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus
member.summary: This class represents the WellStatus xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.abandoned
member.summary: The status of a facility in which drilling, completion, and production operations have been permanently terminated.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.active
member.summary: For a well to be active, at least one of its wellbores must be active. For a wellbore to be active, at least one of its completions must be actively producing or injecting fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.completed
member.summary: The completion has been installed, but the facility is not yet active. This status is appropriate only before the initial producing or injecting activity.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.drilling
member.summary: The status of a well or wellbore in which drilling operations have begun, but are not yet completed. The status ends when another status becomes appropriate.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.permitted
member.summary: The facility has received regulatory approvel, but drilling has not yet commenced. For a well, it has been spudded. For a subsequent wellbore, the whipstock or similar device has not yet been set.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.proposed
member.summary: The status of a well or wellbore from conception to either regulatory approval or commencement of drilling.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.sold
member.summary: The facility has been sold, so it is no longer appropriate to keep a close internal status value. Status values may be added at later times without changing the sold status.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.suspended
member.summary: Production or injection has been temporarily suspended in a manner that will allow immediate resumption of activities.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.testing
member.summary: The facility operations are suspended while tests are being conducted to determine formation and/or reservoir properties. For example, a drillstem test. This status also includes extended testing.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.tight
member.summary: Information about the status of the well is confidential. This is more explicit than unknown, since it gives the reason that the status value is unknown.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ReferenceData.WellStatus.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ExtensionName
member.summary: The names of agreed extensions to WITSML. This list may be locally extended but it is recommended that new names be approved by the WITSML SIG before use. Each standard name must define its data type. For string types, the maximum length must be defined in number of characters. For measures, the expected measure class must be defined.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ExtensionName.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ExtensionName.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ExtensionName.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of ExtensionNames

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ExtensionName.Dummyexamplestring
member.summary: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a string of maximum length of 64 characters which can be used in the commonData of any object. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ExtensionName.Dummyexamplemeasure
member.summary: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a length measure which can only be specified in the commonData of the well and wellbore objects. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field. The extensionMeasureClass constrains the allowed units of measure for each value. The extensionDataType value of double constrains the size of each value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.ExtensionName.Dummyexampledatetime
member.summary: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a dateTime value which can be specified anywhere in the tubular object. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass
member.summary: Defines classes of measures and their allowed units of measures. For a value whose underlying meaning conforms to one of these classes, any specified unit of measure must conform to the defined list. These are copied from the Energistics (POSC) Units Classes v2.2. The units of measure map to the POSC Units of Measure Dictionary v2.2.

member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of MeasureClasss

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.AbsorbedDose
member.summary: The amount of energy absorbed per mass.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.ActivityOfRadioactivity
member.summary: A measure of the radiation being emitted.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.ConcentrationOfB
member.summary: molar concentration of a substance

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.AmountOfSubstance
member.summary: molar amount of a substance

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.AnglePerTime
member.summary: The angular velocity. The rate of change of an angle.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.Attenuation
member.summary: A logarithmic, fractional change of some measure, generally power or amplitude, over a standard range. This is generally used for frequency attenuation over an octave.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.DataTransmissionSpeed
member.summary: used primarily for computer transmission rates.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.DeltaTemperature
member.summary: Delta temperature refers to temperature differences. For non-zero offset temperature scales, Fahrenheit and Celsius, the conversion formulas are different than for absolute temperatures.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.Dimensionless
member.summary: A dimensionless quantity is the ratio of two dimensional quantities. The quantity types are not apparent from the basic dimensionless class, but may be apparent in variations - such as area per area, volume per volume, or mass per mass.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.ElectrochemicalEquivalent
member.summary: An electrochemical equivalent differs from molarity in that the valence (oxidation reduction potential) of the element is also considered.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.FrequencyInterval
member.summary: An octave is a doubling of a frquency.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.GammaRayApiUnit
member.summary: This class is defined by the API, and is used for units of gamma ray log response.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.Ph
member.summary: The pH is a class that measures the hydrogen ion concentration (acidity).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.MeasureClass.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.summary: Defines the mechanisms for attaching an equipment tag to an item.

member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.NameTagTechnology.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of NameTagTechnologys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.NameTagTechnology.Tagged
member.summary: Independent identification components attached or embedded to a larger component for purposes of identification of the larger component. Tags typically use electronic, radio or sound based technologies and that require a special non-optical device to read them. Radio Frequency Identification (RFID tags) are of this type, as are some magnetic and sound based identification technologies.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.NameTagTechnology.Labeled
member.summary: An optical label attached to a component. The label may be glued, riveted or attached by some other method and may contain a serial number, barcode or other optically recognized information. Note that a label may possibly have a combination of identifiers associated with it, such as a serial number, a barcode and an embedded RFID identifier. This would generate three nameTags for the one physical label, two of type 'label' for the barcode and serial number and one of type 'tagged' for the RFID identifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.NameTagTechnology.Intrinsic
member.summary: Identification technologies where the intrinsic properties of the component to be identified contain the identification information and no other unique code has been added. For example, some magnetic identification technologies use grooves machined into a component. Some components may also be identified, for example, by their individual sonic signature or optical profile.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.NameTagTechnology.Stamped
member.summary: An identification code physically stamped into the base material of the component to be identified. Note that if a serial number is stamped into a label attached to a component, 'labeled' should be used and not 'stamped'. Stamped identifiers can wear off but can not fall off.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.NameTagTechnology.Painted
member.summary: Painted or stenciled on the material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.NameTagTechnology.Temporary
member.summary: Temporary identification codes marked with grease pencil, chalk, or such.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML121.NameTagTechnology.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.summary: A count that is the number of persons from the catering contractor spending the night at the installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.CrewType.ContractorCrew
member.summary: A count that is the number of persons from other than operator spending the night at the installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.CrewType.DayVisitors
member.summary: A count that is the number of persons visiting the installation but not spending the night at the installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.CrewType.DrillingContractCrew
member.summary: A count that is the number of persons from the drilling contractor spending the night at the installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.CrewType.OwnCrew
member.summary: A count that is the number of persons from the operator normally working on the installation and spending the night there.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.CrewType.OwnOtherCrew
member.summary: A count that is the number of persons from the operator normally not working on the installation, but spending the night there.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.CrewType.OtherCrew
member.summary: A count that is the number of persons from an unknown source normally not working on the installation, but spending the night there.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.CrewType.PersonnelOnBoard
member.summary: A count of the total personnel on board.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier
member.summary: The meaning of the endpoint for min/max query parameters on "growing objects".

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of EndpointQualifiers

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier.Inclusive
member.summary: The endpoint of the range is inclusive of the specified range value. That is, a node index value which matches the specified range value is considered to be within the range.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier.Exclusive
member.summary: The endpoint of the range is exclusive of the specified range value. That is, a node index value which matches the specified range value is considered to be outside the range.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier.Extensive
member.summary: The endpoint of the range may be extended to the first encountered value if an exact value match is not found. That is, if a node index value does not match the specified range value then the next smaller value (on minimum end) or larger value (on maximum end) in the index series should be used as the endpoint. Basically, this concept is designed to support interpolation across an undefined point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier.OverlapExtensive
member.summary: The endpoint of the range may be extended to the first encountered value if the interval is overlapped with the index interval. That is, if a node index value does not match the specified range value then the next smaller value (on minimum end) or larger value (on maximum end) in the index series should be used as the endpoint. This concept is designed to select ALL nodes whose index interval overlap with the query range.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.EndpointQualifier.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter
member.summary: Defines kinds of facility parameters.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of FacilityParameters

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.Available
member.summary: Indicates the availablity of the facility. This should be implemented as a string value. A value of "true" indicates that it is available for use. That is, it may be currently shut-down but it can be restarted. A value of "false" indicates that the faility is not available to be used. That is, it cannot be restarted at this time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.AvailableRoom
member.summary: Defines the unoccupied volume of a tank. Zero indicates that the tank is full. This should be implemented as a volume measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.BlockValveStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of a block valve. This should be implemented as a string value. A value of "open" indicates that it is open. A value of "closed" indicates that it is closed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.FacilityUptime
member.summary: The ammount to time the facility was available during the specified period. This should be implemented as an time measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.PumpCountOnline
member.summary: The number of pumps which are active. This should be implemented as an integer value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.ReciprocatingSpeed
member.summary: The reciprocating speed of a device (e.g., motor, compressor). This should be implemented as an anglePerTime measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.RelativeTankLevel
member.summary: Defines the relative level of a tank. Zero indicates empty and 100% indicates full. This should be implemented as a lengthPerLength measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.RelativeValveOpening
member.summary: Indicates the status of a valve. This should be implemented as an areaPerAreaMeasure. A value of 100 % indicates that it is open. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.ValveOpening
member.summary: Indicates the open area of a valve. This should be implemented as an areaMeasure. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.ScheduledDowntime
member.summary: Indicates the amount of time the facility has been unavailable during the specified period. May be related to a particular point in time which would represent the start of the downtime. This should be implemented as an time measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.ShutdownOrder
member.summary: Defines the relative order in which a facility should be shutdown. This should be implemented as an integer count. Facilities with smaller values should be shut down first. Only facility parameters with the same version time and same version source should be evaluated together for the purposes of this order.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.TankFluidLevel
member.summary: The vertical height of the specified product in a tank. This should be implemented as a length measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.TankProductVolume
member.summary: The volume of the specified product in a tank. This should be implemented as a volume measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.TankProductStandardVolume
member.summary: The volume of the specified product in a tank, corrected to standard conditions of temperature and pressure. This should be implemented as a volume measure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.WellOperationType
member.summary: This commonly called the "well type". It characterizes the well based on its mode of lifting the product. This should be implemented as a string value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FacilityParameter.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FiberMode.Singlemode
member.summary: A single, narrow, core of constant refractive index, surrounded by glass cladding. The core diameter is comparable to a wave length of the light (about 5 um).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FiberMode.Multimode
member.summary: The core has a graded refractive index. The core is generally about 50um in diameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FiberMode.Other
member.summary: The fiber mode is neither singlemode or multimode.

member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of FlowQualifiers

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Allocated
member.summary: Indicates product characteristics that were allocated back to a well as opposed to being measured at the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Budget
member.summary: A performance requirement as determined by a budget.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Constraint
member.summary: Indicates product characteristics that were determined by an allowable or other performance limit. This includes allowables which are usually established by a regulatory agency for a product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Difference
member.summary: A value that is the difference between e.g. a target value and a metered value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Forecast
member.summary: A forecast future value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Derived
member.summary: Indicates product volumes that were derived directly from one or more other flows.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Estimate
member.summary: An estimated or calculated performance, possibly based on comparable product flow units, but not based on reservoir simulations for the particular product flow unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.MassAdjusted
member.summary: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Measured
member.summary: Indicates product volumes that were actually measured at the port.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Metered
member.summary: A value that is read off an officially calibrated instrument (e.g. a gas chromatograph).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.MeteredFiscal
member.summary: A value that is generated by measurement and calculation and has an impact on company revenue and government taxation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Nominated
member.summary: Normally a 1 day forcast promise to a buyer.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Potential
member.summary: The estimated maximum which is possible.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Processed
member.summary: A measured value that has been processed. This is different from derived because it is fundamentally a variation of the original value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Quota
member.summary: An amount, set by some authority, which may or may not be based on technical criteria.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Recommended
member.summary: A value which is believed to be very desirable if it can be achieved. This a recommendation that something be changed in order to achieve this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Simulated
member.summary: An estimated performance based on a simulation that includes the particular product flow unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Target
member.summary: The desired value. What you are aiming for.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.TariffBasis
member.summary: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.ValueAdjusted
member.summary: A value that is adjusted due to a change in the value of a product.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowQualifier.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.DeclineCurve
member.summary: Indicates a pseudo decline-curve of flow rate over time. This presumes that the flow will not be interrupted over that time period. Specialization of "forecast".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Difference
member.summary: A value is derived by taking the difference between two other values. Specialization of "derived".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Fiscal
member.summary: The value was measured for fiscal purposes. Specialization of "measured".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Fixed
member.summary: The value supplied is the only value permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Minimum
member.summary: The value supplied is the minimum permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Maximum
member.summary: The value supplied is the maximum permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Raw
member.summary: The value is a raw measurement. Specialization of "measured".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Recalibrated
member.summary: The value has changed due to a recalibration of the sensor. Specialization of "measured".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Standard
member.summary: A standard forecast as opposed to a decline curve. Specialization of "forecast".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.FlowSubQualifier.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint
member.summary: The type of Distributed Temperature Survey (DTS) fiber point.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of InstalledFiberPoints

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.Splice
member.summary: A point at which a fiber is physically, and semi-permanently, connected to another length of fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.Connector
member.summary: A point at which a cable connector is installed, which allows the fiber to be connected to another instrument or fiber length.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.EndOfFiber
member.summary: The end of the fiber. If a U-geometry is used, and a connector is at both ends, the connector classification should be used rather than the end of fiber classification.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.BaseOfFiber
member.summary: The deepest point of the installed fiber in a well. This is a valid value for fiber installations that do NOT turn around at the bottom (J- and U-type installations).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.TurnAroundPoint
member.summary: The point in the turn-around-sub at which measured depth stops increasing and begins decreasing. This is a valid value for fiber installations of the J- and U- type only.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.StartOfFiber
member.summary: The start of the fiber. If appropriate, the connector classification should be used instead of this classification.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.OvenEntryPoint
member.summary: The point on the fiber at which it enters the oven.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.OvenExitPoint
member.summary: The point on the fiber at which it exits the oven. The oven exit point should be closer to the wellbore than the oven entry point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.DownholeGauge
member.summary: A downhole point on the fiber at which a gauge is attached.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.DtsLaserHead
member.summary: The connector between the laser head and the optical fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.DtsReferenceOven
member.summary: The oven within or near the DTS instrument box which maintains a length of fiber at a reference temperature.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.SpliceBox
member.summary: Container in which ends of lengths of fiber are joined.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.WellheadJunctionBox
member.summary: The device at which a fiber originating at the instrument box is joined to a fiber installed in a wellbore. This is a recommended location at which LengthAlongFiber and measuredDepth in the wellbore are correlated

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.BaseTubingHangerFlange
member.summary: The device at the base of the wellhead to which the production tubing is attached. This is a recommended location at which LengthAlongFiber and measuredDepth in the wellbore are correlated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.PbrWetConnect
member.summary: The top-most point at which the fiber intersects the PBR (polished bore receptacle). For J- and U- installations, on the upward portion of the fiber, this is the point at which it leaves the pbf.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.TopEspPump
member.summary: The top of the electrical submersible pump (ESP). This is the minimum measured depth point of the pump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.BaseEspPump
member.summary: The base of the electrical submersible pump (ESP). This is the maximum measured depth point of the pump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.WellheadTemperatureGauge
member.summary: Temperature measuring device at the wellhead independent of the optic fiber sensor.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.TopCompletionZone
member.summary: The point which is the minimum measured depth of a completion zone.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.BaseCompletionZone
member.summary: The point which is the maximum measured depth of a completion zone.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.InstalledFiberPoint.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.summary: A single sleeve valve. This is a type of tubing valve which has a sliding sleeve to cover holes in the tubing. You cover all of the holes in order to close the valve. For configurations oriented toward production, the inlet is on the casing side and the outlet is on the tubing side. For injection, the reverse would be true.
