member.summary: Consumed (all methods) by the facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeBlackStart
member.summary: Consummed to restart power facilities as a result of an overall power outage.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeCompressor
member.summary: Consummed by compressors.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeNonCompressor
member.summary: Consumed by devices other than compressors.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeEmitted
member.summary: Released into the atmosphere as a by-product of consumption.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeFlare
member.summary: Burned in a flare. A fluid stream that has one or more flares as the ultimate target.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeHpFlare
member.summary: Burned in a high pressure flare.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeLpFlare
member.summary: Burned in a low pressure flare.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeFuel
member.summary: Consumed by processing equipment.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ConsumeVenting
member.summary: Released into the atmosphere.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Disposal
member.summary: A fluid stream that contains waste fluids for disposal.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Export
member.summary: Leaving the installation for commercialized purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ExportRequested
member.summary: Requested to leave the installation for commercialized purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ExportNominated
member.summary: Planned to leave the installation for commercialized purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.ExportShortfall
member.summary: Difference between what was requested and what was delivered.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.GasLift
member.summary: Injected into a producing well to reduce the hydrostataic pressure of the fluid column. The resulting reduction in bottom hole pressure allows the reservoir liquids to flow.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.HydrocarbonAccounting
member.summary: An accounting of all of the fluids into and out of Stock (i.e., Inventory) which includes all storage facilities at a site including fluid within a pipeline.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Import
member.summary: Entering the facility for commercialized purposes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Injection
member.summary: Inject into a well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Inventory
member.summary: Stock at a facility. For a period that represents an event, the amount would represent the current amount of inventory. For other periods, the amount would represent the addition (positive value) or drawdown (negative value) over that period. For an individual storage facility (e.g., a tank), the amounts would represent that tank. For an overall facility, the amounts would represent all tanks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Overboard
member.summary: Dropped overboard into the sea.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Production
member.summary: Exploited from a reservoir. This is independent of any disposition.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Sale
member.summary: A fluid stream that is sold and transported to a buyer by pipeline.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Storage
member.summary: A fluid stream that is directed to one or more storage locations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingFlow.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod
member.summary: A period of one day. If the report does not represent one day then this represents the 24 hour period ending at the end of the report period.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of ReportingPeriods

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.Day
member.summary: A period of one day. If the report does not represent one day then this represents the 24 hour period ending at the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.Week
member.summary: A period of one week. If the report does not represent one week then this represents the 7 times 24 hour period ending at the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.Month
member.summary: A period of one calendar month.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.Year
member.summary: A period of one gregorian year.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.YearToDate
member.summary: A period from the beginning of the year to the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.MonthToDate
member.summary: A period from the beginning of the calendar month to the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.DailyYearToDate
member.summary: The average per day over the period from the beginning of the year to the end of the report period

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.DailyMonthToDate
member.summary: The average per day over the period from the beginning of the month to the end of the report period

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.TotalCumulative
member.summary: A period with no beginning that ends at the end of the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.Report
member.summary: A period coinciding with the report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.ReportStart
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with the start of report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.ReportEnd
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with the end of report period.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.PreviousPeriod
member.summary: The previous reporting period. For example, if the report period represents a day then the previous period represents the previous day.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.Midnight
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with midnight during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at midnight - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.Noon
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with noon during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at noon - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.ZeroSixZeroZero
member.summary: A point in time coinciding with 6 am during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at 6 am - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.GasDay
member.summary: A period in time that is all space of time within a day (24 hour period) starting at 06:00 AM and ending 06:00 AM next day.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.GasMonth
member.summary: A period in time that is all space of time within a whole given month starting at 06:00 AM the first day and ending at 06:00 AM the first day of next month.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.GasYear
member.summary: A period in time that is all time within a period starting at 06:00 AM October 1st and ending at same date and time the following year.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.GasYearToDate
member.summary: A period in time that is all space of time within a period starting at 06:00 AM October 1st ending at 06:00 AM at a given date.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.LifeToDate
member.summary: A period in time that is all space of time within a period from starting up an equipment, installation, field, license, etc, to a given date.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingPeriod.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Oleic
member.summary: An undifferentiated liquid fluid phase in which the dominant continuous materials are liquid hydrocarbons. This phase is often called the "oil phase".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Aqueous
member.summary: An undifferentiated liquid fluid phase in which the dominant continuous material is liquid water. This phase is often called the "water phase".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Vapor
member.summary: An undifferentiated fluid phase that is distinctly gaseous. This phase is often called the "gas phase".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Liquid
member.summary: An undifferentiated fluid phase that is distinctly liquid. This includes water.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.CSeven
member.summary: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with seven carbon atoms.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.CEight
member.summary: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with eight carbon atoms.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.CNine
member.summary: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with nine carbon atoms.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.COneZero
member.summary: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with ten carbon atoms.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.CarbonMonoxodeGas
member.summary: Carbon monoxode in a gaseous state.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.CarbonDioxideGas
member.summary: Carbon dioxide in a gaseous state.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Chemical
member.summary: A chemical of some type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Condensate
member.summary: Mixture of light and heavier hydrocarbons in a liguid state.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.CondensateGross
member.summary: Light hydrocarbon fractions produced with natural gas, which condense into liquid at normal temperatures and pressures associated with surface production equipment.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.CondensateNet
member.summary: Hydrocatbon condensate containing only the heavier carbon fractions C5 to C10+.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.CrudeStabilized
member.summary: A crude oil that has been stabilized by separating out dissolved gas.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Cuttings
member.summary: Drill cuttings.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.DiethyleneGlycol
member.summary: A compound where the main component is diethylene glycol.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Diesel
member.summary: Diesel fuel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Dioxygen
member.summary: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.ElectricPower
member.summary: Electrical power.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Ethane
member.summary: A compound where the main component is ethane.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.EthaneComponent
member.summary: Ethane as a component in another fluid.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.Gas
member.summary: Gas mixture of hydrocarbons.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.GasDry
member.summary: A natural gas that occurs in the absence of condensate or liquid hydrocarbons, or gas that has had condensable hydrocarbons removed, mainly consisting of methane gas.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.GasRich
member.summary: Gas mixture of light and heavier hydrocarbons than a lean gas.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.GasWet
member.summary: A natural gas that contains less methane (typically less than 85% methane) and more ethane and other more complex hydrocarbons like propane, butane and naphtha.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.GasComponentInOil
member.summary: Gas as a component in oil.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.HeliumGas

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.LiquifiedNaturalGas
member.summary: A liquid compound that is natural gas compressed and supercooled to -167 deg C (-269 deg F) into a liquid to reduce its volume to 1/635th for storage and transportation. Liquefied natural gas has a calorific value of 22,300 Btu/lb. It consists of about 91% of methane and 7% ethane with some propane, butane, and higher hydrocarbons. One tonne liquified natural gas is equal to about 53 Mcf of gas. Liquified natural gas can be vaporized by ambient air, another fluid, or directfired vaporizer.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ReportingProduct.LiquifiedPetroleumGas
member.summary: A liquid compound that is predominantly butane and propane separated from natural gasoline or natural gas and sold as fuel - commonly known as bottled gas, tank gas or LP-gas.

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of TimeSeriesKeywords

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesKeyword.AssetIdentifier
member.summary: A PRODML formatted URI identifier of the asset (facility) related to the value. This captures the kind of asset as well as the unique identifier of the asset within a specified context (the authority). The identifier may define a hierarchy of assets.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesKeyword.Qualifier
member.summary: A qualifier of the meaning of the value. This is used to distinguish between variations of an underlying meaning based on the method of creating the value (e.g., measured versus simulated). The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type FlowQualifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesKeyword.Subqualifier
member.summary: A specialization of a qualifier. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type FlowSubQualifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesKeyword.Product
member.summary: The type of product that is represented by the value. This is generally used with things like volume or flow rate. It is generally meaningless for things like temperature or pressure. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type ReportingProduct.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesKeyword.Flow
member.summary: Defines the part of the flow network where the asset is located. This is most useful in situations (e.g., reporting) where detailed knowledge of the network configuration is not needed. Basically, this classifies different segments of the flow network based on its purpose within the context of the whole network. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type ReportingFlow.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TimeSeriesKeyword.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus
member.summary: An indicator of the quality of a value. This is designed for a SCADA or OPC style of value stasus. The token in parentheses are OPC's status string for the condition.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of ValueStatuss

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.BadCalibration
member.summary: The calibration status of the sensor is unknown. (Out of Calibration)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.RangeLimit
member.summary: The value is range limited, that is, at or near the end of range of the sensor. The value might be clamped. (Low Limited, High Limited)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.Questionable
member.summary: The value is just plain questionable. (Sub-Normal, Non-specific)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.DeviceFailure
member.summary: The unit to which the sensor is attached is not running. (Device Failure)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.SensorFailure
member.summary: The field sensor itself is not working due to hardware failure or misconfiguration. (Sensor Failure)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.CommFailure
member.summary: The communication to the field sensor is not working. That is, communcation cannot be established or maintained. (Comm Failure)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.Timeout
member.summary: Communication to the field sensor has timed out, that is, a connection exists, but a request for a field sensor data value has failed. (Last Known Value)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ValueStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ExtensionName
member.summary: The names of agreed extensions to WITSML. This list may be locally extended but it is recommended that new names be approved by the WITSML SIG before use. Each standard name must define its data type. For string types, the maximum length must be defined in number of characters. For measures, the expected measure class must be defined.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ExtensionName.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ExtensionName.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ExtensionName.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of ExtensionNames

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ExtensionName.Dummyexamplestring
member.summary: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a string of maximum length of 64 characters which can be used in the commonData of any object. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ExtensionName.Dummyexamplemeasure
member.summary: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a length measure which can only be specified in the commonData of the well and wellbore objects. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field. The extensionMeasureClass constrains the allowed units of measure for each value. The extensionDataType value of double constrains the size of each value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.ExtensionName.Dummyexampledatetime
member.summary: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a dateTime value which can be specified anywhere in the tubular object. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType
member.summary: These values represent the lithological terminology used in descriptions of rock cuttings in mud logs.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of LithologyTypes

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Andesite
member.summary: Intermediate porphyritic volcanic rock consisting of plagioclase, pyroxene, hornblende and bitotite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Anhydrite
member.summary: The mineral form of anhydrous calcium sulfate, commonly massive in evaporite beds.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Arkose
member.summary: An indurated arenaceous deposit consisting chiefly of quartz and feldspar (>25%).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Basalt
member.summary: Volcanic rock consisting essentially of plagioclase feldspar and pyroxene.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Breccia
member.summary: A lithified rock rich in angular fragments of size greater than 2mm.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Calcarenite
member.summary: A limestone more than half of which consists of cemented sand-size grains of calcium carbonate: a consolidated calcareous sand.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Calcilutite
member.summary: A limestone more than half of which consists of detrital calcite particles of silt and/or clay size: a consolidated calcareous mud.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Calcisiltite
member.summary: A limestone more than half of which consists of detrital calcite particles of silt size: a consolidated calcareous silt.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Chalk
member.summary: A fine-grained limestone composed largely of coccolith fragments.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Chert
member.summary: Siliceous sedimentary rock containing finely crystalline snd fibrous quartz.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Clay
member.summary: Unconsolidated deposit of very fine particles of size generally less than 1/256mm and composed of clay minerals.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Claystone
member.summary: An indurated clay, lacking the fissility of shale.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Coal
member.summary: A combustible organic sedimentary rock with less than 40% of mineral matter (based on dry material) composed of polymers of cyclic hydrocarbons.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Conglomerate
member.summary: An indurated sedimentary rock containing an essential quantity of rounded rock fragments larger than 2mm, and normally having a matrix of sand.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Diabase
member.summary: Igneous rock of grain size intermediate between basalt and gabbro composed of plagioclase feldspar, pyroxene and opaque minerals. Synonym: dolerite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Diorite
member.summary: Plutonic igneous rock consisting of plagioclase feldspar, commonly with hornblende and biotite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Dolomite
member.summary: Sedimentary rock containing more than 90% dolomite (mineral) and less than 10% calcite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.DolomiteCalcareous
member.summary: A dolomite rock containing more than 10% calcite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.ExtrusiveRockVolcanic
member.summary: Igneous rocks formed by solidification of material erupted sub-aerially or sub-aqueously onto the earth's surface, as either lava flows or pyroclastic material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Feldspar
member.summary: The family of aluminium silicates of sodium, potassium, calcium and other metals which comprise over 60% of the earth's crust, are the most abundant mineral group, and occur in all types of rocks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Gabbro
member.summary: Coarse grained plutonic igneous rock composed essentially of calcic plagioclase feldspar, pyroxenes and iron oxide.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Glauconite
member.summary: A mineral composed of ferrous potassium silicates related to mica which commonly imparts a green color to its sedimentary host rock.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Gneiss
member.summary: A metamorphic rock, commonly foliated and crystalline, whose mineral content can range from quartz and feldspars to amphiboles and pyroxenes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Granite
member.summary: Coarse grained plutonic rock typically containing free quartz, alkali feldspar and biotite mica.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Gravel
member.summary: An unconsolidated deposit of coarse clastics. The diameters on the Wenworth scale are generally greater than 2mm.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Greenstones
member.summary: A field term for any dark fine grained altered or metamorphosed basic igneous rock.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Greywacke
member.summary: A dark grey consolidated deposit containing feldspar, rock fragments and a dark chloritic matrix.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Gumbo
member.summary: A term used in the U.S. for clay soils that become sticky, impervious, and plastic when wet.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Gypsum
member.summary: A mineral composed of hydrous calcium sulphate, commonly forming thick extensive evaporite beds.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Halite
member.summary: A mineral composed of sodium chloride common in evaporite rocks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Igneous
member.summary: Term applied to rock or mineral formed by solidification of molten or partly molten material (magma).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.IntrusvieRockPlutonic
member.summary: Igneous rock formed by cooling and solidification of magma within the earth's crust.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Lignite
member.summary: A low-rank humic coal.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Limestone
member.summary: A sedimentary rock composed mostly of the mineral calcite (calcium carbonate) which is the consolidated equivalent of lime mud, calcareous sand, and/or shell fragments.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.LimestoneArgillaceous
member.summary: A limestone homogeneously mixed with 10-50% clay minerals.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.LimestoneDolomitic
member.summary: A limestone containing 10-50% dolomite and 50-90% calcite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.LimestoneSandy
member.summary: A limestone homogeneously mixed with 10-50% quartz grains.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Marble
member.summary: A metamorphic rock composed of calcite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Marl
member.summary: A consolidated or semi-consolidated mixture of clay and generally fine grained carbonate material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.MetamorphicRocks
member.summary: Rocks formed by mineralogical, chemical and structural alteration of pre-existing rocks under conditions of temperature and pressure at depth in the earth.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Mudstone
member.summary: Consolidated and indurated mud.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.NoDescription
member.summary: No description is provided.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.NoSample
member.summary: No sample is provided.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Ophiolite
member.summary: Basic and ultra-basic igneous rocks and their metamorposed, often hydrated, derivatives, believed to represent former oceanic crust.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Peat
member.summary: Unconsolidated, semi-carbonised plant remains which are a precursor of humic coal.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Phosphate
member.summary: Any mineral compound containing the ((PO4)3) radical.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.PhosphateRock
member.summary: Any rock containing phosphate minerals such as apatite of sufficient purity and abundance to be an economic resource.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.PotassiumAndMagnesiumSalts
member.summary: Salts such as sylvinite, carnalite, keiserite with swelling properties that can severely obstruct drilling operations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Quartzite
member.summary: A sedimentary rock composed of more than 95% of quartz.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Rhyolite
member.summary: Silica rich volcanic rock consisting of quartz and alkali feldspar with minor plagioclase and biotite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Salt
member.summary: Common term for naturally occurring sodium chloride.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Sand
member.summary: An aggregation of particles having diameters in the range 1/16mm to 2mm usually consisting of quartz.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Sandstone
member.summary: A sedimentary rock composed of indurated sand.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Schist
member.summary: A strongly foliated crystalline metamorphic rock.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Serpentine
member.summary: A rock forming mineral of hydrous iron and magnesium silicates, often resulting from metamorhism of amphiboles and pyroxenes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Shale
member.summary: A fine-grained sedimentary rock formed by the compaction of clay, silt or mud.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Silt
member.summary: Unconsolidated sedimentary material with grain sizes between 1/16mm and 1/256mm.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Siltstone
member.summary: Consolidated silt.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Slate
member.summary: A compact fine-grained metamorphic rock displaying slaty cleavage along which the rock may be cut into sheets.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Syenite
member.summary: Plutonic igneous rock composed essentially of alkali feldspar, with lesser sodic plagioclase, biotite and hornblende, and minor quartz.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.TilliteDiamictite
member.summary: Consolidated unsorted glacial deposits with particles ranging from boulder to mud in grain size and of highly variable composition.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Trachyte
member.summary: A group of fine-grained often porphyritic volcanic rocks containing alkali feldspar and minor mafic minerals.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Tuff
member.summary: An indurated pyroclastic deposit, predominantly consisting of fine-grained volcanic rocks: sedimentary particles may be present. Tuff may be deposited sub-aerially or sub-aqueously, and may be well sorted or heterogeneous.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Ultrabasic
member.summary: A class of igneous rocks composed mostly of mafic minerals such as pyroxenes along with calcic feldspar, with no free silica and a total silica content less than about 45%.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Undifferentiated
member.summary: The lithology is not differentiated. This is typically used to fill out a lithology description to 100 percent.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.LithologyType.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass
member.summary: Defines classes of measures and their allowed units of measures. For a value whose underlying meaning conforms to one of these classes, any specified unit of measure must conform to the defined list. These are copied from the Energistics (POSC) Units Classes v2.2. The units of measure map to the POSC Units of Measure Dictionary v2.2.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of MeasureClasss

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.AbsorbedDose
member.summary: The amount of energy absorbed per mass.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.ActivityOfRadioactivity
member.summary: A measure of the radiation being emitted.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.ConcentrationOfB
member.summary: molar concentration of a substance

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.AmountOfSubstance
member.summary: molar amount of a substance

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.AnglePerTime
member.summary: The angular velocity. The rate of change of an angle.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.Attenuation
member.summary: A logarithmic, fractional change of some measure, generally power or amplitude, over a standard range. This is generally used for frequency attenuation over an octave.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.DataTransmissionSpeed
member.summary: used primarily for computer transmission rates.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.DeltaTemperature
member.summary: Delta temperature refers to temperature differences. For non-zero offset temperature scales, Fahrenheit and Celsius, the conversion formulas are different than for absolute temperatures.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.Dimensionless
member.summary: A dimensionless quantity is the ratio of two dimensional quantities. The quantity types are not apparent from the basic dimensionless class, but may be apparent in variations - such as area per area, volume per volume, or mass per mass.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.ElectrochemicalEquivalent
member.summary: An electrochemical equivalent differs from molarity in that the valence (oxidation reduction potential) of the element is also considered.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.FrequencyInterval
member.summary: An octave is a doubling of a frquency.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.GammaRayApiUnit
member.summary: This class is defined by the API, and is used for units of gamma ray log response.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.Ph
member.summary: The pH is a class that measures the hydrogen ion concentration (acidity).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.MeasureClass.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagLocation
member.summary: Defines the locations where an equipment tag might be found.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagLocation.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagLocation.#ctor(System.String)

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagLocation.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of NameTagLocations

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagLocation.Body
member.summary: The body of the equipment. For tubular components this specifies a location toward the middle of the component.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagLocation.Box
member.summary: The female threaded end of a device.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagLocation.Pin

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology
member.summary: Defines the mechanisms for attaching an equipment tag to an item.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of NameTagTechnologys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.Tagged
member.summary: Independent identification components attached or embedded to a larger component for purposes of identification of the larger component. Tags typically use electronic, radio or sound based technologies and that require a special non-optical device to read them. Radio Frequency Identification (RFID tags) are of this type, as are some magnetic and sound based identification technologies.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.Labeled
member.summary: An optical label attached to a component. The label may be glued, riveted or attached by some other method and may contain a serial number, barcode or other optically recognized information. Note that a label may possibly have a combination of identifiers associated with it, such as a serial number, a barcode and an embedded RFID identifier. This would generate three nameTags for the one physical label, two of type 'label' for the barcode and serial number and one of type 'tagged' for the RFID identifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.Intrinsic
member.summary: Identification technologies where the intrinsic properties of the component to be identified contain the identification information and no other unique code has been added. For example, some magnetic identification technologies use grooves machined into a component. Some components may also be identified, for example, by their individual sonic signature or optical profile.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.Stamped
member.summary: An identification code physically stamped into the base material of the component to be identified. Note that if a serial number is stamped into a label attached to a component, 'labeled' should be used and not 'stamped'. Stamped identifiers can wear off but can not fall off.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.Painted
member.summary: Painted or stenciled on the material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.Temporary
member.summary: Temporary identification codes marked with grease pencil, chalk, or such.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.NameTagTechnology.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.QualifierType.Stylolite

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.QualifierType.Stylolitic

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.QualifierType.Tuffite

member.summary: Acetylene content of the sample (cycle-based)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.Activity
member.summary: A WITSML activity name indicating what activity is currently being performed on the rig. IT IS ESSENTIAL that this information be as accurate and current as possible. Added via Issue

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.ActivityWits
member.summary: Code indicating what activity is currently being performed on the rig. IT IS ESSENTIAL that this information be as accurate and current as possible. Use the integer codes shown in WITS Appendix E.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.AnnularVelocityMaximum
member.summary: Calculated maximum velocity of the drilling fluid in the annulus.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.AnnularVelocityMinimum
member.summary: Calculated minimum velocity of the drilling fluid in the annulus.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.AntistokesIntensity
member.summary: Anti-Stokes intensity values from a Distributed Temperature Survey.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.AzimuthCorrected
member.summary: Borehole azimuth measured by the directional sensor relative to true north, i.e. corrected for declination.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.AzimuthUncorrected
member.summary: Borehole azimuth measured by the directional sensor relative to local magnetic north.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.BitJetImpactForce
member.summary: Force exerted on the bottom of the hole by the flow of fluid through the bit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.BitPressureLoss
member.summary: Calculated pressure differential across the bit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.BitRevolutionsCumulative
member.summary: Measured/calculated running total of the bit revolutions while on bottom. This does not include reaming time. For a re run bit, it is the total revolutions since the last trip.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.BitTotalMeasuredDepth
member.summary: Measured depth at the end of the bit run (null if bit run not over).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.BlockPosition
member.summary: Measured distance of the traveling block above the rotary table.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.BuildRate
member.summary: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.Caliper
member.summary: Value of the Caliper sensor.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CarbonDioxideAverage
member.summary: Carbon dioxide content of the returning mud sample, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CarbonDioxideCyclebased
member.summary: Carbon dioxide content of the sample. (cycle-based)

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CarbonDioxideMaximum
member.summary: Maximum carbon dioxide content of the returning mud sample, over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CarbonDioxideMinimum
member.summary: Minimum carbon dioxide content of the returning mud sample, over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CationExchangeCapacity
member.summary: The cation exchange capacity of a sample, measured using the methylene blue titration method.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.Cavings
member.summary: That proportion of the cuttings which are interpreted to be cavings.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingCementVolume
member.summary: Cumulative volume of cement pumped (all batches in the current stage) at the time the record is generated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingCumulativeReturns
member.summary: Cumulative calculated/measured returns since the start of the cement job. This does not include mud circulation prior to pumping cement or spacer

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingDensityInAverage
member.summary: Measured density of the fluid entering the well, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingDensityOutAverage
member.summary: Measured density of the fluid leaving the well, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingEcdAtCasingShoe
member.summary: Effective circulating density, at the casing shoe measured depth, of the fluids currently in the hole.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingFlowRateInAverage
member.summary: Flow rate of the fluid entering the hole, measured with a flow sensor, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingFlowRateInCalculated
member.summary: Flow rate of the fluid entering the hole, based on strokes per minute, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingFlowRateOutAverage
member.summary: Flow rate of the fluid leaving the hole, measured with a flow sensor, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingFlowRateOutCalculated
member.summary: Flow rate of the fluid leaving the hole, based on strokes per minute, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingFlowRateOutRelative
member.summary: Percent of flow out as measured by a paddle or target sensor in the flow line, where 0% = no flow, 100% = full deflection of the sensor.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingFluidType
member.summary: Type/batch of fluid currently being pumped. An integer number indicates the fluid type and a letter (ie. A,B,C etc.) indicates the batch. Type codes are: 1=Drilling fluid, 2=Spacer, 3=Cement, 4=Displacement. The coding sequence for a cement job could look like this: 1A, 2A, 2B, 3A, 3B, 4A, etc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingIndividualVolume
member.summary: Cumulative volume of fluid pumped, for the current individual type/batch, at the time the record is generated. This number should be reset to zero whenever the fluid type or batch changes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingJobType
member.summary: Type of cementing job being performed. Valid types are: 1=Casing, 2=Liner, 3=Plug, 4=Squeeze.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingPlugs
member.summary: Number/status of all plugs for the current stage. Number the plugs in sequential order starting with the first plug that will be released (i.e. bottom plug (1), middle plug (2), top plug (3)). The status is either loaded (L) or dropped (D) (ie. 1D2L3L).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingPumpPressureAverage
member.summary: Measured pump pressure, averaged over the interval. This is the pressure required to displace fluid down the hole during the entire cementing operation (ie. rig pump pressure, cement truck pump pressure, etc.).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingStage
member.summary: Current stage number of the cementing operation (i.e. 1 , 2, 3, etc.).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingTemperatureInAverage
member.summary: Measured temperature of the fluid entering the well, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingTemperatureOutAverage
member.summary: Measured temperature of the fluid leaving the well, averaged over the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingTotalVolume
member.summary: Cumulative volume of spacer, cement and displacement fluid pumped (current stage) at the time the record is generated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.CementingVolumeToBumpPlug
member.summary: Calculated volume required for the plug to bump.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.RealtimeData.PassNumber
member.summary: Sequential number assigned to repeated MWD logging runs over the same hole interval. The original hole should have a pass number of 0. Any new hole drilled should have a pass number of 0. Repeat logging sections in a hole should have the pass number incremented by 1. Except for returning to 0 for new sections, the pass number will always increment for each repeat section. As an example: A hole is drilled from 2000m to 4000m with pass number 0. It is decided to repeat log the section from 3500m to 4000m. The pass number is 1 for this section. New hole is again drilled from 4000m. The pass number returns to 0. After drilling to 5000m, it is decided to relog the section from 3500m to 5000m. The pass number for this section is 2. Following this, another repeat log is taken from 4800m to 5000m. This pass is number 3.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm
member.summary: The type of algorithm used in the calculation of a trajectory station dependent data. This is traditionally positional information except for the cases of inertial survey data. See API Bulletin D20 "BULLETIN ON DIRECTIONAL DRILLING SURVEY CALCULATION METHODS AND TERMINOLOGY", First Edition December 31, 1985.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of TrajStnCalcAlgorithms

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.ConstantToolFace
member.summary: An algorithm used to design a well trajectory during the planning stage

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.MinimumCurvature
member.summary: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path between stations is that of a circular arc in 3-D space. Also known as "Minimum Radius Of Curvature" method.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.Tangential
member.summary: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path between stations is a straight line oriented according to the seconds stations orientation. Also known as "Backward Station" and "Terminal Angle" methods.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.BalancedTangential
member.summary: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path between stations is along two straight lines, with the first section oriented according to the first stations orientation and the second line oriented according to the second stations orientation. Each line segment is set to have a length of half the measured depth difference between the two stations. Also known as "Acceleration", "Secant", "Trapezoidal", and "Vector Averaging" methods.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.AverageAngle
member.summary: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path between stations is along a straight line oriented according to the average of the inclination and azimuth orientations of the start and end stations. Also known as "Angle Averaging" method.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.RadiusOfCurvature
member.summary: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path is a helix with a fixed vertical radius wrapped around a cylinder of fixed radius. Both radii can tend to infinity yielding simple circular arcs in either the horizontal or vertical planes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.Inertial
member.summary: This encompasses surveying methods where the positional data was not derived from a transformation of MD,INC,AZM, but are provided directly by some other mechanism such as direct positional output from an inertial gyro system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.Custom
member.summary: This encompasses methodologies which are similar to the Inertial method in that they are direct populations of the positional data, which have been determined by some other possibly non-published methodology.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.PRODML120.TrajStnCalcAlgorithm.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType
member.summary: These values represent the lithological terminology used in descriptions of rock cuttings in mud logs.

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.GetList
member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of LithologyTypes

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Andesite
member.summary: Intermediate porphyritic volcanic rock consisting of plagioclase, pyroxene, hornblende and bitotite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Anhydrite
member.summary: The mineral form of anhydrous calcium sulfate, commonly massive in evaporite beds.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Arkose
member.summary: An indurated arenaceous deposit consisting chiefly of quartz and feldspar (>25%).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Basalt
member.summary: Volcanic rock consisting essentially of plagioclase feldspar and pyroxene.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Breccia
member.summary: A lithified rock rich in angular fragments of size greater than 2mm.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Calcarenite
member.summary: A limestone more than half of which consists of cemented sand-size grains of calcium carbonate: a consolidated calcareous sand.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Calcilutite
member.summary: A limestone more than half of which consists of detrital calcite particles of silt and/or clay size: a consolidated calcareous mud.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Calcisiltite
member.summary: A limestone more than half of which consists of detrital calcite particles of silt size: a consolidated calcareous silt.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Chalk
member.summary: A fine-grained limestone composed largely of coccolith fragments.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Chert
member.summary: Siliceous sedimentary rock containing finely crystalline snd fibrous quartz.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Clay
member.summary: Unconsolidated deposit of very fine particles of size generally less than 1/256mm and composed of clay minerals.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Claystone
member.summary: An indurated clay, lacking the fissility of shale.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Coal
member.summary: A combustible organic sedimentary rock with less than 40% of mineral matter (based on dry material) composed of polymers of cyclic hydrocarbons.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Conglomerate
member.summary: An indurated sedimentary rock containing an essential quantity of rounded rock fragments larger than 2mm, and normally having a matrix of sand.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Diabase
member.summary: Igneous rock of grain size intermediate between basalt and gabbro composed of plagioclase feldspar, pyroxene and opaque minerals. Synonym: dolerite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Diorite
member.summary: Plutonic igneous rock consisting of plagioclase feldspar, commonly with hornblende and biotite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Dolomite
member.summary: Sedimentary rock containing more than 90% dolomite (mineral) and less than 10% calcite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.DolomiteCalcareous
member.summary: A dolomite rock containing more than 10% calcite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.ExtrusiveRockVolcanic
member.summary: Igneous rocks formed by solidification of material erupted sub-aerially or sub-aqueously onto the earth's surface, as either lava flows or pyroclastic material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Feldspar
member.summary: The family of aluminium silicates of sodium, potassium, calcium and other metals which comprise over 60% of the earth's crust, are the most abundant mineral group, and occur in all types of rocks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Gabbro
member.summary: Coarse grained plutonic igneous rock composed essentially of calcic plagioclase feldspar, pyroxenes and iron oxide.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Glauconite
member.summary: A mineral composed of ferrous potassium silicates related to mica which commonly imparts a green color to its sedimentary host rock.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Gneiss
member.summary: A metamorphic rock, commonly foliated and crystalline, whose mineral content can range from quartz and feldspars to amphiboles and pyroxenes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Granite
member.summary: Coarse grained plutonic rock typically containing free quartz, alkali feldspar and biotite mica.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Gravel
member.summary: An unconsolidated deposit of coarse clastics. The diameters on the Wenworth scale are generally greater than 2mm.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Greenstones
member.summary: A field term for any dark fine grained altered or metamorphosed basic igneous rock.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Greywacke
member.summary: A dark grey consolidated deposit containing feldspar, rock fragments and a dark chloritic matrix.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Gumbo
member.summary: A term used in the U.S. for clay soils that become sticky, impervious, and plastic when wet.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Gypsum
member.summary: A mineral composed of hydrous calcium sulphate, commonly forming thick extensive evaporite beds.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Halite
member.summary: A mineral composed of sodium chloride common in evaporite rocks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Igneous
member.summary: Term applied to rock or mineral formed by solidification of molten or partly molten material (magma).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.IntrusvieRockPlutonic
member.summary: Igneous rock formed by cooling and solidification of magma within the earth's crust.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Lignite
member.summary: A low-rank humic coal.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Limestone
member.summary: A sedimentary rock composed mostly of the mineral calcite (calcium carbonate) which is the consolidated equivalent of lime mud, calcareous sand, and/or shell fragments.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.LimestoneArgillaceous
member.summary: A limestone homogeneously mixed with 10-50% clay minerals.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.LimestoneDolomitic
member.summary: A limestone containing 10-50% dolomite and 50-90% calcite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.LimestoneSandy
member.summary: A limestone homogeneously mixed with 10-50% quartz grains.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Marble
member.summary: A metamorphic rock composed of calcite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Marl
member.summary: A consolidated or semi-consolidated mixture of clay and generally fine grained carbonate material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.MetamorphicRocks
member.summary: Rocks formed by mineralogical, chemical and structural alteration of pre-existing rocks under conditions of temperature and pressure at depth in the earth.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Mudstone
member.summary: Consolidated and indurated mud.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.NoDescription
member.summary: No description is provided.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.NoSample
member.summary: No sample is provided.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Ophiolite
member.summary: Basic and ultra-basic igneous rocks and their metamorposed, often hydrated, derivatives, believed to represent former oceanic crust.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Peat
member.summary: Unconsolidated, semi-carbonised plant remains which are a precursor of humic coal.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Phosphate
member.summary: Any mineral compound containing the ((PO4)3) radical.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.PhosphateRock
member.summary: Any rock containing phosphate minerals such as apatite of sufficient purity and abundance to be an economic resource.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.PotassiumAndMagnesiumSalts
member.summary: Salts such as sylvinite, carnalite, keiserite with swelling properties that can severely obstruct drilling operations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Quartzite
member.summary: A sedimentary rock composed of more than 95% of quartz.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Rhyolite
member.summary: Silica rich volcanic rock consisting of quartz and alkali feldspar with minor plagioclase and biotite.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Salt
member.summary: Common term for naturally occurring sodium chloride.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Sand
member.summary: An aggregation of particles having diameters in the range 1/16mm to 2mm usually consisting of quartz.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Sandstone
member.summary: A sedimentary rock composed of indurated sand.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Schist
member.summary: A strongly foliated crystalline metamorphic rock.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Serpentine
member.summary: A rock forming mineral of hydrous iron and magnesium silicates, often resulting from metamorhism of amphiboles and pyroxenes.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Shale
member.summary: A fine-grained sedimentary rock formed by the compaction of clay, silt or mud.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Silt
member.summary: Unconsolidated sedimentary material with grain sizes between 1/16mm and 1/256mm.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Siltstone
member.summary: Consolidated silt.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Slate
member.summary: A compact fine-grained metamorphic rock displaying slaty cleavage along which the rock may be cut into sheets.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Syenite
member.summary: Plutonic igneous rock composed essentially of alkali feldspar, with lesser sodic plagioclase, biotite and hornblende, and minor quartz.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.TilliteDiamictite
member.summary: Consolidated unsorted glacial deposits with particles ranging from boulder to mud in grain size and of highly variable composition.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Trachyte
member.summary: A group of fine-grained often porphyritic volcanic rocks containing alkali feldspar and minor mafic minerals.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Tuff
member.summary: An indurated pyroclastic deposit, predominantly consisting of fine-grained volcanic rocks: sedimentary particles may be present. Tuff may be deposited sub-aerially or sub-aqueously, and may be well sorted or heterogeneous.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Ultrabasic
member.summary: A class of igneous rocks composed mostly of mafic minerals such as pyroxenes along with calcic feldspar, with no free silica and a total silica content less than about 45%.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Undifferentiated
member.summary: The lithology is not differentiated. This is typically used to fill out a lithology description to 100 percent.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.LithologyType.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.summary: Protected constructor, should always pass in "name"

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Retrieves the complete list of NameTagTechnologys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.NameTagTechnology.Tagged
member.summary: Independent identification components attached or embedded to a larger component for purposes of identification of the larger component. Tags typically use electronic, radio or sound based technologies and that require a special non-optical device to read them. Radio Frequency Identification (RFID tags) are of this type, as are some magnetic and sound based identification technologies.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.NameTagTechnology.Labeled
member.summary: An optical label attached to a component. The label may be glued, riveted or attached by some other method and may contain a serial number, barcode or other optically recognized information. Note that a label may possibly have a combination of identifiers associated with it, such as a serial number, a barcode and an embedded RFID identifier. This would generate three nameTags for the one physical label, two of type 'label' for the barcode and serial number and one of type 'tagged' for the RFID identifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.NameTagTechnology.Intrinsic
member.summary: Identification technologies where the intrinsic properties of the component to be identified contain the identification information and no other unique code has been added. For example, some magnetic identification technologies use grooves machined into a component. Some components may also be identified, for example, by their individual sonic signature or optical profile.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.NameTagTechnology.Stamped
member.summary: An identification code physically stamped into the base material of the component to be identified. Note that if a serial number is stamped into a label attached to a component, 'labeled' should be used and not 'stamped'. Stamped identifiers can wear off but can not fall off.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.NameTagTechnology.Painted
member.summary: Painted or stenciled on the material.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.NameTagTechnology.Temporary
member.summary: Temporary identification codes marked with grease pencil, chalk, or such.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.NameTagTechnology.Unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo
member.summary: A schema to capture a set of data that is relevant for many exchange documents. It includes information about the file that was created, and high-level information about the data that is being exchanged within the file.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentName
member.summary: An identifier for the document. This is intended to be unique within the context of the NamingSystem.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentAlias
member.summary: Zero or more alternate names for the document. These names do not need to be unique within the naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentDate
member.summary: The date of the creation of the document. This is not the same as the date that the file was created. For this date, the document is considered to be the set of information associated with this document information. For example, the document may be a seismic binset. This represents the date that the binset was created. The FileCreation information would capture the date that the XML file was created to send or exchange the binset.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.DocumentClass
member.summary: A document class. Examples of classes would be a metadata classification or a set of keywords.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.FileCreationInformation
member.summary: The information about the creation of the exchange file. This is not about the creation of the data within the file, but the creation of the file itself.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.SecurityInformation
member.summary: Information about the security to be applied to this file. More than one classification can be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Disclaimer
member.summary: A free-form string that allows a disclaimer to accompany the information.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.AuditTrail
member.summary: A collection of events that can document the history of the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Owner
member.summary: The owner of the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.DocumentInfo.Comment
member.summary: An optional comment about the document.

member.summary: The type of lithology declaration. An interpreted type will specify one lithology for the whole interval (i.e., the percentage is 100%). A cuttings or core type may specify one or more lithologies for the interval based on a visual inspection of the cuttings or core and a relative percentage will be assigned to each lithology.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Lithology.Qualifier
member.summary: A single qualifier. In mudlogging terms, a qualifier is a graphical symbol in the Interpreted Lithology column of the Formation Evaluation Log (aka "the mudlog"). In addition to the major lithologies (e.g., sand, shale, etc) existing in the sample, other minerals (present as accessories or inclusions e.g. chert, pyrite, glauconite) and fossils (forams, oyster shells, bryozoans, etc) may exist and their abundance is generally categorized using ranges such as Trace (less than 10%), Common (10-25%) and Abundant (greater than 25%). These additional minerals and fossils can be of disproportionately great diagnostic and descriptive value. For example, qualifiers can be used to indicate facies changes, marker beds or something that impacted drilling conditions. These qualifiers (representing accessories, inclusions and/or fossils) are used to rapidly and graphically indicate to the recipient of the mudlog that a significant lithological event was encountered while drilling the well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Qualifier
member.summary: WITSML - lithology qualifier Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Qualifier.Type
member.summary: The type of qualifier.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Qualifier.MDTop
member.summary: The measured depth at the top of the interval represented by the qualifier. This must be within the range of the parent geologic interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Qualifier.MDBottom
member.summary: The measured depth at the bottom of the interval represented by the qualifier. A point can be indicated by specifying bottom=top. This must be within the range of the parent geologic interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Qualifier.Abundance
member.summary: The relative abundance of the qualifier. This is usually estimated based on a "visual area" basis by inspecting the cuttings spread out on the shaker table. This either represents a point value or the upperbound of a range (e.g., 0% to 10%).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Qualifier.AbundanceCode
member.summary: A code associated with the relative abundance of the qualifier. For example, "trace", "common" or "abundant". This is generally a proprietary code. The interoperable semantics are provided by the above abundance value. The presumption is that the value range associated with a code is mapped to a single value. On the other end of an exchange, the single value is mapped to the range associated with the local codes on that end.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Qualifier.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the qualifier.
