member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystemList
member.summary: This class represents the obj_dtsInstalledSystems xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystemList.DocumentInfo
member.summary: Information about the XML message instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystemList.DtsInstalledSystem
member.summary: Main wrapper for all the distributed temperature survey information about the installed system. Note that this can serve as a standalone object for messages that are not part of the WITSML server architecture.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystemList.Version
member.summary: Data object schema version. The fourth level must match the version of the schema constraints (enumerations and XML loader files) that are assumed by the document instance.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem
member.summary: The optical fiber is installed in a wellbore and attached to an instrument box. Calibrations are performed. In general, this should be a subelement of a DTS object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.NameWell
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.NameWellbore
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore that contains the installed system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the dts.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.IsPlanned
member.summary: Is this a planned installation in a well, or has the installation already occurred. Note that the default value is 'false', which states that this is an actual installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberInformation
member.summary: Information about the fiber used, and its installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.InstrumentBoxInformation
member.summary: Information about the instrument box used, and its installation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration of the fiber installation. Example values would be linear, linear with gauge, J, U.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberEndPoint
member.summary: A fiber installed with a "U" configuration will have two ends available for hookup to an instrument box. In order to record which end is cabled to the instrument box on a particular measurement run, it is necessary to identify the two ends. This complex type allows a name and description for each end, so that it may be identified in a later use. This may also be useful when multiple fibers in multiple wellbores converge at the same wellhead.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.FiberLength
member.summary: The length of the fiber installed in the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.WellboreFiberSchematic
member.summary: A table of values along the length along the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.OperatingticalBudget
member.summary: Total light budget available for the installation. This is generally measured in decibels, and indicates the total power loss for two-way travel of the light in the installed fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.PumpActivity
member.summary: The activity of pumping the fiber downhole

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.OtdrInstallationTest
member.summary: This captures the data from the pre-installation and post-installation OTDR tests run on the fiber. A standard quality control program would include these two, but the schema allows for more than two if additional runs associated with the installation of the fiber are performed. OTDR runs associated with a measurement are given as a child of the measurementInformation element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.InstallationCAlibration
member.summary: Any calibration other than the ones explicitly given may be recorded here. This is a general calibration type, which is populated with name/value pairs.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.BasedOnInstalledFiber
member.summary: If an instrument box is changed, for example, but the fiber remains the same, this instance of installed fiber is given to record that change. This element refers to a previous installed fiber, on which this one is based. For example, the wellboreFiberSchematic is unchanged, and may be obtained from the previous instance of installed fiber that is referenced here.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsInstalledSystem.UidWellbore
member.summary: Unique identifier for the wellbore. This uniquely represents the wellbore referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberInformation
member.summary: The optical fiber used for distributed temperature surveys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberInformation.InstallationDate
member.summary: The date the fiber is installed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberInformation.InstallationCompany
member.summary: The company that installed the fiber in the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberInformation.DeInstallationDate
member.summary: The date the fiber was de-installed from the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberInformation.CapillaryTubeDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the capillary tube into which one or more fibers will be installed. If the installation has fibers that go to different wellbores, only those fibers installed in the parent wellbore should be included in this instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberInformation.Fiber
member.summary: The properties of the fiber or fibers installed in the wellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber
member.summary: The optical fiber used for distributed temperature surveys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.Name
member.summary: A human understandable name for the fiber. This is used for identification of the instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.Mode
member.summary: The mode of fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.Type
member.summary: Zero or more instances that allow other classifications to be assigned to the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.Coating
member.summary: The type of coating on the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.Jacket
member.summary: The type of jacket covering the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.CoreDiameter
member.summary: The inner diameter of the core, generally measured in microns (um).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.CladdedDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the core plus the cladding, generally measured in microns (um).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.OutsideDiameter
member.summary: The diameter of the cable and all its sheathing, generally measured in microns (um). This is intended to be the diameter of the cable on the spool.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.RefractiveIndex
member.summary: The refractive index of the fiber. Also included is the frequency in Hz for which this refractive index is valid. There may be multiple instances of this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.OneWayLoss
member.summary: The power loss (usually in decibels) per unit of length of the fiber. Also included is the frequency for which this loss is measured. There ay be multiple instances of this element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: Additional parameters to define the fiber as a material. These should not be parameters to define the installation of the fiber in a well, or other system. This element should be used only if an appropriate parameter is not available as an element, or in the calibration operation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.SpoolNumberTag
member.summary: The spool number located on the particular spool. The spool number may contain alphanumeric characters.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.SpoolLength
member.summary: The length of the fiber on the spool when purchased.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.SupplyDate
member.summary: A fiber may go through several manufacturers for its various parts. The supplier is the final company in the chain that supplies the fiber to the end user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.Supplier
member.summary: A fiber may go through several manufacturers for its various parts. The supplier is the final company in the chain that supplies the fiber to the end user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.SupplierModelNumber
member.summary: The model number (alphanumeric) that is used by the supplier to reference the type of fiber that is supplied to the user.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.FactoryCAlibration
member.summary: Information about calibrations and quality checks that were performed on the cable at the factory. This is not to include calibrations that are run at installation time and at measurement time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Fiber.InstallationHistory
member.summary: A reference to a dtsInstalledSytem object that previously used the fiber.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.TypeOptionalClassString
member.summary: This class represents the typeOptionalClassString xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.TypeOptionalClassString.ClassType
member.summary: This identifies the classification system to which the class belongs.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefractiveIndex
member.summary: The refractive index of a material depends on the frequency or wavelength of the light. Hence it is necessary to include both the value (a unitless number) and the frequency or wavelength. The frequency will be a quantity type with a frequency unit, such as Hz, kHz, or MHz. The wavelength will be a quantity type with a length unit, such as m, cm, um, in, or ft.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefractiveIndex.Value
member.summary: The value of the refractive index.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefractiveIndex.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency (and uom) for which the refractive index is measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefractiveIndex.Wavelength
member.summary: The wavelength (and uom) for which the refractive index is measured. The reported wavelength should be the wavelength of the light in a vacuum.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.OneWayLoss
member.summary: The The power loss for one way travel of a beam of light, usually measured in decibels per unit length. It is necessary to include both the value (and its unit) and the wavelength. The wavelength varies with the refractive index, while the frequency remains constant. The wavelength given to specify this type is the wavelength in a vacuum (refractive index = 1).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.OneWayLoss.Value
member.summary: The value of the one way loss per unit of length. The usual uom is decibels per kilometre (dB/km), although this might vary depending on the calibration method used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.OneWayLoss.Frequency
member.summary: The frequency (and uom) for which the one-way loss is measured.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.OneWayLoss.Wavelength
member.summary: The wavelength (and uom) for which the one-way loss is measured. The reported wavelength should be the wavelength of the light in a vacuum.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.IndexedObject
member.summary: This class represents the indexedObject xsd type.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Calibration
member.summary: Calibration parameters vary from vendor to vendor, depending on the calibration method being used. This is a general type that allows a calibration date, business associate, and many name/value pairs.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Calibration.DateTimeCAlibration
member.summary: The date of the calibration

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Calibration.CalibratedBy
member.summary: The business associate that performed the calibration.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Calibration.CAlibrationProtocol
member.summary: This may be a standard protocol, or a software application.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Calibration.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: Attribute name is the name of the parameter. Optional attribute uom is the unit of measure of the parameter. The value of the element is the value of the parameter. Note that a string value may appear as a parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Calibration.Remarks
member.summary: Any remarks that may be useful, regarding the calibration information.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.CalibrationParameter
member.summary: Parameters are given by name/ value pairs, with optional uom. The parameter name and uom are attributes, and the value is the value of the element.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.CalibrationParameter.Uom
member.summary: The unit of measure of the parameter value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.CalibrationParameter.Name
member.summary: The name of the parameter.

member.summary: The instrument box used for distributed temperature surveys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BoxInformation.InstallationCompany

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BoxInformation.DeInstallationDate
member.summary: The date the instrument box was de-installed from the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BoxInformation.InstrumentBox
member.summary: The properties of the instrument box.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox
member.summary: The instrument box used for distributed temperature surveys

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.Name
member.summary: A name for the instrument box. This can be used to access the instrument box.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.Manufacturer
member.summary: The ultimate manufacturer of the instrument box.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.ManufacturingDate
member.summary: The date the manufacturing of the instrument box was completed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.Type
member.summary: The type of instrument box used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.NameTag
member.summary: An identification tag for the instrument box. A serial number is a type of identification tag however some tags contain many pieces of information. This structure just identifies the tag and does not describe the contents.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.SoftwareVersion
member.summary: The version of the software installed in the instrument box.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.FactoryCAlibration
member.summary: Information about the calibration of the instrument box that was performed. This includes factory calibrations before shipping, and bench calibrations. This does not include calibrations made in preparation for taking measurements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.InternalOvenLocationNear
member.summary: Near distance of the oven from the beginning of the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.InternalOvenLocationFar
member.summary: Far distance of the oven from the beginning of the fiber.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.OvenSetPoint
member.summary: The temperature of the oven.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.TestCAble
member.summary: The cable used to test the instrument box.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.Offset
member.summary: The offset setting applied to the instrument box based on the factory or bench calibration.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.DifferentialLossSetting
member.summary: The power loss over the length of the cable.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBox.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: Additional parameters to define the instrument box as a piece of equipment. These should not be parameters to define the installation or use of the box in the wellbore, or other system. This element should be used only if an appropriate parameter is not available as an element, or in the calibration operation.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag
member.summary: WITSML - Equipment NameTag Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Name
member.summary: The physical identification string of the equipment tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.NumberingScheme
member.summary: The format or encoding specification of the equipment tag. The tag may contain may different pieces of information and knowledge of that information is inherent in the specification. The "identification string" is a mandatory part of the information in a tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Technology
member.summary: Identifies the general type of identifier on an item. If multiple identifiers exist on an item, a separate description set for each identifier should be created. For example, a joint of casing may have a barcode label on it along with a painted-on code and an RFID tag attached or embedded into the coupling. The barcode label may in turn be an RFID equipped label. This particular scenario would require populating five nameTags to fully describe and decode all the possible identifiers as follows: 'tagged' - RFID tag embedded in the coupling, 'label' - Serial number printed on the label, 'tagged' - RFID tag embedded into the label, 'label' - Barcode printed on the label, 'painted'- Mill number painted on the pipe body.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Location
member.summary: An indicator of where the tag is attached to the item. This is used to assist the user in finding where an identifier is located on an item. This optional field also helps to differentiate where an identifier is located when multiple identifiers exist on an item. Most downhole components have a box (female thread) and pin (male thread) end as well as a pipe body in between the ends. Where multiple identifiers are used on an item, it is convenient to have a reference as to which end, or somewhere in the middle, an identifier may be closer to. Some items may have an identifier on a non-standard location, such as on the arm of a hole opener. 'other', by exclusion, tells a user to look elsewhere than on the body or near the ends of an item. Most non-downhole tools will use either 'body', 'other' or not specified as the location tends to lose value with smaller or non threaded items.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.InstallationDate
member.summary: When the tag was installed in or on the item.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.InstallationCompany
member.summary: The name of the company that installed the tag.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.MountingCode
member.summary: Reference to a manufacturers or installers installation description, code, or method.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.NameTag.Comment
member.summary: A comment or remark about the tag.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBoxCalibration
member.summary: Calibration parameters vary from vendor to vendor, depending on the calibration method being used. This is an extension of the general cs_calibration, and allows for specific parameters associated with an instrument box. The two additional parameters are the offset temperature calibration, and the slope calibration. These allow for a linear shift in temperature vs measurements. Additional offset and slope calibrations may be performed at measurement time.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBoxCalibration.DateTimeCAlibration
member.summary: The date of the calibration

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBoxCalibration.CalibratedBy
member.summary: The business associate that performed the calibration.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBoxCalibration.CAlibrationProtocol
member.summary: This may be a standard protocol, or a software application.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBoxCalibration.PluggedAndAbandonedrameter
member.summary: Attribute name is the name of the parameter. Optional attribute uom is the unit of measure of the parameter. The value of the element is the value of the parameter. Note that a string value may appear as a parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBoxCalibration.Remarks
member.summary: Any remarks that may be useful, regarding the calibration information.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBoxCalibration.OffsetTemperatureCAlibration
member.summary: The temperature offset correction that is applied to the dts instrument box.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.InstrumentBoxCalibration.SlopeCAlibration
member.summary: The temperature slope correction that is applied to the dts instrument box.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberEndPoint
member.summary: A fiber installed in a "U" configuration has two end points that a cable may hook to. When making a measurement, it is useful to be able to say which end was hooked to the input from the instrument box. In order to do this, the fiber ends must be identified. The identifier is a name, along with a description to further aid the interpreter in determining which end was used as the input

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberEndPoint.Name
member.summary: A name, unique within the context of the well, for an instrument box cable to hook to.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.FiberEndPoint.Description
member.summary: Any description of the node that may be useful in identifying the hookup.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SingleInstalledPoint
member.summary: A set of points recorded during the installation process. The information can include the length along the fiber, the measured depth, and a type of point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SingleInstalledPoint.MD
member.summary: The measured depth of the installed point of the fiber. This is optional, because the sender may want to record points that are outside the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SingleInstalledPoint.LengthAlongFiber
member.summary: The length along the fiber, from the zero point, for this particular point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SingleInstalledPoint.Type
member.summary: The type of point that is being recorded.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.PumpActivity
member.summary: The activity of pumping the fiber downhole.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.PumpActivity.Name
member.summary: A name which can be used to reference the pumping activity. In general, a pumping activity does not have a natural name, so that this element will not be often used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.PumpActivity.InstalledFiber
member.summary: The name of the InstalledFiberInstance that this activity relates to.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.PumpActivity.PumpingDate
member.summary: The date, or dateTime of the pumping activity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.PumpActivity.EngineerName
member.summary: The person in charge of the pumping activity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.PumpActivity.ServiceCompany
member.summary: The company that performed the pumping activity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.PumpActivity.PumpFluidType

member.summary: True or False. Was a drift run performed? This element should be used to indicate if a drift run was performed or not, where the instance of the drift run (OTDR) is not available. If the OTDR is available, use the OTDRPerformed element to specify the OTDR instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.PumpActivity.OTDRPerformed
member.summary: A reference to the OTDR that was run. If an OTDR was run, but there is not instance of the OTDR to reference, choose the wasDriftRunPerformed element, and set it to True.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Otdr
member.summary: This records the result arrays, along with context information, from an Optical Time Domain Reflectometry (OTDR) run. The arrays will define the relative scattered power from the Rayleigh scattering vs distance along the fiber. The actual data values are recorded in a wellLog object, which is referenced in a subelement.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Otdr.ReasonForRun
member.summary: The reason the OTDR test was run. The three main reasons are 'pre-installation', which is before the installation of the fiber; 'post-installation', which is used to validate a successful fiber installation; and 'DTS run', which is a quality check of the fiber prior to a DTS run. A fourth permitted value is 'other'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Otdr.DateTimeRun
member.summary: The dateTime of the run.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Otdr.DataInWellLog
member.summary: A reference to the well log used to record the table of data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Otdr.FiberEndConncected
member.summary: A pointer to the fiber connection node. If more than one node is available for a well/wellbore, this element is used to specify which node is connected to the instrument box. This name should correspond to the fiberEndPoint/name that is recorded in the installed system object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Otdr.Comment
member.summary: A general comment about the OTDR run.

member.summary: Human recognizable context for the dts.

member.summary: The length of time that the instrument box was operating while collecting DTS data.

member.summary: A reference to the fiber used to record the table of data. This is necessary only in the cases in which a dtsInstalledSystem has a multi-fiber installation. If there is only a single installed fiber, this element is unnecessary.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsMeasurement.FiberEndConnected
member.summary: A pointer to the fiber connection node. If more than one node is available for a well/wellbore, this element is used to specify which node is connected to the instrument box. This name should correspond to the fiberEndPoint/name that is recorded in the installed system object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.DtsMeasurement.FiberDefinedPoint
member.summary: A known point of the fiber. This point should correspond to one that is given in the wellboreFiberSchematic, so that the relationship between the length of fiber values in the wellboreFiberSchematic can be related to the values in the measurement table.

member.summary: Human recognizable context for the log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.ObjectGrowing
member.summary: Whether or not the log is growing. True ("true" or "1") indicates the that the log is still growing in size (that is, logData values are still being added). For example, it may be connected to a realtime stream. False ("false" or "0") indicates that the log is closed (that is, no further logData values will be added). Not given indicates that the status of the log is not known. This value is only relevant within the context of a server.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.DataRowCount
member.summary: The number of data rows in the persistent log. If a value is specified for this element in a query then the server will limit the number of data rows in the result but the return value will still be the number of data rows in the persistent log.

member.summary: Name of contractor who provided the service.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.RunNumber
member.summary: Log run number. This should normally be a number; however some legacy systems encode other information in this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.BhaRunNumber
member.summary: The bottom hole assembly run number associated with this log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.PluggedAndAbandonedss
member.summary: Identifies the pass within the run.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.CreationDate
member.summary: Date and time that the log was created.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.Description
member.summary: Description of item and details.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.IndexType
member.summary: Primary index type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.StartIndex
member.summary: When the log header defines the direction as "Increasing", the startIndex is the starting (minimum) index value at which the first valid data point is located. When the log header defines the direction as "Decreasing", the startIndex is the starting (maximum) index value at which the first valid data point is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.EndIndex
member.summary: When the log header defines the direction as "Increasing", the endIndex is the ending (maximum) index value at which the last valid data point is located. When the log header defines the direction as Decreasing, the endIndex is the ending (minimum) index value at which the last valid data point is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.StepIncrement
member.summary: The sampling increment. Set to zero for unequal sampling. This would only apply if the curve was sorted on its own values. For curves that are originally sampled at a constant increment, this value should be retained because the calculated values may have cumulative errors.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.StartDateTimeIndex
member.summary: When the log header defines the direction as "Increasing", the startIndex is the starting (minimum) index value at which the first valid data point is located. When the log header defines the direction as "Decreasing", the startIndex is the starting (maximum) index value at which the first valid data point is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.EndDateTimeIndex
member.summary: When the log header defines the direction as "Increasing", the endIndex is the ending (maximum) index value at which the last valid data point is located. When the log header defines the direction as Decreasing, the endIndex is the ending (minimum) index value at which the last valid data point is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.Direction
member.summary: The sort order of the data row index values in the XML instance. For an "Increasing" direction the index value of consecutive data nodes are ascending. For a "Decreasing" direction the index value of consecutive data nodes are descending. The default direction is "Increasing". The direction of a log cannot be changed once it has been created. That is, this value cannot be updated in a server.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.IndexCurve
member.summary: The mnemonic of the index curve plus the column index. A column index of zero indicates an implied trace whose values start at startIndex and increment by stepIncrement for each row.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.NullValue
member.summary: An empty string is the default representation of a null value for a curve (i.e. when the null value representation is not explicitly defined). If a null value representation is defined for a log, this becomes the default for all curves in that log (but can be overridden at the curve level). An empty string is always a valid null value representation in the comma delimited list. An empty string is not a valid null value representation within a space delimited array. Specifying a null value also makes it easier to transform data back to a legacy format without having to scan the data to insure that the null pattern does not exist in the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Log.LogPluggedAndAbandonedram
member.summary: Log parameters.

member.summary: Container element for the log curve information.

member.summary: Container for one or more "rows" of log data.

member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.summary: WITSML Log - Curve Information

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.Minemonic
member.summary: The curve name. This must be unique for all curves in a log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.ClassWitsml
member.summary: The curve classification obtained from a lookup in the vendors mnemonic catalog.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.Unit
member.summary: Unit of measurement of the data values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.MinemAlias
member.summary: Name alias for this trace.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.NullValue
member.summary: An empty string is the default representation of a null value for a curve (i.e. when the null value representation is not explicitly defined). If a null value is defined in the logCurveInfo, it overrides any null value specified at the logHeader level. An empty string is always a valid null value representation in the comma delimited list. An empty string is not a valid null value representation within a space delimited array. Specifying a null value also makes it easier to transform data back to a legacy format without having to scan the data to insure that the null pattern does not exist in the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.AlternateIndex
member.summary: True (true or 1) if this curve is a candidate to be a primary index. False (false or 0) or not given, indicates otherwise. An index curve should monotonically change when sorted on its own values (i.e., no duplicates).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.WellDatum
member.summary: A pointer to the wellDatum that represents the values of this trace. This is only relevant for measured depths, vertical depths or elevations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.MinIndex
member.summary: The minimum index value at which the first valid data point is located. This value will be properly set by the server to reflect data in the returned document.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.MaxIndex
member.summary: The maximum index value at which the last valid data point is located. This value will be properly set by the server to reflect data in the returned document.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.MinDateTimeIndex
member.summary: The minimum index value at which the first valid data point is located. This value will be properly set by the server to reflect data in the returned document.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.MaxDateTimeIndex
member.summary: The maximum index value at which the last valid data point is located. This value will be properly set by the server to reflect data in the returned document.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.ColumnIndex
member.summary: A 1-based index of data in the LOGDATA.DATA section. A value of zero indicates an implied curve with no values in the data record.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.CurveDescription
member.summary: Description of the curve.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.SensorOffset
member.summary: Offset of sensor from drill bit. This element is only informative. The measured depth values are at the actual depth (not bit depth from which you must subtract the offset).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.DataSource
member.summary: Data source, could be tool name/id.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.DensData
member.summary: Data density of sample in samples per length unit.

member.summary: State of trace data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.TraceOrigin
member.summary: Origin of trace data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.TypeLogData
member.summary: Log data type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LogCurveInfo.AxisDefinition
member.summary: Indicates that the curve is an array curve (i.e., multi-valued samples), and provides meta data by which an axis of the array can be understood.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.AxisDefinition
member.summary: Metadata by which the array structure of a compound value is defined. This defines one axis of an array.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.AxisDefinition.Order
member.summary: The order of this axis. The order should begin with one and increment by one for each additional axis. The order indicates how fast the index of the axis varies in the serialized list of values. The index of an axis with an order of one varies the slowest. The index of an axis with an order of two varies the next slowest. And so on. This is the same ordering that is used in the C programming language. For example, the following array: [ x axis ] | z11 z12 z13 y axis: z21 z22 z23 | z31 z32 z33 | z41 z42 z43 may be encoded as follows: axisDefinition[order=1].name='x' axisDefinition[order=1].count='3' axisDefinition[order=2].name='y' axisDefinition[order=2].count='4' { z11 z21 z31 z41 z12 z22 z32 z42 z13 z23 z33 z43 } or alternatively: axisDefinition[order=1].name='y' axisDefinition[order=1].count='4' axisDefinition[order=2].name='x' axisDefinition[order=2].count='3' { z11 z12 z13 z21 z22 z23 z31 z32 z33 z41 z42 z43 }

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.AxisDefinition.Count
member.summary: The count of elements along this axis of the array.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.AxisDefinition.Name
member.summary: The name of the array axis.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.AxisDefinition.PropertyType
member.summary: The property type by which the array axis is classified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.AxisDefinition.Uom
member.summary: A string representing the units of measure of the axis values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.AxisDefinition.DoubleValues
member.summary: The serialziation of the axis positions of an array as a whitespace-delimited list values of type xsd:double. If the length of this list is less than 'count' then the difference in the last two values represents the increment to be used to fill out the list. For example, the list '2 4' with count=4 represents the list '2 4 6 8'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.AxisDefinition.StringValues
member.summary: The serialziation of the axis positions of an array as a whitespace-delimited list values of type xsd:String. Note: the serialization of string elements with embedded whitespace cannot be properly decoded.

member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore that contains the mud log.

member.summary: Human recognizable context for the mud log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.MudLog.ObjectGrowing
member.summary: Whether or not the mudLog is growing. True ("true" or "1") indicates the that the mudLog is still growing in size (that is, geologyInterval or parameter values are still being added). For example, it may be connected to a realtime stream. False ("false" or "0") indicates that the mudLog is closed (that is, no further geologyInterval or parameter values will be added). Not given indicates that the status of the mudLog is not known. This value is only relevant within the context of a server.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.MudLog.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time the information is related to.

member.summary: Concatenated names of mud loggers constructing the log.

member.summary: The minimum mdTop value in all geologyIntervals for this mud log message. This will be populated by the server to match the values that were returned as a result of a query. Used in a query template for specifying the begining range of logs to be retrieved.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.MudLog.EndMD
member.summary: The maximum mdBottom value in all geologyIntervals for this mud log message. This will be populated by the server to match the values that were returned as a result of a query. Used in a query template for specifying the ending range of logs to be retrieved.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter
member.summary: WITSML - Mud Log Parameter Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.Type
member.summary: The type of the mud log parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.DateTimee
member.summary: The data and time related to the parameter. At least one of dTime or mdTop must be given. The time refers to the top of the interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.MDTop
member.summary: The measured depth at a point or at the top of an interval. If it represents the top of an interval then bottom measured depth must also be given. At least one of dTime or mdTop must be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.MDBottom
member.summary: The bottom of an interval along the borehole. The bottom of the interval cannot be given unless the top is also given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.Concentration
member.summary: A concentration value that represents the parameter. If you set this property, you must also set TypeConc.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.EquivalentMudWeight
member.summary: A equivalent mud weight value that represents the parameter. This commonly used for pressure gradient parameters and pressure parameters.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.PressureGradient
member.summary: A pressure gradient value that represents the parameter. This is sometimes specified instead of an equivalent mud weight.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.Force
member.summary: A force value (e.g., hookload) that represents the parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.MudLogParameter.Text
member.summary: A textual parameter value. This value is typically annotation on the log. All spaces, tabs, line feeds and carriage returns are retained in the string. Characters representing line breaks should be replaced by a line feed or carriage return.

member.summary: Grid Correction (Meridian convergence). The angle between True North and Grid North. Grid Correction is positive when True North is west of Grid North. The correction is added to the raw observation, thus yielding a reduced or corrected observation that can go into the subsequent calculations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location
member.summary: WITSML Location Component Schema This is a location that is expressed in terms of 2D coordinates. In order that the location be understood, the coordinate reference system (CRS) must be known.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.WellCRS
member.summary: A pointer to the wellCRS that defines the CRS for the coordinates. While optional, it is strongly recommended that this be specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude with north being positive. If you set this property, you must also set Longitude.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude with east being positive. If you set this property, you must also set Latitude.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.Easting
member.summary: The projected coordinate with east being positive. This is the most common type of projected coordinates. UTM coordinates are expressed in Easting and Northing. If you set this property, you must also set Northing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.Northing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with north being positive. This is the most common type of projected coordinates. UTM coordinates are expressed in Easting and Northing. If you set this property, you must also set Easting.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.Westing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with west being positive. The positive directions are reversed from the usual Easting and Northing values. These values are generally located in the southern hemisphere, most notably in South Africa and Australia. If you set this property, you must also set Southing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.Southing
member.summary: The projected coordinate with south being positive. The positive directions are reversed from the usual Easting and Northing values. These values are generally located in the southern hemisphere, most notably in South Africa and Australia. If you set this property, you must also set Westing.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.ProjectedX
member.summary: The projected X coordinate with the positive direction unknown. ProjectedX and ProjectedY are used when it is not known what the meaning of the coordinates is. If the meaning is known, the Easting/Northing or Westing/Southing should be used. Use of this pair implies a lack of knowledge on the part of the sender. If you set this property, you must also set ProjectedY.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.ProjectedY
member.summary: The projected Y coordinate with the positive direction unknown. ProjectedX and ProjectedY are used when it is not known what the meaning of the coordinates is. If the meaning is known, the Easting/Northing or Westing/Southing should be used. Use of this pair implies a lack of knowledge on the part of the sender. If you set this property, you must also set ProjectedX.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.LocalX
member.summary: The local (engineering) X coordinate. The CRS will define the orientation of the axis. If you set this property, you must also set LocalY.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.LocalY
member.summary: The local (engineering) Y coordinate. The CRS will define the orientation of the axis. If you set this property, you must also set LocalX.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.Original
member.summary: Flag indicating (if "true" or "1") that this pair of values was the original data given for the location. If the pair of values was calculated from an original pair of values, this flag should be "false" (or "0"), or not present.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Location.Description
member.summary: A Comment, generally given to help the reader interpret the coordinates if the CRS and the chosen pair do not make them clear.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellboreTrajectoryStation
member.summary: This class represents the cs_refWellboreTrajectoryStation xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellboreTrajectoryStation.StationReference
member.summary: A pointer to the trajectoryStation within the parent trajectory. This is a special case where we only use a uid for the pointer. The natural identity of a station is its physical characteristics (e.g., md).

member.summary: A pointer to the trajectory within the parent wellbore. This trajectory contains the trajectoryStation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellboreTrajectoryStation.WellborePluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the trajectory. This is not needed unless the trajectory is outside the context of a common parent wellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather
member.summary: WITSML - Operations Weather Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time the information is related to.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.Agency
member.summary: Name of company that supplied the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.BarometricPressure
member.summary: Atmospheric pressure.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.BeaufortScaleNumber
member.summary: The Beaufort wind scale is a system used to estimate and report wind speeds when no measuring apparatus is available. It was invented in the early 19th Century by Admiral Sir Francis Beaufort of the British Navy as a way to interpret winds from conditions.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.TempSurfaceMin
member.summary: Minimum temperature above ground. Temperature of the atmosphere.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.TempSurfaceMax
member.summary: Maximum temperature above ground.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.TempWindChill
member.summary: A measure of the combined chilling effect of wind and low temperature on living things, also named chill factor, e.g., according to US weather service table, an air temperature of 30 degF with a 10 mi/h corresponds to a windchill of 22 degF.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.Tempsea
member.summary: Sea temperature.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.Visibility
member.summary: Horizontal visibility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.AziWave
member.summary: The direction from which the waves are coming, measured from true north.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.HeightWave
member.summary: Average height of the waves.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.SignificantWave
member.summary: An average of the higher 1/3 of the wave heights passing during a sample period (typically 20 to 30 minutes).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.MaxWave
member.summary: The maximum wave height.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.PeriodWave
member.summary: The elapsed time between the passing of two wave tops.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.AziWind
member.summary: The direction from which the wind is blowing, measured from true north.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.VelWind
member.summary: Wind speed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.TypePrecip
member.summary: Type of precipitation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Weather.AmtPrecip
member.summary: Amount of precipitation.

member.summary: Current speed.

member.summary: Azimuth of current.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.RealtimeList
member.summary: This class represents the obj_realtimes xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.RealtimeList.DocumentInfo
member.summary: Information about the XML message instance.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.RealtimeList.Realtime
member.summary: A single realtime.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.RealtimeList.Version
member.summary: Data object schema version. The fourth level must match the version of the schema constraints (enumerations and XML loader files) that are assumed by the document instance.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime
member.summary: The non-contextual content of a WITSML Realtime object. Realtime data is not persistent data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.DateTime
member.summary: The time index for the realtime object if the interval type is time-based. It is the default time index for all data in the realtime object. Both dTim and md can be overridden at the channel level. This value should be given when "dTim" is given with any channel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.MD
member.summary: Along hole measured depth of measurement from the drill datum. It is the default depth index for all data in the realtime object. Both dTim and md can be overridden at the channel level. This value should be given when "md" is given with any channel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.Sequence
member.summary: The one-based sequence of realtime messages for one subscription. The first message for a subscription should have a sequence number of one and each subsequent message for that subscription should increment by one.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.ActivityCode
member.summary: A code used to define rig activity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.DetailActivity
member.summary: Custom string to further define an activity.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.DataGroup
member.summary: The group name of the channels in this realtime. For example, a publisher can publish data from the mudlogger, drilling and MWD systems at the same time. The drilling and mudlogger systems could have channels with the same mnemonic. The group name is used to distinguish between curves from these different source systems.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.RealtimeHeader
member.summary: The information which is constant for all realtimes. This will only be sent with the first realtime for a subscription, when a retransmit is requested or when the header is updated (e.g., when more channels are added).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.Channel
member.summary: The data associated with a (de-multiplexed) channel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.Record
member.summary: The multiplexed data associated with a channel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.UidWellbore
member.summary: Unique identifier for the wellbore. This uniquely represents the wellbore referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Realtime.IdSub
member.summary: Unique identifier for the Subscription. This matches the value of the idSub attribute that is returned in the Subscription Request. The value is only optional so that the a realtime can be retrieved using the Store interface (possibly after the subscription has retired). Otherwise, the value must be included when the realtime is returned as a result of a subscription.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader
member.summary: WITSML realtime header component object. The header is only transmitted with the first realtime, when the header changes or when a retransmit is requested.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.NameWell
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.NameWellbore
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore that contains the tubular.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.ServiceCompany
member.summary: Name of contractor who provided the service.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.RunNumber
member.summary: Log run number. This should normally be a number; however some legacy systems encode other information in this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.BhaRunNumber
member.summary: The bottom hole assembly run number associated with this log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.PluggedAndAbandonedss
member.summary: Identifies the pass within the run.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.CreationDate
member.summary: Date and time that the realtime was created.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.Description
member.summary: Comments about the realtime.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RealtimeHeader.GroupDefinition
member.summary: The definition of a group of channels.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GroupDefinition
member.summary: WITSML realtime group definition component object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GroupDefinition.Id
member.summary: The id of this group. The value should match a commonly agreed value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GroupDefinition.Multiplexed
member.summary: True (value of "1" or "true") indicates that this group will be represented by multiplexed data records. False (value of "0" or "false") indicates that this group will be represented by de-multiplexed data channels.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GroupDefinition.Interval
member.summary: The depth or time interval over which the group data are requested to be derived.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GroupDefinition.PersistedAsLog
member.summary: A pointer to the log (within the context of the current wellbore) that will be used to persist this data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GroupDefinition.PersistedAsWellLog
member.summary: A pointer to the wellLog (within the context of the current wellbore) that will be used to persist this data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GroupDefinition.Comment
member.summary: A comment or remark about this group.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GroupDefinition.ChannelDefinition
member.summary: The definition of a channel.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Interval
member.summary: WITSML - Realtime Channel Interval Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Interval.Type
member.summary: The type of interval.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Interval.Method
member.summary: The interval method. Not appropriate for a SpotSample.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Interval.DistanceInterval
member.summary: The distance interval associated with the method.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Interval.TimeInterval
member.summary: The time interval associated with the method.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition
member.summary: WITSML - Realtime Channel Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.Minemonic
member.summary: Used to differentiate between multiples of same sensor type. The mnemonic must be unique within the context of each group definition.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.DataType
member.summary: Specifies the data encoding of a "value". If this value is not supplied, the data type is assumed to be double.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.ClassWitsml
member.summary: Name of channel from realtime catalog. Although this is optional, it is strongly recommended that it be included. This defines the underlying meaning of the curve (e.g., a porosity). Mnemonic allows multiple channels of the same class to exist in one realtime.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.ColumnIndex
member.summary: A 1-based index of curve data in the data records. This can only be specified if multiplexed is true in the group definition.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.Unit
member.summary: The unit of measure for a quantity value. This can only be specified if multiplexed is true in the group definition. For demultiplexed values the unit is carried by each individual value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.Description
member.summary: A description of the channel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.MinemAlias
member.summary: Name alias for this trace.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.SensorOffset
member.summary: Offset of sensor from a downhole equipment vertical reference (the drill bit, for MWD logs; the tool zero reference for wireline logs). This element is only informative (log values are presented at actual depth, not requiring subtraction of an offset).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.DataSource
member.summary: Data source, could be tool name/id.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.Interval
member.summary: A container element that describes how data was gathered, computed, and sampled. This can only be specified if multiplexed is false in the group definition. That is, this can only be specified for a de-multiplexed representation.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ChannelDefinition.AxisDefinition
member.summary: Indicates that the channel is an array channel (i.e., multi-valued samples), and provides meta data by which an axis of the array can be understood.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel
member.summary: WITSML - Realtime Channel Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel.Id
member.summary: The id of the group that this channel represents.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel.Minemonic
member.summary: The mnemonic assigned to the channel. This must match a mnemonic of a channel definition in the header and represents the unique key of the channel. Multiple (de-multiplexed) channels with the same mnemonic cannot exist in the same realtime.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel.DateTime
member.summary: The time index for the realtime channel if the interval type is time-based.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel.MD
member.summary: Along hole measured depth of measurement from the drill datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel.Value
member.summary: Value of the channel. The encoding of the value is defined by "dataType" in the header. For array channels, this will be a space delimited list of values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel.DensData
member.summary: Data density of sample in samples per length unit

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel.QualData
member.summary: Data quality indicator.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Channel.Fet
member.summary: Formation exposure time.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.EncodedArrayString
member.summary: This class represents the encodedArrayString xsd type.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Record
member.summary: WITSML - Realtime Record Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Record.Id
member.summary: The id of the group that this record represents. The combination of id and seq should be unique within a subscription.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Record.Seq
member.summary: The one-based sequence of records for one group in this subscription. The first record for a group should have a sequence number of one and each subsequent record for that group should increment by one.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Record.DateTime
member.summary: The time index for the record if the interval type is time-based.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Record.MD
member.summary: Along hole measured depth of measurement from the drill datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Record.Value
member.summary: The data values for the record. A comma delimited list of data values with one value for each channel in the group (e.g., "xxx,yyy, zzz"). For array channels, the value of the array channel will be a space delimited list of values that are contained within the commas that delimit the value for that curve (e.g., "xxx,aa bb cc,zzz"). This essentially represents one row of a table where the channel mnemonics represent the column headings.

member.summary: Coiled tubing - Injector Stack Up. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SurfaceEquipment.HeightInjStk
member.summary: Coiled tubing -The length of tubing from the end of the coil reel to the rotary kelly bushing. Basically we define what is in the hole and on the reel. This measurement takes into account the 20 or so feet of tubing that is being straightened and shoved through the injector head.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SurfaceEquipment.UmbInside
member.summary: Coiled tubing - Umbilical inside, true/false check box so that you can account for the wireline inside the coiled tubing. With this pressure loss calculation, you can calculate for the strings used for logging, wire line coring, etc. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SurfaceEquipment.OuterDiameterUmbilical
member.summary: Coiled tubing - Outer diameter of the umbilical.

member.summary: Coiled tubing - Length of the umbilical.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SurfaceEquipment.InnerDiameterTopStk
member.summary: Top drive - Inner diameter of top stack.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SurfaceEquipment.HeightTopStk
member.summary: Top drive - The distance that the mud travels from the end of the standpipe hose to the drill pipe connection at the bottom of the top drive. We are measuring the distance that the mud will flow through the top drive.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.SurfaceEquipment.HeightFlange
member.summary: Height of flange. If you select Top Drive Stackup Height, Swivel and Kelly are disabled so that you can specify the top-drive rotary system.

member.summary: The non-contextual content of a WITSML Trajectory object.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.NameWell
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.NameWellbore
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore that contains the trajectory.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the trajectory.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.ObjectGrowing
member.summary: Whether or not the trajectory is growing. True ("true" or "1") indicates the that the trajectory is still growing in size (that is, trajectoryStation values are still being added). For example, it may be connected to a realtime stream. False ("false" or "0") indicates that the trajectory is closed (that is, no further trajectoryStation values will be added). Not given indicates that the status of the trajectory is not known. This value is only relevant within the context of a server.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.PluggedAndAbandonedrentTrajectory
member.summary: If a trajectory is tied into another trajectory, a pointer to the parent trajectory. The trajectory may be in another wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.DateTimeTrajStart
member.summary: Start date and time of trajectory station measurements. Note that this is NOT a server query parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.DateTimeTrajEnd
member.summary: End date and time of trajectory station measurements. Note that this is NOT a server query parameter.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.MDMin
member.summary: Minimum measured depth of trajectory. This is a query parameter. It's value will be populated by the server to reflect the values of md in the returned trajectoryStations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.MDMax
member.summary: Maximum measured depth of trajectory. This is a query parameter. It's value will be populated by the server to reflect the values of md in the returned trajectoryStations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.ServiceCompany
member.summary: Name of contractor who provided the service.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.MagDeclUsed
member.summary: Magnetic declination used to correct a magnetic survey. Starting value if stations have individual values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.GridCorUsed
member.summary: Grid correction used to correct a survey. Starting value if stations have individual values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.AziVertSect
member.summary: Azimuth used for vertical section plot/computations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.DispNSVertSectOrig
member.summary: Origin north-south used for vertical section plot/computations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.DispEWVertSectOrig
member.summary: Origin east-west used for vertical section plot/computations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.Definitive
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that this trajectory is definitive for this wellbore. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates otherwise. There can only be one trajectory per wellbore with definitive=true and it must define the geometry of the whole wellbore (surface to bottom). The definitive trajectory may represent a composite of information in many other trajectories. A query requesting a subset of the possible information can provide a simplistic view of the geometry of the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.Memory
member.summary: Is trajectory a result of a memory dump from a tool? Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" (or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Trajectory.FinalTraj

member.summary: License number of the well.

member.summary: State or province in which well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.County
member.summary: County in which the well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.Region
member.summary: Geo-political region.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.District

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.Block
member.summary: Block name in which well is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.TimeZone
member.summary: The time zone in which well is located. It is the deviation in hours and minutes from UTC. This should be the normal time zone at the well and not a seasonally adjusted value such as daylight savings time. While the time zone is optional in a date time value, it is strongly advised that the zone always be specified in each date time value. The time zone in a date time value may use seasonally adjusted values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.Operator
member.summary: Operator company name.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.OperatorDivision
member.summary: Division of operator company.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.PercentInterest
member.summary: Interest for Operator. Commonly in percent.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.NumAPI
member.summary: American Petroleum Institute well number.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.StatusWell
member.summary: POSC Well status.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.PurposeWell
member.summary: POSC well purpose.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.FluidWell
member.summary: POSC well fluid. The type of fluid being produced from or injected into a well facility.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.DirectionWell
member.summary: POSC well direction. The direction of flow of the fluids in a well facility (generally, injected or produced, or some combination).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.DateTimeSpud
member.summary: Date and time at which well was spudded.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.DateTimePluggedAndAbandoned
member.summary: Date and time at which well was plugged and abandoned.

member.summary: Elevation of wellhead relative to a wellDatum.
