member.summary: A datum to which elevations and depths are referenced.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.GroundElevation
member.summary: Elevation of ground level (land rigs).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.WaterDepth
member.summary: Depth of water (not land rigs).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.WellLocation
member.summary: the 2D coordinates of the well surface point in one coordinate reference system. This is where the well crosses ground level on land and crosses the platform offshore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.ReferencePoint
member.summary: Defines a reference point within the context of the well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.WellCRS
member.summary: A coordinate reference system that was used within the context of this well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Well.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum
member.summary: Defines the datums associated with elevation, vertical depth and measured depth coordinates within the context of a well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Name
member.summary: The human understandable contextual name of the reference datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Code
member.summary: The code value that represents the type of reference datum. This may represent a point on a device (e.g., kelly bushing) or it may represent a vertical reference datum (e.g., mean sea level).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DatumName
member.summary: The name of the vertical reference datum in a particular naming system. This should only be specified if the above 'code' represents some variation of sea level. An optional short name (code) can also be specified. Specifying a well known datum is highly desired if the above code is a variant of sea level because sea level varies over time and space. An example would be to specify a name of 'Caspian Sea' with a code of '5106' in the 'EPSG' naming system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Kind
member.summary: Since various activities may use different points as measurement datums, it is useful to characterize the point based on its usage. A well reference datum may have more than one such characterization. For example, it may be the datum used by the driller and logger for measuring their depths. Example usage values would be 'permanent','driller', 'logger' 'WRP' (well reference point) and 'SRP' (site reference point).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Wellbore
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the reference datum. This should be specified if a measured depth is given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Rig
member.summary: A pointer to the rig that contains the device used as a reference datum. The rig may be associated with a wellbore in another well (e.g., pattern drilling using a rig on a track).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Elevation
member.summary: The gravity based elevation coordinate of this reference datum as measured from another datum. Positive moving upward from the elevation datum. An elevation should be given unless this is a vertical reference datum (e.g., sea level).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.MeasuredDepth
member.summary: The measured depth coordinate of this reference datum as measured from another datum. The measured depth datum should either be the same as the elevation datum or it should be relatable to the elevation datum through other datums. Positive moving toward the bottomhole from the measured depth datum. This should be given when a local reference is "downhole", such as a kickoff point or ocean bottom template, and the borehole may not be vertical. If a Depth is given then an Elevation should also be given.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.Comment
member.summary: A contextual description of the well reference datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultMeasuredDepth
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for measured depth coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Measured depth coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to this default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default measured depth datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultVerticalDepth
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for vertical depth coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Vertical depth coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to the default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default vertical depth datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellDatum.DefaultElevation
member.summary: True indicates that this is the default reference datum for elevation coordinates. False or not given indicates that this is not the default reference datum. Elevation coordinates that do not specify a datum reference should be assumed to be measured relative to the default reference datum. Only one reference datum may be designated as the default elevation datum for each well. Values are "true" (or "1") and "false" ( or "0").

member.summary: A unique (short) code associated with the name.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore
member.summary: Data that represents a foreign key to a wellbore. The wellbore may be defined within the context of another well.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore.WellboreReference
member.summary: A pointer the wellbore with which there is a relationship.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellbore.WellPluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the well that contains the wellboreReference. This is not needed unless the referenced wellbore is outside the context of a common parent well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig
member.summary: A reference to a rig within a wellbore. The wellbore may be defined within the context of another well. This value represents a foreign key from one node to another.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.RigReference
member.summary: A pointer to the rig with which there is a relationship.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.WellborePluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the wellbore that contains the rigReference. This is not needed unless the referenced rig is outside the context of a common parent wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.RefWellWellboreRig.WellPluggedAndAbandonedrent
member.summary: A pointer to the well that contains the wellboreParent. This is not needed unless the referenced wellbore is outside the context of a common parent well.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint
member.summary: WITSML - Reference Point Component Schema.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Type
member.summary: The kind of point. For example, 'well reference point', 'platform reference point', 'sea surface', 'sea bottom'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Elevation
member.summary: The gravity based elevation coordinate of this point as measured from a datum. Positive moving upward from the elevation datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.MeasuredDepth
member.summary: The measured depth coordinate of this reference point. Positive moving toward the bottomhole from the measured depth datum. This should be given when the reference is "downhole", such as an ocean bottom template, or when the reference point is also used as a vertical well datum. The measured depth value can be used to determine if the reference point and a vertical well datum are at the same point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Location
member.summary: Two dimensional coordinates that locate the point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.ReferencePoint.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the point.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS
member.summary: WITSML - Well Coordinate Reference System Component Schema. Note that this is intended for use with two dimensional coordinates. That does not prevent the use of a three dimensional CRS. It just means that only two coordinates will be specified in that 3D system. The veritcal coordinates are specified separately and, for 3D systems, one of the linked wellDatums should represent the vertical datum of that 3D system so that the height in the 3d system can be determined.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the system. For a geographic system this is commonly the name of the datum.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.Geographic
member.summary: Geographic system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.MapProjection
member.summary: Map projection system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.LocalCRS
member.summary: Local (engineering) system.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellCRS.Description
member.summary: A textual description of the system.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel
member.summary: WITSML - Geodetic Model Component Schema

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.NameCRS
member.summary: The name of the coordinate reference system in a particular naming system. An optional short name (code) can also be specified. Specifying a well known system is highly desired. An example would be to specify a name of 'ED50' with a code of '4230' in the 'EPSG' naming system. Note that specifying a name in the EPSG naming system is asserting that the parameters in the EPSG database are appropriate for this CRS. This is also true for any other naming system. If in doubt, contact your local geodesist.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.GeodeticDatumCode
member.summary: Geodetic datum code. This defines a system in the Geoshare naming system and should probably not be used with CRSName.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.XTranslation
member.summary: Ellipsoid translation (3). Units are meters by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.YTranslation
member.summary: Ellipsoid translation (3). Units are meters by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.ZTranslation
member.summary: Ellipsoid translation (3). Units are meters by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.XRotation
member.summary: Ellipsoid rotation (3). Seconds of arc by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.YRotation
member.summary: Ellipsoid rotation (3). Seconds of arc by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.ZRotation
member.summary: Ellipsoid rotation (3). Seconds of arc by convention.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Ellipsoid scale factor.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.EllipsoidCode
member.summary: Ellipsoid code (spheroid) defining geographic or planar coordinates. Implied if geodeticDatumCode is specified (and is not user defined).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.EllipsoidSemiMajorAxis
member.summary: Ellipsoid semi-major axis size. Implied if geodeticDatumCode or ellipsoidCode specified.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.GeodeticModel.EllipsoidInverseFlattening
member.summary: Ellipsoid inverse flattening value (ie. 1/x). Implied if geodeticDatumCode or ellipsoidCode specified.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS
member.summary: This class represents the cs_localCRS xsd type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.Origin
member.summary: A pointer to the reference point that is the origin of this CRS.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.UsesWellAsOrigin
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that the well surface point is the origin of this CRS. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates otherwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.OriginDescription
member.summary: A textual description of the origin.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.YAxisAzimuth
member.summary: The angle of the Y axis from North (as described in attribute northDirection). Defaults to zero. Positive clockwise.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.YAxisDescription
member.summary: A free-form description of the Y axis. Examples would be 'parallel to the west side of the platform', or 'along the main entry road'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.LocalCRS.XRotationCounterClockwise
member.summary: True ("true" or "1") indicates that the X axis is rotated counter-clockwise from the Y axis when viewed from above the earth looking down. False ("false" or "0") or not given indicates a clockwise rotation. Generally the X axis is rotated clockwise.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx
member.summary: WITSML Element Types

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.NameCRS
member.summary: The name of the coordinate reference system in a particular naming system. An optional short name (code) can also be specified. Specifying a well known system is highly desired. An example would be to specify a name of 'WGS 84 / UTM zone 10N' with a code of '32610' in the 'EPSG' naming system. Note that specifying a name in the EPSG naming system is asserting that the parameters in the EPSG database are appropriate for this CRS. This is also true for any other naming system. If in doubt, contact your local geodesist.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.ProjectionCode
member.summary: A code to identify the type of projection.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.ProjectedFrom
member.summary: A pointer to the wellCRS that represents the geographic system from which this system was projected.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.StdPluggedAndAbandonedrallel1
member.summary: Latitude of first standard parallel.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.StdPluggedAndAbandonedrallel2
member.summary: Latitude of second standard parallel, if used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.CentralMeridian
member.summary: Longitude of the Y axis of the resulting map.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.OriginLatitude
member.summary: Latitude at which the X axis intersects the central meridian.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.OriginLongitude
member.summary: Longitude of the central meridian.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.Latitude1
member.summary: Latitude of the first point if the two-point specification of the central line is used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.Longitude1
member.summary: Longitude of the first point if the two-point specification of the central line is used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.Latitude2
member.summary: Latitude of the second point if the two-point specification of the central line is used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.Longitude2
member.summary: Longitude of the second point if the two-point specification of the central line is used.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.LatitudeForScale
member.summary: Latitude of a point for which the scale factor is specified exactly. Default to origin.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.LongitudeForScale
member.summary: Longitude of a point for which the scale factor is specified exactly. Default to origin.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.TrueScaleLatitude
member.summary: Latitude at which the scale on the map is exact. If none is provided, scale is assumed to be exact at the equator.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.SpheroidRadius
member.summary: Spheroid radius.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Ellipsoid scale factor.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.MethodVariant
member.summary: Projection method variant - establishes minor variations of the projection. Geoshare proposal.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.PerspectiveHeight
member.summary: Height above the surface origin location from which the perspective is taken.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.Zone
member.summary: Zone for the type of projection. Zones have values from 1 to 60 with a required direction of "N" (North) or "S" (South). For example, "21N".

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.NADType
member.summary: North American Datum type.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.FalseEasting
member.summary: Artificial value added to the X axis.

member.summary: Artificial value added to the Y axis.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.Bearing
member.summary: Bearing angle of the great circle with respect to north at the central point.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.Projectionx.Hemisphere
member.summary: Is the projection in the northern hemisphere or the southern hemisphere.

member.summary: Description of item and details.

member.summary: Parameter describing the user-defined projection.

member.summary: True ("true" of "1") indicates that the wellbore has acheieved total depth. That is, drilling has completed. False ("false" or "0") indicates otherwise. Not given indicates that it is not known whether total depth has been reached.

member.summary: The current measured depth of the borehole. If status is plugged, indicates the maximum depth reached before plugging.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Wellbore.TvdCurrent
member.summary: The current true vertical depth of the borehole. If status is plugged, indicates the maximum depth reached before plugging.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.Wellbore.TvdPlanned

member.summary: Information about the XML message instance.

member.summary: A single well log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLogList.Version
member.summary: Data object schema version. The fourth level must match the version of the schema constraints (enumerations and XML loader files) that are assumed by the document instance.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog
member.summary: The non-contextual content of a WITSML Well Log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.NameWell
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well that contains the wellbore.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.NameWellbore
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the wellbore that contains the log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.Name
member.summary: Human recognizable context for the well log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.ObjectGrowing
member.summary: Whether or not the wellLog is growing. True ("true" or "1") indicates the that the wellLog is still growing in size (that is, logData values are still being added). For example, it may be connected to a realtime stream. False ("false" or "0") indicates that the wellLog is closed (that is, no further logData values will be added). Not given indicates that the status of the wellLog is not known. This value is only relevant within the context of a server.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.ServiceCompany
member.summary: Name of contractor who provided the service.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.RunNumber
member.summary: Log run number. This should normally be a number; however some legacy systems encode other information in this value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.BhaRunNumber
member.summary: The bottom hole assembly run number associated with this log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.CreationDate
member.summary: Date and time that the log was created.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.Description
member.summary: Description of item and details.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.IndexType
member.summary: Primary index type. If the log is comprised of both DEPTH- and TIME-indexed passes, the primary index type of the log should be DEPTH.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.MinIndex
member.summary: A bounding primary index value for the data records of the log. The minimum indexType value for all data records of the log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.MaxIndex
member.summary: A bounding primary index value for the data records of the log. The maximum indexType value for all data records of the log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.MinDateTimeIndex
member.summary: A bounding (date time) index value for the data records of the log. The minimum date time index value for all data records of the log. If an index is elapsed time and a start date time is specified then the corresponding date time should be calculated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.MaxDateTimeIndex
member.summary: A bounding (date time) index value for the data records of the log. The maximum date time index value for all data records of the log. If an index is elapsed time and a start date time is specified then the corresponding date time should be calculated.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.NullValue
member.summary: An empty string is the default representation of a null value for a curve (i.e. when the null value representation is not explicitly defined). If a null value representation is defined for a log, this becomes the default for all curves in that log (but can be overridden at the block and curve level). An empty string is always a valid null value representation in the comma delimited list. An empty string is not a valid null value representation within a space delimited or base64 encoded array. Specifying a null value also makes it easier to transform data back to a legacy format without having to scan the data to insure that the null pattern does not exist in the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.LogPluggedAndAbandonedram
member.summary: Log parameters that apply to the overall log.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.LogCurveInfo
member.summary: Information about a curve mnemonic. This defines curve information whose data can be recorded into many blocks.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.BlockInfo
member.summary: The description of a data block.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.LogData
member.summary: Container for one or more blocks of well log data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.CommonData
member.summary: A container element that contains elements that are common to all data objects.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.CustomData
member.summary: A container element that can contain custom or user defined data elements.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.UidWell
member.summary: Unique identifier for the well. This uniquely represents the well referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWell.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.WellLog.UidWellbore
member.summary: Unique identifier for the wellbore. This uniquely represents the wellbore referenced by the (possibly non-unique) nameWellbore.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo
member.summary: WITSML Well Log - Curve Information

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.Minemonic
member.summary: The curve name. More than one curve can have the same mnemonic but something like the array definition should be different between them.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.ClassWitsml
member.summary: The curve classification obtained from a lookup in the vendors mnemonic catalog.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.Unit
member.summary: Unit of measurement for the data values.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.MinemAlias
member.summary: Name alias for this trace.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.NullValue
member.summary: An empty string is the default representation of a null value for a curve (i.e., when the null value representation is not explicitly defined). If a null value is defined in the logCurveInfo, it overrides any null value specified at the logHeader level. An empty string is always a valid null value representation in the comma delimited list. An empty string is not a valid null value representation within a space delimited or base64 encoded array. Specifying a null value also makes it easier to transform data back to a legacy format without having to scan the data to insure that the null pattern does not exist in the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.AlternateIndex
member.summary: True (true or 1) if this curve is a candidate to be a primary index. False (false or 0) or not given, indicates otherwise. An index curve should monotonically change when sorted on its own values (i.e., no duplicates).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.WellDatum
member.summary: A pointer to the wellDatum that represents the values of this trace. This is only relevant for measured depths, vertical depths or elevations.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.CurveDescription
member.summary: Description of the curve.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.SensorOffset
member.summary: Offset of sensor from a downhole equipment vertical reference (the drill bit, for MWD logs; the tool zero reference for wireline logs). This element is only informative (log values are presented at actual depth, not requiring subtraction of an offset).

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.DataSource
member.summary: Data source, could be tool name/id.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.DensData
member.summary: Data density of sample in samples per length unit.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.TraceState
member.summary: State of trace data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.TraceOrigin
member.summary: Origin of trace data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.EncodingDef
member.summary: Indicates that the channel is encoded using a Base64 representation of binary values, and defines the binary type of elements of the array. If absent and axisDefinition is given, implies space delimited values, whose elemental data type is given by typeLogData.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.TypeLogData
member.summary: Curve data type. For simple (non-array) traces, the data type of the curve data. For array curves (except Base64-encoded array curves), the data type of curve array element. For Base64-encoded arrays, the element data type is defined by encodingDef. If neither typeLogData nor encodingDef are given then 'Double' is assumed.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.AxisDefinition
member.summary: Indicates that the curve is an array curve (i.e., multi-valued samples), and provides meta data by which an axis of the array can be understood. A separate definition is required for each axis of an N-dimensional array.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.WellLogCurveInfo.Uid
member.summary: Unique identifier for the curve. This value must be unique within the context of the wellLog. This value will be referenced by block curve descriptors.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo
member.summary: Describes a well log data block.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.DataRowCount
member.summary: The number of data rows in the persistent block. If a value is specified for this element in a query then the server will limit the number of data rows in the result but the return value will still be the number of data rows in the persistent block.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.PluggedAndAbandonedss
member.summary: Identifies the pass within the run.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.Description
member.summary: A description of the block. For example, 'main log section', 'repeat section', 'logged going in hole' 'main log section, curve group 1', 'composite'.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.IndexType
member.summary: Primary index type. The index may be a quantity type or it may be a dateTime type. At least one of the index sets must be given. If both are given then "indexType" and "indexCurve" must represent an elapsed time from "startDateTimeIndex". The start and end indexes are server query parameters and will be populated with valid values in a GetFromStore result.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.StartIndex
member.summary: When the direction is defined as "Increasing", the startIndex is the starting (minimum) index value at which the first data point is located. When the log header defines the direction as "Decreasing", the startIndex is the starting (maximum) index value at which the first data point is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.EndIndex
member.summary: When the direction is defined as "Increasing", the endIndex is the ending (maximum) index value at which the last data point is located. When the log header defines the direction as Decreasing, the endIndex is the ending (minimum) index value at which the last data point is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.StepIncrement
member.summary: The sampling increment. Set to zero for unequal sampling. For curves that are originally sampled at a constant increment, this value should be retained because calculated values may have cumulative errors.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.StartDateTimeIndex
member.summary: When the direction is defined as "Increasing", the startIndex is the starting (minimum) index value at which the first data point is located. When the log header defines the direction as "Decreasing", the startIndex is the starting (maximum) index value at which the first data point is located.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.EndDateTimeIndex
member.summary: When the direction is defined as "Increasing", the endIndex is the ending (maximum) index value at which the last data point is located. When the log header defines the direction as Decreasing, the endIndex is the ending (minimum) index value at which the last data point is located. This value is optional when startDateTimeIndex represents a reference for elapsed times. Otherwise, it should be defined when startDateTimeIndex is defined.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.Direction
member.summary: The polarity of change in index values associated with successive data records. Increasing or Decreasing. Mixed is not a valid value.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.IndexCurve
member.summary: The mnemonic of the index curve plus the column index. A column index of zero indicates an implied trace whose values start at startIndex and increment by stepIncrement for each row.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.NullValue
member.summary: An empty string is the default representation of a null value for a curve (i.e. when the null value representation is not explicitly defined). If a null value representation is defined for a log, this becomes the default for all curves in that log (but can be overridden at the block or curve level). An empty string is always a valid null value representation in the comma delimited list. An empty string is not a valid null value representation within a space delimited or base64 encoded array. Specifying a null value also makes it easier to transform data back to a legacy format without having to scan the data to insure that the null pattern does not exist in the data.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.LogPluggedAndAbandonedram
member.summary: Log parameters that apply to this block.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.BlockCurveInfo
member.summary: A curve occurring in data records defined by this block, and its position within the data record. Each curve in the block must have a different mnemonic.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockInfo.Uid
member.summary: Unique identifier for the block. This value must be unique within the context of the wellLog. This value will be pointed to by data levels that are associated with this block.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockCurveInfo
member.summary: Descriptor of a curve associated with a block. This captures the representational aspects of the curve. The data semantics is defined by logCurveInfo.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockCurveInfo.CurveId
member.summary: A pointer to the curveInfo's curveId that this curve represents.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockCurveInfo.ColumnIndex
member.summary: A 1-based index of curve data in the data records. A value of zero indicates an implied curve with no values in the data record.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockCurveInfo.MinIndex
member.summary: The minimum index value at which the first valid data point is located. This value will be properly set by the server to reflect data in the returned document.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockCurveInfo.MaxIndex
member.summary: The maximum index value at which the last valid data point is located. This value will be properly set by the server to reflect data in the returned document.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockCurveInfo.MinDateTimeIndex
member.summary: The minimum index value at which the first valid data point is located. This value will be properly set by the server to reflect data in the returned document.

member.name: P:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ComponentSchemas.BlockCurveInfo.MaxDateTimeIndex
member.summary: The maximum index value at which the last valid data point is located. This value will be properly set by the server to reflect data in the returned document.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType
member.summary: This class represents the TubularComponent xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.stabilizer
member.summary: Drill string component with blades that help keep the drill string away from the sides of the hole.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.accelerator
member.summary: A downhole tool used in conjunction with a jar that stores energy for rapid release when the jar is fired. Depending on the operating mode, the energy in tension or compression is stored by means of a mechanical spring or compressible fluid such as nitrogen gas.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.bullnose
member.summary: A blank end component substituting for a bit, when re entering an already existing hole to guide the BHA, to avoid inadvertent sidetracks, such as when run below a hole opener in an existing hole.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.casing
member.summary: Tubing used to line the wellbore and protect against pressure differences between the wellbore fluids and the formation.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.jar
member.summary: Hydraulic or spring-loaded component used to free stuck pipe.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.kelly
member.summary: Hexagonal or square pipe used to rotate the drill string from the rig floor.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.liner
member.summary: Casing or tubing that is hung from the inside of existing casing rather than from the sea bed or surface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.magnet
member.summary: Magnet used to retrieve magnetic debris from the hole.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.motor
member.summary: Downhole tool, usually powered by fluid flow, that rotates the drill bit.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.overshot
member.summary: Tool used for retrieving pipe that has been lost in the hole.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.packer
member.summary: Component that can be inflated so that it seals off a section of the wellbore, typically for formation testing.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.scratchers
member.summary: A device for cleaning mud and mud filter cake off of the wellbore wall when cementing casing in the hole to ensure good contact and bonding between the cement and the wellbore wall.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.spear
member.summary: Fishing tool that attaches to the inside of the stuck pipe by threads or grapples.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.thruster
member.summary: Drilling tool used to maintain weight on bit.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.tubing
member.summary: Small diameter pipe that is run inside casing or tubing as part of the well completion.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.turbine
member.summary: Downhole device used for directional drilling, powered by mud circulation that rotates the drill bit while the drill string remains non-rotating

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.whipstock
member.summary: Wedge shaped tool used to drill off in a different direction.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.reamer
member.summary: Tool used to enlarge the hole.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.TubularComponentType.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.summary: A particular extent of space or surface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.attenuation
member.summary: The amount of reduction in the amplitude of a wave.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.auxiliary
member.summary: A general classification for measurements which are very specialized and not normally accessed by petrophysicists.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.azimuth
member.summary: In the horizontal plane, it is the clockwise angle of departure from magnetic north (while looking down hole).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.blocked
member.summary: A well log trace which has been edited to reflect sharp bed boundaries. The trace has a square wave appearance.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.caliper
member.summary: A well log used to record hole diameter (open or cased).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.conductivity
member.summary: The property of a medium (solid or fluid) which allows the medium to conduct a form of energy; e.g., electrical conductivity or thermal conductivity.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.corrected
member.summary: A trace which has had corrections applied; e.g. environmental corrections.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.density
member.summary: Mass per unit Volume - well logging units are usually gm/cc.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.depth
member.summary: The distance to a point in a wellbore.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.deviation
member.summary: Departure of a borehole from vertical. Also, the angle measured between the tool axis and vertical.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.dielectric
member.summary: Relative permittivity.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.dip
member.summary: The angle that a structural surface, e.g. a bedding or fault plane, makes with the horizontal, measured perpendicular to the strike of the structure.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.dipmeter
member.summary: Any of a number of measurements produced by a tool designed to measure formation dip and borehole characteristics through direct and indirect measurements.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.edited
member.summary: A well log trace which has been corrected or adjusted through an editing process.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.element
member.summary: The elemental composition, generally in weight percent, of a formation as calculated from information obtained from a geochemical logging pass; e.g., weight percent of Al, Si, Ca, Fe, etc.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.enhanced
member.summary: A well log trace which has been filtered to improve its value; e.g. inverse filtering for better resolution.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.filtered
member.summary: A well log trace which has had a filter applied to it.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.flowmeter
member.summary: A logging tool to measure the rate and/or direction of fluid flow in a wellbore.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.force
member.summary: Energy exerted or brought to bear.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.gradiomanometer
member.summary: The measurement of the average density of fluids in a wellbore.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.image
member.summary: The likeness of an object produced by an electrical device.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.joined
member.summary: A well log trace which has had two or more runs spliced together to make a single trace.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.length
member.summary: A measured distance or dimension.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.mineral
member.summary: The mineral composition, generally in weight percent, of a formation as calculated from elemental information obtained from a geochemical logging pass; e.g., weight percent of dolomite, calcite, illite, quartzite, etc.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.perforating
member.summary: The procedure for introducing holes through casing into a formation so that formation fluids can enter into the casing.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.permeability
member.summary: The permeability of the surrounding formation.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.porosity
member.summary: The total pore volume occupied by fluid in a rock. Includes isolated nonconnecting pores and volume occupied by absorbed, immobile fluid.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.potassium
member.summary: The measurement of gamma radiation emitted by potassium.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.pressure
member.summary: The force or thrust exerted upon a surface divided by the area of the surface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.processed
member.summary: A well log trace which has been processed in some way; e.g., depth adjusted or environmentally corrected.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.quality
member.summary: Degree of excellence.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.ratio
member.summary: A relationship between two values usually expressed as a fraction.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.raw
member.summary: A well log trace which has not had any processing. In other words, a trace which has not been depth adjusted or environmentally corrected.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.resistivity
member.summary: The property measuring the resistance to flow of an electrical current.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.salinity
member.summary: The concentration of ions in solution.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.sampling
member.summary: To take a sample of or from something.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.saturation
member.summary: The fraction or percentage of the pore volume of a rock.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.shifted
member.summary: A well log trace which has had its original values shifted by some factor; e.g., added or multiplied by a constant.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.sigma
member.summary: The macroscopic capture cross section, i.e. the effective cross-sectional area per unit volume for the capture of neutrons.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.smoothed
member.summary: A well log trace which has been filtered to smooth, or average the trace.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.temperature
member.summary: A temperature measurement.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.tension
member.summary: The tension on the wireline cable while logging.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.thorium
member.summary: The measurement of gamma radiation emitted by thorium.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.time
member.summary: A measured or measurable period.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.uranium
member.summary: The measurement of gamma radiation emitted by uranium.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.velocity
member.summary: directional speed

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.volume
member.summary: cubic capacity

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.MeasurementType.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.summary: This class represents the BearingType xsd enumeration.

member.summary: This class represents the BladeType xsd enumeration.

member.summary: This class represents the HoleOpenerType xsd enumeration.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.DeflectionMethod
member.summary: This class represents the DeflectionMethod xsd enumeration.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus
member.summary: This class represents the WellStatus xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.abandoned
member.summary: The status of a facility in which drilling, completion, and production operations have been permanently terminated.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.active
member.summary: For a well to be active, at least one of its wellbores must be active. For a wellbore to be active, at least one of its completions must be actively producing or injecting fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.completed
member.summary: The completion has been installed, but the facility is not yet active. This status is appropriate only before the initial producing or injecting activity.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.drilling
member.summary: The status of a well or wellbore in which drilling operations have begun, but are not yet completed. The status ends when another status becomes appropriate.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.permitted
member.summary: The facility has received regulatory approvel, but drilling has not yet commenced. For a well, it has been spudded. For a subsequent wellbore, the whipstock or similar device has not yet been set.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.proposed
member.summary: The status of a well or wellbore from conception to either regulatory approval or commencement of drilling.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.sold
member.summary: The facility has been sold, so it is no longer appropriate to keep a close internal status value. Status values may be added at later times without changing the sold status.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.suspended
member.summary: Production or injection has been temporarily suspended in a manner that will allow immediate resumption of activities.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.testing
member.summary: The facility operations are suspended while tests are being conducted to determine formation and/or reservoir properties. For example, a drillstem test. This status also includes extended testing.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.tight
member.summary: Information about the status of the well is confidential. This is more explicit than unknown, since it gives the reason that the status value is unknown.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellStatus.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellPurpose
member.summary: This class represents the WellPurpose xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellPurpose.appraisal
member.summary: A well drilled into a formation shown to be potentially productive of oil or gas by an earlier well for the purpose of obtaining more information about the reservoir. Also known as a delineation well.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellPurpose.exploration
member.summary: An exploratory well drilled in an unproved area to test for a new field, a new pay, a deeper reservoir, or a shallower reservoir. Also known as a wildcat.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellPurpose.development
member.summary: A well drilled in a zone in an area already proved productive.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellPurpose.mineral
member.summary: A non-oil and gas E and P well drilled for the purpose of locating and/or extracting a mineral from the subsurface, usually through the injection and/or extraction of mineral-bearing fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellPurpose.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid
member.summary: This class represents the WellFluid xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid.air
member.summary: This is generally an injected fluid.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid.condensate
member.summary: Liquid hydrocarbons produced with natural gas that are separated from the gas by cooling and various other means. Condensate generally has an API gravity of 50 degrees to 120 degrees and is water white, straw, or bluish in color. It is the liquid recovery from a well classified as a gas well. It is generally dissolved in the gaseous state under reservoir conditions but separates as a liquid either in passing up the hole or at the surface. These hydrocarbons, from associated and nonassociated gas well gas, normally are recovered from lease separators or field facilities by mechanical separation.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid.dry
member.summary: The well facility is classified as a dry well. It has not been, nor will it be used to produce or inject any fluids.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid.gas
member.summary: The well is classified as a gas well, producing or injecting a hydrocarbon gas. The gas is generally methane, but may have a mixture of other gases also.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid.oil
member.summary: The liquid hydrocarbon, generally referred to as crude oil.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid.steam
member.summary: The gaseous state of water. This is generally an injected fluid, but it is possible that some hydrothermal wells produce steam.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid.water
member.summary: The well is classified as a water well without distinguishing between brine or fresh water.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellFluid.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellDirection
member.summary: This class represents the WellDirection xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellDirection.injector
member.summary: The well facility is injecting fluids into the subsurface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellDirection.producer
member.summary: The well facility is producing fluids from the subsurface.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellDirection.uncertain
member.summary: The flow direction of the fluids is variable, but not on a regular basis as is the case with the huff-n-puff flow.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellDirection.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum
member.summary: This class represents the ElevCodeEnum xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.CF
member.summary: casing flange: A flange affixed to the top of the casing string used to attach production equipment.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.CV
member.summary: crown valve

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.DF
member.summary: derrick floor

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.GL
member.summary: ground level

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.KB
member.summary: kelly bushing

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.RB
member.summary: rotary bushing

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.RT
member.summary: rotary table

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.SF
member.summary: sea floor

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.LAT
member.summary: Lowest Astronomical Tide. The lowest tide level over the duration of the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.SL
member.summary: Mean Sea Level - A tidal datum. The arithmetic mean of hourly heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MHHW
member.summary: Mean Higher High Water - A tidal datum. The average of the higher high water height of each tidal day observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MHW
member.summary: Mean High Water - A tidal datum. The average of all the high water heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MLLW
member.summary: Mean Lower Low Water - A tidal datum. The average of the lower low water height of each tidal day observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years ).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MLW
member.summary: Mean Low Water - A tidal datum. The average of all the low water heights observed over the National Tidal Datum Epoch (19 years).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.MTL
member.summary: Mean Tide Level - A tidal datum. The arithmetic mean of mean high water and mean low water. Same as half-tide level.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.KO
member.summary: kickoff point

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.ElevCodeEnum.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreType
member.summary: This class represents the WellboreType xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreType.bypass
member.summary: The original wellbore had to be abandoned before its final usage. This wellbore is being drilled as a different wellbore, but one which has the same target as the one that was abandoned.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreType.initial
member.summary: This is the first wellbore that has been drilled, or attempted, in a given well.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreType.redrill
member.summary: The wellbore is being redrilled.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreType.reentry
member.summary: The wellbore is being reentered after a period of abandonment.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreType.respud
member.summary: The wellbore is part of an existing regulatory well. The original borehole did not reach the target depth. This borehole required the well to be respudded (drilled from a different surface position).

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreType.sidetrack
member.summary: The wellbore is a deviation from a given wellbore, that produces a different borehole from the others, and whose bottomhole differs from any previously extisting wellbore bottomholes.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreType.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

member.name: T:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreShape
member.summary: This class represents the WellboreShape xsd enumeration.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreShape.deviated
member.summary: A wellbore that significantly departs from vertical with respect to the surface location.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreShape.horizontal
member.summary: A wellbore whose path deviates from the vertical by at least 75 degrees.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreShape.vertical
member.summary: A wellbore that is nearly vertical with respect to the surface location.

member.name: F:Energistics.DataAccess.WITSML131.ReferenceData.WellboreShape.unknown
member.summary: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.
